Reviews.Title: “Comfort on Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: MarkPLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: Two nights in Grand Hyatt. Excellent, large room overlooking the garden. Made use of the relaxing pool and some time in the spa. Very comfortable, large room. Excellent location near Orchard Road shops, banks, MTR etc. 15 min run to Botanic Gardens each morning (recommended). Delicious buffet breakfast with lots of choice. Friendly, efficient staff. i would definitely stay again for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great room, Great food,Great stay”
Reviews.Author: RovingRajan
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this hotel, 2 years after our first. Happy to report that everything is just as good as before. We booked 2 club suites and one of our rooms was upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite which was fantastic so my wife and I could share some quiet time. Strait's kitchen and Pete's place were fantastic as before. Try and make a reservation as these are some of the most popular eating venues in Singapore Overall, friendly cheerful staff and quietly luxurious surroundings. Will definitely be visiting here again

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: skyflyer1
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed at this hotel for 1 week. It was fab. The moment the cab got to the hotel, someone came to get the luggage and another person showed me all the way to the front desk. Check in was swift. There was lots of lifts, not needing to wait for long at all times. I had a Grand deluxe room in the front tower. It has separate sitting/lounge area and bedroom area separated by a sliding door. There's flat screen TV in each room. The bed was really comfy. The electronic safe was in the drawer and it is big - large enough to even hold my 15" laptop and etc. My room has a view over the garden and the pool. The bathroom was great. It has a ceiling rain forest shower. The room temp was easily controlled by the thermostat - one for each room. I did use the gym. It was located at the back of the hotel - only about 5mins walk by the garden/waterfall area. It was reasonably well equipped with usual weights and cardio machines except there's no rowing machine. They have one water rowing machine which felt different from the usual rowing machine. I didn't use the pool. They also have a sauna/steam room and jacuzzi in the changing room. The breakfast buffet was great with a choice of indian, malay, nasi lemak. chinese congee/noodles and condiments. dim sum. etc. western cold and hot including egg station and freshly squeezed fruit juices. I will definitely come back when I am next in singapore.

Reviews.Title: “in the middle of amazing shopping”
Reviews.Author: IsabellePhuket
Reviews.Content: Just located in the middle of all the shopping that you can find in Singapour, MRT can u also bring everywhere, staff very friendly, pool also after a long day shopping it's just a perfect hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and reliable upscale business hotel in city centre”
Reviews.Author: roltraveler
Reviews.Content: I was staying here 10+ times over the years. Like all Grand Hyatts in Asia, it is a professional upscale business hotel. Centrally located just 2 minutes from Orchard among busy streets, it has a large area of tranquility around the pool. Try to get a room in the back building with pool or garden view if you like it more quiet. Those rooms are more modern and nicer in terms of design. However, the rooms in the front block are all suites incl. separate bed- and living room for almost the same price. They are a bit older, but bigger. With Mezzanine and The Straits Kitchen the hotel has excellent restaurants for all tastes. The Champagne brunch at Mezzanine on Sunday is a must! If you want to try more, just cross the street where you find Les Amis and other great chinese restaurants. The bars are good too (Mezzanine and the pool bar) where the Fresh Berry Mojito is a must try at the pool bar. All in all, a very good hotel right in the city centre with high quality standards in all aspects.

Reviews.Title: “Great property, restaurant, and service.”
Reviews.Author: Jertzy99
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived at the GHS at about 2 a.m. after our long journey from the U.S., we were surprised by the amount of activity at the hotel: lots of young and beautiful people dressed up for the nightclub attached to the property. Inside, though, is very calm and tranquil. The staff are friendly, courteous, and attentive, including the concierge desk, which offered us several good recommendations on restaurants and activities. As other reviewers have noted, the rooms are surprisingly spacious, with well-designed bathrooms. We enjoyed little perks like the free shoe shine service the hotel provides. The location of the hotel really can't be beat -- near Orchard Road and the MRT. The main floor restaurant has an excellent evening buffet showcasing food from the Malay, Chinese, and Indian cultural influences in Singapore. Great property.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, nice rooms and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: clairelybelgian
Reviews.Content: Stayed on business but nice to be close to Orchard road shopping and the MRT. The rooms are very clean and feel spacious. The reception area has the most shiny floors I have ever seen and I like the tropical waterfall area by the lifts. The bathrooms are quite well designed, with access to the wardrobe and a vanity area with mirror and hairdryer. Traveling from the UK means you won't have to take a plug converter for a change! I had an iron and ironing board in my Club level room but others staying in the Club floor in the other wing didn't. Usual tea and coffee making equipment in the room, took me a while to find the in room safe! Considering the amount of rooms on each floor, the hotel is very quiet. Breakfast on the Club floor was was good, excellent coffees and never seemed too full. The cooked options changed daily, fairly good spread of lighter continental options. Evening beers, wines and snacks were also available. The pool area is very nice with palm trees and poolside cafe/bar area. The sunloungers were comfy and had in built switches to call staff to order drinks- a bit like the plane! Lots of shady spots to be had as well as loungers in the shallow area of the pool itself. The staff are very, very helpful and super polite. Such a shock to return to the UK! The Italian/Pizza place under reception is a great informal place for a pizza and, for Singapore, a relatively cheap place for a glass of wine and the set meal was good value for money for 3 courses as the salad bar was much appreciated and the pizza was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Kitkat071
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the grand Hyatt in march. We were upgraded to a two story apartment with our own breakfast area. There were many complimentary food and drink products and our came with a small kitchen. The king size bed was very big!

Reviews.Title: “1 bed suite”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel, it's one of my favourites, maybe my favourite in Singapore and I've stayed here on a few occassions now. Great location, good facilities, helpful staff, spacious suites, clean tidy and well organised. The restuarants and bars are all good, and the food is always good quality. It's can be a little bit pricey but it's a real 5 star hotel compared to some of the hotel chains which 'masquerade' as 5 star. It's always a hassle free pleasure to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but a bit worn...”
Reviews.Author: SSS2005
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect... very central (right off Orchard Road). However the rooms are a bit worn. Was only there for one night so the location was key.

Reviews.Title: “so much to like but wood floors in room are a major drawback”
Reviews.Author: jg56
Reviews.Content: Can't beat location near MRT and Orchard Road. Service very good and the evening cocktails/hors doevres in the exec lounge are quite comprehensive. Major issue I had is the wood flooring in guest rooms. I herd my neighbor above me every time they moved a desk chair or dragged a suitcase (at 5 am!). There must be a reason why most hotels have wall to wall carpeting and now I know why. I would not stay there again until this was remedied.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in center of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Yasmina R
Reviews.Content: It is my third visit to Singapore and stay in this hotel which is really good the people working there are really nice and helpful The rooms are good and clean Anything you need you can count on the Concierge service location is great, center of the city with all shops around The restaurants located in the Hotel are ones of the best in the city, I would recommend the Mezza9, they have good chocolate also (being Swiss I love chocolates) I would recommend anyone to go to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Standars at its' Best”
Reviews.Author: fedrickMendos
Reviews.Content: Clean & Comfortable rooms, polite service and the location is very convenient right middle of Orchard shopping paradise. Tangs was packed, thus we walked over to Ion and had a peaceful shopping time.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel...very good location...”
Reviews.Author: sanv
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt Singapore is a very comfortable hotel with great service. The lobby area is probably not as grand as other hotels tend to be but everything else is perfect. The best part is the location though which is just off Orchard Road. All the shopping is walking distance. Also the MRT is round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jlabrie
Reviews.Content: It's hard to go wrong with a Grand Hyatt. It was a better value than the Marriott, and it is very nice as well. Very good breakfast, and very good dinner as well.

Reviews.Title: “BEST LOCATION! Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: ninidada
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotel in Singapore along Orchard road. MRT which 5 mins away which link to all major shopping centre. Nice room with 42' TV and DVD player. Shopping Paradise which idea doe shopper.

Reviews.Title: “Truly, Never Fails!”
Reviews.Author: Softlanding
Reviews.Content: This is by far my preferred address in Singapore. I have in and out of this hotel since the mid 80's and the management have really moved with the times. Yes, there are newer hotels, fancier hotels and all that (not to mention the Sands mega-complex) but this one has all the right attributes for me. In part it is location, in part it is the nice ambience of the rooms (and I have been in both wings) but most of all it is the flawless and personal service at every touch point. Really should be upgraded to a Park Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Singapore Jewel”
Reviews.Author: Kapaluacat29220
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for the second time in a year. Service incredible. Ferdaus in Grand Club Room very special. Food in Mezza9 Restaurant just as good as last year! Location on Scotts Road off Orchard is close enough to the action, yet far enough for a peaceful environment.

Reviews.Title: “Only a REGENCY and not GRAND”
Reviews.Author: hasonteh1
Reviews.Content: Everything i saw in this hotel is the same with HYATT REGENCY CASINO MANILA. And the price difference is huge. Also this Hyatt Property is kind a old already, Service is still great. This hotel is very busy hence there is no chance encouter their service to be personalized unlike in hyatt properties i had stayed with,

Reviews.Title: “hope you return my deposit”
Reviews.Author: noviDenpasar
Reviews.Content: service on grand hyatt singapore is very good and friendly but when we checked in, we were asked to make a deposit using an ATM card,by Receptionist... Upon check in I asked the receptionist about our complimentary. and I get complimentary breakfast. I do not have any transactions at your hotel. After we checked out, we just handed a room key. I arrived in Bali, I was checking my ATM, my savings were reduced and there is no deposit refund when I leave your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for business and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: adrian_goodwin
Reviews.Content: Allocated a club class room. Very large comfortable room with good air conditioning.(essential in Singapore) Check in was quick and courtious which was welaomed after a long haul flight. Bars and restaurnts are very good. Laundry service while expensive was very quick. Good location for shopping in Orchard Road. Would be happy to stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: hrueschen
Reviews.Content: When you arrive at Grand Hyatt Singapore it's a relief to come to a quite place in such a vibrant city. The receptionist was very efficient and I got upgraded to a club room by adding breakfast and WIFI to my pre-booked room rate. The room itself was very spacious on the top floor with separate living / bed rooms. Remarkable about this hotel was the complete invisibility of any room service personnel, but still the rooms where made up perfectly. I can also recommend spending some time at the pool, which is surrounded by a tropical garden with waterfalls etc.. Also try the various restaurants at the hotel. They all offer great food. I had a very late departure and although I could only extend my checkout until 2 p.m. the hotel issued me a key card to let me continue using their facilities (club lounge, spa, pool) until my departure late at night. Great service and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: letbe
Reviews.Content: Everything was just about perfect. From the pick up from the airport to return to the airport by hotel limo. Excellent location, close to all major shopping. Sleek, modern room. Hotel staff was really GREAT! from Manager Ery to house keeping. Highly recommended! I have stayed at many Singapore Hotels and the Hyatt ranks among the best. Hard to stay anywhere else..........

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and comfort in a great location”
Reviews.Author: AssimilatedCajun
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt is easily the most elegant of the hotels in the Orchard Road area. The spacious lobby, the luxurious and comfortable rooms, the large pool surrounded by tropical gardens, the excellent gym, the great restaurants serving a thoughtful variety of regional and international cuisine, and the abundant food and beverages in the executive lounge are all world-class. And the Hyatt is an easy taxi ride to the airport and everywhere else in Singapore, steps from the entrance to the Orchard MRT station, and a short walk to all the shopping and eating that Orchard road has to offer. I have only one small complaint: all the restaurants and even the main bar/lounge ("10 Scotts") stop serving food at 11 pm, and the lounge closes at 11:30. I was told that something called the "Martini Bar" serves drinks but not food until 2 a.m., and there's also a noisy basement bar called BRIX whose customers all seem to be Western men of a certain age and much younger Asian women. Neither of these places would have been right for the late-night snack and glass of wine I sometimes like to have while checking/writing email. Many other hotels of comparable quality in the region have a reasonably quiet and dignified lounge area where you can get a snack as well as a drink until 1 a.m. or so, and many have coffee shops that are open until late or even 24 hours. But the only real reason I don't stay at the Hyatt more often is that, like other good hotels in Singapore, it's terribly expensive. Only the very rich and those who are lucky enough to work for very generous employers can afford the standard rates. If you are one of these people, or if you qualify for a corporate or government rate (still moderately expensive but somewhat less than the standard rates) or have a free night award from Hyatt, this is the place to stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel but somethings could be better”
Reviews.Author: livinasia04
Reviews.Content: as someone who has stayed with hyatt off and on, I can say honestly say the hotel has pros and cons and while the stay was acceptable i don't feel as their club member it was on the mark with its brand pros - location, really good food at there main restaurant, service was fantastic, nothing to small to handle and helpful. Room is average size on par with the hotel industry in singapore. breakfast was pretty good to. wifi was good as well. my highlight though was the spa, they have 4 hand massage and there therapists were really good in terms of service, taking care, making sure i was comfortable and there massage techniques were really good. so much so i feel asleep 2 times during the massage cons - for the bed, being a tall person and needing to have a good nights sleep would have been nice if the bed hadn't been so small or a bit hard. TV had a issue where you turned on one tv in the living room and the tv in the bedroom turned on as well, cable signal was not to good. breakfast at the executive level is very limited and only has asian food, thats why I choose to eat on the bottom floor, where the breakfast has western food. overall besides the breakfast and the bed was a descent stay, would I return to this hyatt hotel not likely, another hyatt hotel maybe, overall I just feel for the high price I paid just wasn't worth it though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: acr1960
Reviews.Content: A good hotel but looking a little dated for Singapore. I've stayed here many times and the staff make it - particularly in the Grand Club.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveler w
Reviews.Content: I stayed at grand hyatt singapore almost everytime i am in sg, i tried other hotels such as st regis, four seasons, ritz carlton, fullerton, etc but there's something about this hotel that kept me coming back. First of all the genuinely friendly staff that always greet me with a big smile. After staying there in 2 different occasion they already remember my name and bump me up into a suite! No joke, i am paying for the deluxe room for 5 days and they bump me up into a a junior suite for 5 days. Never have any problem with late checkout request, Very helpful staff! Great breakfast selections! Fantastic Gym and Spa with 2 pools. Location is also very convenient right in the heart of orchard road not too far from ION mall. This hotel is just home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “best stay”
Reviews.Author: rickypasir
Reviews.Content: wow we had such a wonderful time. service was excellent total value for your money

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, one of the best restaurant ever been, excellent location & perfect service”
Reviews.Author: Elyes B
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Grand Haytt Singapore for 3 nights end of last week. Excellent stay by all means & all standards! Absolutely nothing to complain about! Just want to mention 3xthings that really amazed me during my stay: 1/ Mezzanine Restaurant is simply EXCELLENT…Never tasted such very fresh sea food, it just melts in your mouth! it was sooooo DELICIOUS! Service was quick and top-notch! A MUST TRY! 2/ Concierge: a special thanks to all of the staff but especially Gwen …What a great associate and hotel should be proud to have such professional & dedicated employee Asked for info about a theme park in my last day in SG, she ended up arranging everything for me in few minutes …You would say it's normal, it's her job??? Ok this is the thing: I've almost checked out from the hotel by then and my CC didn’t work over the phone for some security reasons, she immediately offered to pay with her personal CC so I could get my ticket & express pass quickly !!!!!!! That was astonishing & above all expectations!! (And trust me don't think that even the Ritz concierge won't do that!!!) Really astonishing!! 3/ Housekeeping: they are like ghosts! Yes like ghosts! So discret and so efficient! First day my room was a huge mess (broke a glass, towels everywhere, cigarettes, mini-bar, room service, etc)! Went out but returned back to my room after like 15minutes ...Surprise:.It was impeccably clean & neat! Really amazing!!!! In just 15mintues! Me? I would have spent the entire day cleaning! So hat's off to the 6th floor team !! The rest is just great i.e. Pool & Gym (No comments + Service EXCELLENT!), Check-in (very smooth, quick and very professional (less than 3minutes!)), Room (spacious, opulently furnished, loved the office corner with view over the pool (#692), the closet is communicating with the toilette (very handy!), Location (perfect within few meters from ION shopping mall, Orchard Station, lots of restaurants, coffee shops, pubs), Pub in the basement (Brix, very nice, great music & live band, classy & clean. Service is again PERFECT!) Note:Need to pay for internet connection ...But it's fine and remain reasonable (25SGD/24hours) In few words: JUST EXCELLENT! If you can afford the price (Average: 500SGD/night for normal room), then I would recommend it without the slightest hesitation to everyone: business travelers, solo travelers, honeymooners, group of friends/colleagues, seniors, etc. Definitely coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Very welcomed hotel”
Reviews.Author: dream1980
Reviews.Content: It is a very good hotel . The staff was waiting for us with warm welcome . For our comfort , they made us make a check in in our fantastic room . The gave us a gift of cookies as our anneversary present . The location is perfect .

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: Nesh-MY
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days and had great experience in terms of hotel's service, its location, food (halal restaurant) and room amenities. Our room was very comfortable and clean, daily breakfasts served in the room were great! Located within walking distance to the famous Orchard road and next to Far East Plaza, makes Grand Hyatt Singapore an ideal place to stay and will always be our choice in future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, lovely room”
Reviews.Author: mark c
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded to a Junior Suite on my first visit to a Hyatt Hotel so obviously that was a good start. Room was retro-chic stylish and well appointed. Onsite dining was excellent, getting to the swimming pool and gym is bit of a hike and would stop me coming with my family. Club Lounge was good, choice of wines and snacks better than many I've experienced. Handy for Orchard Road and Transport.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice suites”
Reviews.Author: Albertusguntur
Reviews.Content: The pool is very nice as well as the breakfast. I always get upgraded to the renewal suites so I dont know about the other rooms but the suites are very very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in Orchard Area”
Reviews.Author: sheedog16
Reviews.Content: This is your typical overseas Grand Hyatt. Top shelf amenities and location in the heart of Orchard Area. Pros: -Fabulous breakfast included in rate -Club lounge was very comfortable with great service, although food options were below average -Great room on 14th floor with great beds/bathroom...colleagues on other floors reported same -Very good fitness/spa area, but if they could better chill the water, and also offer chilled hand towels, it would be on par with other Grand Hyatt's -Good pool area with adjacent restaurant -Great Orchard area location with v close access to the MRT. Cons: -Prices for food were on par with other high-end Singapore locations, which means extremely high priced. Drinks in hotel bar were 15-25 local dollars (US$12-20) -Club Brix is mostly prostitutes, with little to no hotel concern with its patrons having "guests for the night." Drinks are very expensive, but the bar itself is actually really nice. The one night we met non-prostitutes there was the highlight of our week....Go Lufthansa! -Very slow room service, even when just requesting ice -Very slow elevators, causing waits longer than other hotels Overall, the hotel and its staff met every standard of excellence I would expect from a high-end Hyatt property. The issues above notwithstanding, I would stay there again if I were to visit Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Armani74
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt Singapore recently whilst in town to celebrate the Lunar New Year with family. The service was top notch from start to finish. We stay at quite a few Hotels and the the arrival experience was very welcoming, friendly and efficient. The room was spacious and stark and contemporary (a style I like very much). The rain shower in the bathroom was a treat. I like that more and more hotels have this put in. We dined at Straits Kitchen, Mezza9 went to the bar and would highly recommend Mezza9; the food and service in my books scored 100 out of 100. Really very very good, try the steamed fish, green veggies in oyster sauce and chicken fried rice for sure, very YUMMY! Compliments to the staff at the Grand Club, The front desk, concierge and the pool side, all were excellent! We will choose the Hotel again, for our next trip there!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty crappy”
Reviews.Author: PSJ1234
Reviews.Content: The grand Hyatt is a pretty crappy hotel in Singapore. the rooms including the suites are so below average. There are usually expired food products in the mini bar. The lobby gives you a sleazy vibe. Not a great hotel to stay in if you're looking for luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if on business trip”
Reviews.Author: Fion W
Reviews.Content: I travel for business and am a top-tier (Diamond) member for Hyatt Passport, Hilton Honors and Starwood. I have stayed at the GH Singapore on many occasions but am not sure I'll come back. The ONLY thing GH Sp has going for it is its location. The rooms are worn-down, the carpets are old and don't look very clean, the toilets and plumbing have given problems on several occasions, the phones don't work properly, the reception for the TV is so poor I can barely hear what's on TV. This latest trip, the phone had problems with the speaker and I had problems taking business calls and teleconferences as a result; the room had gnats and I found a lot of dead insects by the window sill next to the desk. On one previous stay, there appeared to be fecal matter on the sleeve of a bath-robe hangng in the bathrobe when I checked into the room - the hotel gave me a small box of chocolates when I highlighted this. I was at the Conrad on my last 2 trips and the service and condition there were much, much better. Finally, the Hyatt Singapore has in my experience been one of the worst for upgrades - other than the use of the Club Lounge, I have not seen any tangible benefits to being a Diamond member when I stay here. Oh - and the coffee in the Club Lounge is so bad I prefer instant coffee. The Conrad and Park Hyatts have Nespressos.

Reviews.Title: “Buzzing grand Hyatt bang near Orchard Rd”
Reviews.Author: Gaganr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights on a business visit. This was my 2nd stay in 2 months and must say that the hotel has really spruced up and refurbished it's rooms and the service and quality of food also seems to have improved. Stayed at one of the large refurbished rooms which had all the trappings of luxury. The rooms were well sized and very well furnished as well. I had breakfast on 2 days and thw spread was outstanding and the service very prompt. We also ate at the Italian restaurant on one of the nights and the food was pretty good even though it was pretty empty. The location can't get better than what it is. You are a minute's walk from Orchard Rd and the area buzzes. If you want to be away from crowds, this is not the place. This ia a great lively hotel in the buzzing Orchard area and I am a convert.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Primaully W
Reviews.Content: Located in Scott Road but very close to the junction with Orchard Road, perfect if you plan spend a little dime in Singapore's infamous shopping area. Surrounded by many shops, I always try to book this hotel during business trip in Singapore as I can plan to get a late flight and shop a little in the morning. The location is very convenient! Breakfast is good with wide range of choices. Nothing really special with room, standard for 5-star hotel. The air conditioner sometimes a bit too cold.

Reviews.Title: “Location is perfect for enjoying Singapore”
Reviews.Author: petraontheroad
Reviews.Content: Large hotel with inevitable feel of impersonality but suite accommodation was very comfortable and perfectly quiet allowing for a great night's sleep. Didn't try any of the facilities and missed breakfast on account of jet lag but a definite must is the Strait's Kitchen Restaurant. Located in the middle of central Singapore, it's the perfect starting point for shopaholics.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Tschaller
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - one block from MRT, but I get the feeling most guests at the hotel ride in cars. This is a business property- great service, heart of the Orchard Road area. Make sure to reserve in advance as the hotel seems to be fully booked most of the time. Great Pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: berray
Reviews.Content: Staying in this hotel for 2 weeks. Overall great. The only gripe I have is that I am staying in delux suite with 2 rooms and I still need to pay separately for wi fi access. Rooms are pricey so was expecting all inclusive. Gym and pool is excellent

Reviews.Title: “Great restaurant & bars”
Reviews.Author: Susan C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great experience at Hyatt. We came to celebrate our aniversary and started the evening with martinis at the bar. The selection of drinks was the largest I had seen in a long time. Dinner at Straits restaurant was equaly satisfying with a colorful buffet. The highlight of the evening was then a late night visit to the hotel club for after dinner drinks. On that note special thanks to manager Mr Mark for taking great care of us and for finding us a table on this crowded night to enjoy the american music band.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: AngelaSch
Reviews.Content: We visit Singapore regularly and always stay at the Grand Hyatt for its consistently good customer service, the rooms and of course the extensive, delicious buffet breakfast. On our last trip our bags were lost in transit and the hotel regulary followed up with the airline and kept us informed. The hotel is conveniently located to Orchard Road and is perfect for those shopping up a storm.

Reviews.Title: “Aged & Creaking at the Seams...”
Reviews.Author: Titillator
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt Singapore is in serious need of refurbishment. It was a good hotel choice in the past, primarily because of its' ideal location (close to Orchard Road but shielded from the hustle and bustle as it's on Scotts). But nowadays, years after its' last renovation works, it is creaking at the seams and has become very aged.. I have been staying at this hotel for more than the last decade, so I know it well. It used to be pleasant, especially after the new garden wing was constructed. But that was many years ago.. Since then there has been limited refurbishment and the rooms/public areas are showing this distinctly. Nothing has been refreshed in the lobby/reception areas - from the marble floors to the concierge desk, everything looks and feels worn. Though there is a new tea room on the ground floor, most has stayed the same.. and from 15-20 years ago! And it's all starting to show. Only the pool, spa and gym have aged well but most other public zones are at best, retro. The rooms are the most disappointing due to the lack of refurbishment. The Grand King rooms in the new wing are particularly worn. Wooden floors are scratched, furniture is worn, and even the toilets smell quite bad. In my past experiences, the safes don't work properly and electrical sockets are so worn that you can't plug in your computer, etc. More recently, I decided to pay more and stay in the Grand Deluxe Kings to see if there is any improvement. These are similar to mini suites as they have a separate sitting room/office and were renovated after the Grand King rooms (yes, the similar categorization is confusing!). In spite of upgrading myself and paying around 20% more for the Grand Deluxe room, I was still disappointed and once again, the age of the hotel showed up clearly. The air conditioning in the bedroom area didn't work, the toilet flush button was stained around the edge, and even the alarm clock was an item from the last century, ticking away noisily! What was particularly disappointing was that internal windows were dirty, the pillows smelt and housekeeping failed to perform a turn-down service. So, perhaps it's not just the age of the building which disappoints but also management. Yet, I cannot blame the management for everything. I believe that the problems mainly lie in the age of this property, and the lack of investments into refurbishment (surprising as the owner is the Sultan of Brunei, who isn't short of cash!). The management, though young, seem to try their best to make up for what the building lacks.. But in reality, they can only do so much as the hotel is so worn that it is gagging for an overhaul! The Grand Hyatt Singapore is not the best option in the area as there are many other hotels which offer you a fresher stay. More importantly, it is a pricey option and the high cost (USD 300-400 a night for the most basic room) is not justified by the aged nature of this property. Stay here if location is your greatest consideration - but remember that there are a plethora of other newer/renovated 5 star hotels nearby (see my other report on the St Regis, for instance - cheaper especially if you prepay and book online).

Reviews.Title: “Sunday Brunch”
Reviews.Author: pannieCork
Reviews.Content: 5 people +5 month baby really enjoyed the all inclusive brunch. great variety of food .and no shortage of drink including Cocktails and Champagne

Reviews.Title: “GUEST UNFRIENDLY”
Reviews.Author: ANJUGOELA
Reviews.Content: The location, off Orchard Road, is the only thing going for this hotel (besides the room). The Club Deluxe King room we booked was large, spacious and comfortable, with a lounge, walk in closet and a dressing area. The room overlooked the garden, which was probably the best view they could offer. The pool is really tiny, for such a large hotel, with deck chairs brushing against each other. You are literally breathing down your neighbour's neck!! The spa was average. The breakfast spread was sparse and definitely not 5 star standard. Service is definitely not their strong point. We were there for New Year's Eve and enquired several times about their programme packages. Neither the concierge nor the individual restaurants bothered to revert to us despite repeated follow ups. They only had two computers in the business centre for guest use. We were asked to come back after several hours when we wanted a print out!! This was our most disappointing Hyatt experience. We are definitely not going back to this property again!!

Reviews.Title: “Just amazing”
Reviews.Author: Rushu
Reviews.Content: Every thing was perfect, stayed at this hotel in 2005, 2006, 2007 and 2011 and it is still perfect. Service, suites, facilities, restaurants , you name it and it perfection personified. Stay at this property and eat the amazing food, and enjoy the quality of splendor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: Jayteekay
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is great--good shopping within walking distance. The rooms are getting old, but still adequate. The swimming pool is big and you can relax by pool side. You have no idea you are in the middle of town.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent example”
Reviews.Author: madpaddo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Grand Hyatt Singapore many times and this was the first time my husband came along. The hotel and its staff go above and beyond to ensure that every stay is memorable.

Reviews.Title: “"You get what you pay for..."”
Reviews.Author: mizadder
Reviews.Content: ..and that sums up the Grand Hyatt Singapore. Everything from the location to the service and amenities do not leave much room for complaints. My only grouse is the apparent thin floor/ceiling, which ensured I was aware whenever someone directly upstairs used the shower or toilet. Breakfast was served at the Straits Kitchen and the array was sumptuous to say the least. Despite running full on the five mornings I was there, service was attentive. The pool and the surrounding areas were spotless and the pool crew thoughtful. All in all a good stay and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Travels200
Reviews.Content: Always loved Grand Hyatt Singapore and always will. Strait's Kitchen is just awesome and this is one of the best Hyatt hotels in the world. Location is absolutely perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lmadrid
Reviews.Content: A Hyatt will never disappoint you. This is a 5 star place, with great rooms in almost the perfect location in Singapore. From the restaurant to the bar, the coffee shop, the gim and even the Brics night club dowstair for the one looking for some night fun, this hotel has it all in high standards. The only negative points are the always crowed and noisy lobby and the fact that most of the rooms does not offer good views to Singapore, like other hotels located in the Marina Bay Area. However, the convenient location and the excellent service comes along with the price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service in an awkward situation”
Reviews.Author: lovehotels58
Reviews.Content: This hotel really exceeded my expectations. It is everything that you would expect from a Grand Hyatt: well appointed rooms, lovely spa and a great location. What set this Hyatt apart is its outstanding service and amazing food and beverage outlets. I was lucky enough to stay at this property for four nights at the end of a recent trip. Having stayed in various five star brands across the region, I must say that this one stood out. Travelling with friends, we dined at StraitsKitchen, 10 SCOTTS, Pete’s Place and mezza9. StraitsKitchen is a hawker style restaurant with surprisingly authentic cuisine, I had one of the best Laksa’s I have had in Singapore there. All the restaurants are very good and far above normal expectations for hotel dining, however my favourite would have to be mezza9. Predictably we had the Chilli crab from the crustacean bar and I struggle to remember a better meal, I certainly cannot remember a better chilli crab..and I have eaten a lot of chilli crab in my time. Which brings me to the service. The first day/night at this hotel I came down with a 24 hour bug of some description that I had picked up from my previous stop in Bali. I was unable to leave the room and became well acquainted with the amenities, which luckily are very well appointed. The staff were just fantastic. The Front Office called to check on me regularly, but not so regularly as to become annoying. The concierge headed to the chemist next door to purchase a range of items to assist with my predicament. Overall they made me feel very well cared for without impacting my need for privacy. The next day I was perfectly fine and heading for breakfast when I was surprised to speak with the housekeeper on my floor as she expressed her genuine concern for my wellbeing. I had the ‘do not disturb’ sign for the previous 24 hours and she had been very worried about me, checking with my friend if there was any way that she could assist. This kind of warm and authentic customer service has become rare in the hotel industry and I was very pleasantly surprised to find that it still exists at Grand Hyatt Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel with spacious room”
Reviews.Author: wasabiMalaysia
Reviews.Content: My family and I were going to Singapore in June. We stayed in this hotel for three days. Our trip was superb. The hotel is perfectly located wihin a walking distance to Takashimaya, Ion Orchard, Paragon Shopping Centre and Wisma Atria. We stayed in one of the club rooms and the service was incredible. The rooms are spacious and nicely decorated. I highly recommend this hotel for those who are planning to have a vacation in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Basement Disgrace - not worthy of a Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: BillM1964
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is excellent and the restaurants cannot be faulted. We tried Mezza 9 (International), Pete's Place (Italian) and The Martini Bar (Martinis!). All excellent outlets with great service. The rooms are splendid. The location is perfect. Then there is Brix in the basement. It is hard to believe that the Hyatt would sanction this outlet as being linked to the hotel. Indeed I asked to sign my bill and have it allocated to my room in the expectation that this would not be allowed as the bar was not really part of the Hyatt - it is. The service in Brix is just appalling - think waiters and bar staff clad in black, slick pony tails and completely consumed with their appearance, looking cool and having fun. Dealing with customers comes last by a long chalk. Waiters are unbelievably rude. When I pointed out to a waiter that the service was poor and that he was rude he summoned two very menacing bouncers and held a flashlight in my face to identify me. I am quite sure if I had not pointed out that I was a hotel guest - something they checked before backing off - I would have been physically assaulted and removed from the premises for my complaint. A European manager, who looked about 15 and clearly was not able to control his staff, seemed too intimidated to do anything about it. Brix is also essentially a meat-market with wall-to-wall prostitutes aggressively soliciting clients. This is encouraged by the bar and waiting staff who act like pimps for the girls. I was totally shocked as was my female companion when she joined me later, sending the lurking call girls scurrying to new prey. It is an utter disgrace that the Hyatt endorses this bar and although the hotel is excellent in every other regard I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “"I'll Be Back!"”
Reviews.Author: judy k
Reviews.Content: Located in a perfect location on Orchard Rd, within close walking distance to shopping at Ion Center, Wisma Atria, and Takashimaya.There are great food courts there too. Check in was quick and friendly. I had booked a club king room which includes breakfast and evening cocktails. I highly recommend this if you plan on drinking. A beer can set you back 18.USD. FYI, Buy the drinks at the duty free. Very fairly priced. Breakfast had a very nice spread of juices, fruits, pastries, and hot items. At cocktail time, there were delicious canapes, dim sum, ceviche, and lots more.Our server named Jun really took care of us. Coffee cups were always filled and dirty plates were promptly removed. Rooms are spacious and cozy. I really like the large bathroom because of the vanity table. I can spread out all my make- up. Since it was our anniversary, the staff had deliver a very nice bottle of wine and chocolate cookies. So happy! We really enjoyed our dinner at the Straits restaurant in the hotel. Great food and service!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good but Pricey”
Reviews.Author: Steve A
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of weeks in October. Still a great hotel in a great location. You can get hotels nearly as good for half the money though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but expensive.”
Reviews.Author: Alistair_MacDonald
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel extensively remodeled since my last stay. With a good location just off Orchard road. I have no complaints other than the cost. Everything was first class but they charge for it. If you want luxury and can afford to pay for it this is the place to stay at this end of Orchard road.

Reviews.Title: “Always good”
Reviews.Author: junkbuzz
Reviews.Content: My normal spot in Singapore, 3-4 times a year. Great staff. Wide variety of room types depending on where in hotel you stay. I have tried from the basic to the suite, and all work fine, some need a bit of updating. Restaurant breakfast is dangerously good, always a risk of eating too much at breakfast. Did not try the new bar/loung across from restaurant but it looks like a great place for business cocktails, quiet and classy. Internet cost if you are not Platinum Hyatt member, which should be free for all guests, as is the trend in more hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: perkins4108
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Hyatt for a couple of nights and found the whole experience just truly amazing. Service, food, friendly and helpful staff all make it very worthwhile paying just a little extra. Special mention for The Concierge name Faisal. The guy just could not have been more helpful. Well done Grand Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Just a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wiebe_de_Witte
Reviews.Content: Every time I travel to Singapore, I make sure I stay in the Grand Hyatt. The hotel offers great value: well located, great service, and very good kitchen in the various restaurants. I find especially the breakfast legendary: around 7 cooks / mini-restaurants with all kinds of food are served buffet wise. The only drawback for me is that the fairly large swimming pool is not suitable for real swimming.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located hotel.”
Reviews.Author: enr12
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt is well located in the middle of the main shopping district and within a block or two of several malls. We stayed at the Regency rooms which was high tech., well lighted and very spacious. The bathroom was large and also very well designed with an excellent shower. The breakfast on the floor and the evening snacks were very good, and most adequate if one wanted a light breakfast. The swimming pool was set up in a tropical garden setting, complete with and indoor/outdoor, very substantial menu that one could enjoy with many of the local foods. The water was warm, and very comfortable. At times the pool was a little crowded, but other than that, it was an excellent spot to relax as was the health club and spa. I would return here again, and the only draw back was that it was not part of a mall so one would have to brave the hot sun for a couple of blocks, unlike the hotels at City Hall.

Reviews.Title: “great rooms”
Reviews.Author: ichigosan
Reviews.Content: really enjoyed staying at this grand hotel, our room was very spacious with a fantastic balcony, loved the bathrobes and the cocktails in the "lobby bar", good location and very informative staff on where to go shopping, what to do in the city, we only stayed 1 night on a stop over however i highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the city centre”
Reviews.Author: GenieAlice
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times and love its location - in the city centre and shopping street. Major department stores are in the same street, including duty free shop opposite to the hotel. Easy to access - subway 3 minutes walk and taxi stop in front of the hotel. The room are big and simply 5 stars hotel standard. I personally love the big & clean bathroom - bathtab and shower seperate; one side of the bathroom wall are covered by huge mirror. There are also provide powder table with several mirrors....if you are enjoy make up and dress up, you will love this bathroom. Bed are comfortable. Suite room has a living room with another TV and working desk - such a big room. The restaurant for buffet breakfast (open for all meals) is big and have variety of food - chinese, indian,western etc. I also had a buffet dinner here; enjoy all the food and very fresh juice. The Italian restaurant is also good with a friendly staffs. I always come bak to this hotel same as all my friends. Recommened.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place, just nothing special about it”
Reviews.Author: vwhk
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt is a decent but ageing 5-star hotel, which has now been outclassed by many competitors. Its location, next to the Orchard / Scott corner, is great for tourists and shoppers; slightly less ideal for business as the taxi ride to the CBD goes through the most jammed roads in Singapore. The lobby is vast but dark, with low ceilings: OK as a meeting point, not inviting to hang around. It is cool and quiet in comparison to the hustle and bustle of the street. The small reception counters, and a processing system on the slow side, result in long lines for check-in and check-out. The rooms are large but their layout is not ideal, with a small window and balcony in a corner making them slightly claustrophobic. Decent beds, decent equipment, one positive being the presence of a DVD player. No complaint about the restaurants and bars except that they too are rather unmemorable. The tropical pool is relaxed and quintessentially Singaporean. The place is competently managed and the service is up to Hyatt standards. Given a choice among similar hotels, I would not select the Grand Hyatt. If I have to stay there (e.g. for a conference), I have no problem with it either.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for short break & shopping”
Reviews.Author: CutiCutiTime
Reviews.Content: Drove down to Singapore with my wife and our 14mths old boy on the weekend of 29 - 31 Oct. Upon arriving Grand Hyatt Singapore's main entrance, with heavy pedestrian traffic, there were sufficient Hyatt bellboys to help unload our luggages efficiently and also a concierge staff to direct us to the 20th executive Club floor lobby for our quick check-in. Car parks for hotel guests are ample if you are planning to drive to Singapore or rent one during your stay here. This Hotel really exceeded my expectations. Location can't be any better. Scotts & Orchards Roads are literally on your doorsteps. Accessibility is great. Great shopping, excellent restaurants and 24hours convenient stores are all just few minutes walk from the Lobby. There are also many good restaurants such as Mezza9 and Pete's Place (check out weekend brunch @ Pete's). We compared rates on several travel / hotel websites but found the official Hyatt Website to offer the best deal for our Club Deluxe King room. Consider the Club rooms if possible as its well worth the extras and the Grand Club Lounge is amongst the best of any hotel's executive club lounges in terms of decor, ambience, food and beverage selections. This Grand Club is ideal to unwind after a day long of shopping, business meetings or even hosting some friends. Check out the evening cocktail too. The room is spacious with a separate hall. All tastefully appointed and functional as described on its official website. The FOC crib we pre-ordered for our boy when we booked only arrived after we got in to the room. No big deal but would've been better to have prepared it before our arrival. Whilst it only mentioned availability of "high speed internet access" & "Dataport", complimentary WiFi is available throughout the Club Floors and Grand Club Lounge. The recently renovated swimming pool and its surrounding is very nice. Our boy had a great time playing on the vast shallow water area with me while his mummy relaxed in the cabanas. We will surely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Sue303506
Reviews.Content: The location is great. the SPA And pool area are really good and one feels the privacy of the location. Diversity in restaurants at the hotel. Rooms at first building are much better than in the back one.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, but overly expensive”
Reviews.Author: beerdrinker2005
Reviews.Content: The 8th floor room faced away from traffic noise and no hallway noise was noticed. White marble entryway and bath. Separate, full shower. Very large, soft white cotton towels. Dark stone and chrome modern fixtures. Comfortable king bed with medium-weight pillows. 29" flatscreen TV with DVD player and multiple A/V inputs. Hardwired Internet. Electrical outlets with 110/220v and multiple plug styles. Ground floor restaurant for breakfast buffet with small egg station, fresh-squeezed fruit juices and fresh breads. Comfortable multi-room seating. Martini Bar above lobby. No happy hour! $15 USD bottles of Tiger Beer, compared to $10 + tax in minibar. No draught beer in hotel. Nearby Orchard Road international bars with happyhours until 7 or 8pm and $12 USD/pint prices. Local markets with $6USD Leffe botled beers. Overall, friendly staff but they couldn't master the computerized phone system that kept giving mystery 0630 wake-up calls. Uninformed pool cleaning contractor had to be called off after disturbing guests with a power-washer at 3am. Gym and 5th floor pool were untried. Good location for Orchard Road MRT stops, which seems perpetually under construction. Next time I'd consider the Sands Casino Hotel at Marina Bay or the classic hotels around Clarke Quay, since they're in the midst of walkable, traffic-free areas.

Reviews.Title: “Not that grand”
Reviews.Author: PJW22
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel but there are much better options in this price range in Singapore. The location is fine if your main interest is shopping on Orchard Road but if you are on business the approach to the hotel can be time-consuming by car due to the one-way system and traffic congestion. I also noticed quite lengthy queues for taxis. My room was located in the wing at the rear of the hotel. The size was below average for this hotel class, the view was onto a series of appartment blocks and the decor was aggressively minamalist. The bathroom was good and well equipped but the temperature of the hot water at 8.00 a.m. was only just acceptable. Bathroom noise from the next room was audible. There is a good range of dining options in the hotel but prices are very high. I found the concierge service rather off-hand.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hasnat_Mohsin
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel once when I was returning from Bintan Island, Indonesia. I have booked Deluxe Room for me. When I was checking, I was free upgraded to Junior Suite room which was awesome. I had dinner in the hotel and that was so great. Its more than 5 star, but expensive and basis on quality service, its still value for money. Situated at the heart of Singapore city in Orchard Road area with great shopping fun.

Reviews.Title: “Best Option to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: mithi
Reviews.Content: Close to Orchard Road, this Hyatt is a great option to stay in Singapore. The rooms are very nice, the ones overlooking the back are better. The restaurant choice is good, the staff is friendly and the rooms have great amenities. There standard room could have been a little bigger, but its fine for a lone business traveller. I love staying here and usually never stay elsewhere. I have not tried out the spa but the gym is great to work out in and the pool is awesome to lounge in, but not a great pool to swim laps.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Haven”
Reviews.Author: TriciaTAN
Reviews.Content: My bff and her college sweetheart finally tied the knot. We looked forward to this day forever and was overjoyed to celebrate the occasion at Grand Hyatt. We checked into the hotel early to prep and staff were friendly and efficient. They truly have the most stylish ballroom in town- Gallery. The chefs were preparing the cocktail menu live at a private kitchen so it's a wonderful experience. Although I didn't hv much time to enjoy e 10 course dinner, it was an unforgettable time. My happily married bff treated me to the best spa treatment at Damai the next day whilst they took off for their honeymoon. I'll definitely consider Hyatt for my own wedding. Now to find the groom...

Reviews.Title: “Mixed, 5-star hooker heaven”
Reviews.Author: ucrazykid
Reviews.Content: Well, it is a great hotel from 6 am until 11 pm. Great facilities, comfortable rooms, wonderful food. However, after ~Midnight they parade of hookers starts. The night club (Brix) is a well known (reported by my taxi drivers) hang out for hookers. from my driver "The club is full of Lady-boys from Viet Nam, they will put something in your drink and then rob you." So transvestite, transsexual hookers are not my idea of a good time. If you happen to come in on a late night flight and find yourself checking in at ~1:30 am you will see stumbling (drunk? drugged?) businessmen being escorted by women (questionably) to their rooms. The clerk was noticeably embarrassed. If you stay in at night, you will not see this. OH and one more thing. A 330ml beer is SG$16, a bit steep.

Reviews.Title: “Love this property”
Reviews.Author: Lil H
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is fresh, modern and enjoyable. I have stayed here many times for work and pleasure and it is one of my favorite hotels in the world. The service is outstanding, the food is excellent, the pool is gorgeous and the rooms are fabulous. I love the location. Straits Kitchen is so good you must have a meal there. I am a fussy traveller who is spoilt and I think this is one of the best hotels around. The only downside is that the public areas are often crowded. A testament to the quality of the property but at times a bit overwhelming. Treat yourself to a club tower room it is worth the extra expense.

Reviews.Title: “Super vacation”
Reviews.Author: artemisia_nikhil
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt is in the perfect place for a Singapore city holiday, a few metres away from Orchard Road, well connected to practically everything by bus, metro and taxi. The hotel is large and seems slightly impersonal until your first interaction with the staff, who are absolutely brilliant. The service was always smiling, friendly and super-efficient. The suite we stayed in was fairly roomy and looked down into the attractive terrace garden. The food was excellent; the breakfast (whether in the room or in the restaurant) was beautifully presented and spoiled us for choice. We absolutely loved this place and would find it difficult to stay anywhere else when we're in Singapore next.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with the friendliest staff in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: APollak71
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt Singapore is a perfect, well managed hotel right in the center of Singapore,a few meters from Orchard road. Getting here and around is pretty easy using the world famous MRT of Singapore (Orchard station is ca. 50 meters from the hotel) and there are around 20-30 buses stopping in front or opposite the hotel so the location cannot be better both for tourists and business travellers. Getting here from Changi airport takes around 20-25 minutes by taxi (of course depends on the traffic conditions) and costs around S$ 20. The rooms are spacious and clean,with all the modern facilities like brand new LCD tv sets,DVD player,super king size,very comfy bed,separete (rainforest) shower and bathtub. The hotel has two wings (Grand and Terrace) with a Grand Club lounge for each one,where one can have super breakfast with hot food items,all day coffee,tea and soft drink service and an evening cocktail service again with hot food and canapes. The staff overall is the friendliest I ever met,they really try their best to make your stay an unforgettable one and as smooth as possible. They are always open for a friendly chat or giving you any information you may need in this amazing city. One of the greatest spot of the hotel is the Damai Spa,equiped with sauna,steam room and Japanese onsen-style hot and cold pools. The spa is open from 5 in the morning to 11 in the evening so it's a perfect relaxing place after a long business (or shopping) day. On the level 4 (next to Damai Spa) there is a very nice swimming pool (open until 10 in the evening),it is a great and romantic experience to have a swim looking at the Singapore night skyline around. On the level 4 there is a complete small rainforest setting even with a waterfall,amazing sights and sounds of (real) birds especially in the morning,imagine that in the middle of a modern city! In a word the Grand Hyatt Singapore is a 100% nice and faultless experience,with a real Singaporean touch,truly relaxing and smooth.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for both business and holiday.”
Reviews.Author: FrequentBizTraveler1
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Hyatt Singapore so many times that I can't even count the number. Have tried both executive floor, new wings, old wings, Standard rooms, junior suites, suites etc. Certainly there is a difference but even when you stay at the older or smaller rooms you can feel the Hyatt touch. To start with, the old bell captains are amazing, the moment they open the car door when you arrive, you already feel welcomed. If you have stayed more than twice, they already recognize you or at least act well. The check-in system is very efficient and they recognize your reservation even before approaching the counter. The receptionist people are all charming and very fast. After you arrive at your room, someone will call to make sure the room is to your liking. As I mentioned, rooms' quality varies but all are impeccably clean and no compromise on sheet/bed/towels quality. Breakfast offers huge selections that one may wish to have two bellies. All F&B facilities are perfect. Swimming pool is small but enough, gym and spa are amazing. They also have some "stars" like Kumar at the bar, who besides being so entertaining makes wonderful cocktails. So do his colleagues. Can't say much about the club downstairs called Brix as I always try to find words to qualify it but anyway call it very entertaining spot :-). Regarding location, right on Scotts and Orchard, you are in the shopping heart of the city. Yet only 10 minutes to the business city, so good for any purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Olivier_41
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in the centre of Singapore. Excellent staff, nice bar, good rooms. A bit oversized, but still personal in its service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: jakartagirl
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Great service, Friendly staff. Will be back

Reviews.Title: “Service if you can find the staff.............!!”
Reviews.Author: johnnylavaBeijing
Reviews.Content: Wanted to book a night at the Grand Hyatt recently and as I was in town, went in to the Reception Desk around midday.However, there was a queue of about 8 people with only one person manning Reception and no additional help was forthcoming so we all had to wait,in my case 37 minutes and some 'guests ' gave up and walked away. On finally getting to the front of the queue I was asked to cal the hyatt international reservations number which while being a local call,meant my call was routed to the call centre in India !! How stupid is that and what level of service does Hyatt thin this provides? However,the actual stay itself was excellent with a good clean room,attentive if sometimes slow room service and flexibility on check out.As a lifetime passport member I have been consistently pleased with the Hyatt offering but I have to say,the pursuit of efficiency and cost reduction is undermining service,the very reason I remained loyal this long.time to wake up Hyatt!!

Reviews.Title: “I'm very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: EstiYanuar
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, great service, strategic location, nice staff

Reviews.Title: “Not Grand Hyatt standard”
Reviews.Author: workingjapan
Reviews.Content: The hotel was not where you should stay in Singapore with a family. The service was good, however the room (bathroom) was rundown and the food was outrageously expensive. It also seemed to have adult guests that you would not want your children to be around. I was not aware that this hotel had this reputation until after our stay and I asked a friend in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in almost any other city, just good in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Dmitry Z
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in this hotel. Almost everything convinient. Was unpleasantly surprised at my arrival because nobody even tried to help me with my luggage. Visibily heavy enough. And as well as my travel agency made a mistake in dates of my staying (misspelled the month: September instead of October) clerck at the reception desk (wich is well hide from the front door ;-) decided to get accomodation payment once more from my credit card directly. And week after coming back home from Singapore I still haven't my money back. But food in all restaurants is superb. All other staff are very forthcoming. And such a beautifull garden and waterfall at the fifth floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and the size and traffic makes it ideal if one wants anonymity”
Reviews.Author: siglo
Reviews.Content: If you need to be at Scotts Road/Orchard Road, this may well be the best at that location. The public areas are busy. The F&B outlets were packed. But I only tried the Oasis by the poolside. It is a well designed area which makes you feel at a resort, not in the heart of Singapore's busiest shopping district. The food is also good. My Grand King room in the Terrace Wing was modern and comfortable. The work area is well designed. The only complaint is the need to pay for Internet access. Beds are comfortable. Brix is certainly a "happening" nightspot and worth a visit for the experience This old property has seen many rounds of refurbishment over the years and there really is little to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Best weekend brunch buffet ever !!!”
Reviews.Author: Eva Z
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few times on business trips.Ture Grand Hyatt standard and everything is just as perfect as it could get as always. Great location and just seconds away from Orchard Road, the main shopping street in Singapore. The staff are just as friendly and helpful as you ask for if not more. The weekend brunch buffet is awesome. Probably the best in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with nice club room”
Reviews.Author: Cardinalbeagle
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is centrally located and with all the amenities you can expect from a Grand Hyatt. The rooms are spacious but has no views (surrounded by apartment complex). Has a nice outdoor pool and gym. The food in the club lounge is fabulous. The room rate is on the pricey side as you can expect from other 4-5 star hotels in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: Flo088
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, steps from Orchard Road. The staff were excellent, could not do enough for you. Try and book a Club room, well worth having your own lounge for breakfast, all day snacks and evening drinks.

Reviews.Title: “NIce room, nice gym, excellent meals”
Reviews.Author: BoulderTravelers5
Reviews.Content: While the room was a bit on the pricey side as all 4-5 start western hotels in Singapore area, the Grand Hyatt did not disappoint. My room was very large, comfortable bed, nice desk/work area with good internet. The gym was good, plenty of treadmills. Meals were top notch. Any meal at the Straits Kitchen is excellent, and our dinner at Mezza9 was good. All in all a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: OaklandBK
Reviews.Content: I frequently stay at the Grand Hyatt, Singapore when I'm in Singapore on business. The rooms are good - one bedroom suites with a functional work area and sitting area. The martini bar gets a good crowd, with great happy hour deals. The main floor restaurant has an excellent, pan-Asian buffet breakfast and dinner. The hotel is in a good location - good access to the subway and lots of restaurants and shops within easy walking distance. The only things about the hotel I don't like? The taxi queue in the morning can be long and slow. The hotel needs to figure out a better way to get a steady stream of cabs. Or you should pre-book a cab and pay the nominal booking fee.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable”
Reviews.Author: himani17
Reviews.Content: comfortably positioned at scott road. It is on verge of shopping bliss of orchad road and orchad MRT station is few meres away. Breakfast buffet has good indian food.( veggie like me did not need to starve in singapore ) taxi availability very easy. nice pool.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Singapore”
Reviews.Author: aumbricht
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and a modern hotel kept in very good shape. The deluxe rooms are very big and very nice feel. Swimming pool is a bit small, but kids enjoyed it. Breakfast and dinner are good. The lounge has an extra corner for kids and the service is very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “18-22 July, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FUJI_Akira
Reviews.Content: Getting out of the taxi, the hotel has staff manning the front entrance 24/7 who'll greet you with genuine smiles. Check in was a breeze. Our bags were brought promptly, room is clean and smells fresh. Our room was 726 in the 'new' wing, but towards 10pm on the first night, while laying in bed after an exhausting day, my wife and I started to hear a rhythmic low bass thumping sound. It was annoying. At first I thought it was the room above us. Putting my ear to the window, I figured out it was the hotel's night club. To confirm, I jumped in the elevator to the lobby, and yep, same thumping beat. So, even on the 7th floor, we were experience that low annoying bass resonance. Must've been through the building's structural members or could have been transmitting via the ducting system. Stuck it out for 1 1/2 hrs thinking it'd go away, b/c we were still up and watching tv anyway. Well it didn't. So, around 11:45pm called the front desk to kindly investigate (again, I still wanted to believe it was the folks above us), so they mentioned they'd check out the 8th floor. About 8minutes later, there was a knock on the door and it was the night duty manager and an assistant. I was mildly surprised but even more surprised when he kindly asked if he could come in and experience for himself. Which is very good in my book, I'd rather him be there in person and ask for "proof" rather than try to convince someone over the phone who's detached and may not necessarily have your best interests in mind. Some people may be offended or put off by someone asking to, basically, "prove it" (which, I in no way took it that way, but rather very much welcomed it, and was more than happy to let him in the room at midnight and almost forgetting my wife was in bed), but I've soon realized, particularly in asia, that the more you yourself has a "coke & a smile" attitude, the more others are willing to accommodate, help, negotiate, or help fix your problem; if you have a gripe about something or anything, first outfit yourself with a "coke and a smile" then present your case. 9.9 times out of 10, you'll get yourself a "coke and a smile" treatment in return. If you the customer don't have this approach, you might as well take an aspirin for the headache to come. People'll shutdown on you quicker than a rolling blackout, AND with a grin...no smile. Anyway, so, we stood there in silence, lol & wife still hunkered down in bed, and listened for a good minute. Of course, it seemed like the hotel's club was having an intermission with their music playing or something like that while the DJ's figuring out something better to play or taking a break...you know. But, the manager did agree with us, and on the spot offered a couple options. He'd call back within a few minutes with a new room to move to or move first thing in the morning. Wife & I chose the morning. Between my wife & I, we decided we'd just tough it out and wear our airplane earmuffs for the night. However, no more than 5 minutes after he left, sure enough, the downstairs club came out of their "intermission" and resonance was worse than before. So, I called the front desk again and said we'd take up the offer to move now. They offered us the 20th floor, top floor, exec suite, corner room, and complimentary internet and exec club lounge access for remainder of our stay. Told em we'd be ready in 15 minutes. Well, lo' and behold, bellhop is there to transfer our bags and escort us to new room. Wasn't sure if it was our "coke and a smile" attitude or hyatt gold pass membership that assisted us in this matter, but it didn't make a difference. At the end of our stay, I realized Grand Hyatt Singapore's staff would have done their best and treated any other guest with the same respect, promptness, professionalism and sympathy, regardless of stature. New room was great, of course. Downstairs Mezza9 restaurant was reasonable, and actually surprising. At first I thought the dishes were overpriced, however, after receiving my rack of lamb, I was mistaken. 6 full, large chops. Plate was huge, lamb was a plenty. I was exepcting the normal 3 puny/petite chops some 5 star restaurants are getting all too familiar with serving nowadays. And when you order a glass of wine, it's a proper GLASS of wine. So, Mezza9 was worth it. However, due to the very convenient location of the hotel, we only ate inside that one time. Location location location. A hop, skip and a step to your left out of the front entrance and you're at the entrance to the metro service. Taxi's are readily available in the lobby. Concierge was helpful with providing maps, bus schedule/tours, or even which bus/metro to ride to make most of our time and with what we wanted to see. Probably 1/2 mile away by foot, great area for locals & tourists alike to enjoy some after work/happy hour drinks, tapas, meals, or whatever at a string of tavern, outdoor-like bars. Wife is pregnant so we didn't get to experience this. (Not to get off topic, but one day during the trip I'll never forget, she was adamant she wanted a turkey sandwich. We ended up walking all over place, and no turkey sandwich. So, if you want a turkey sandwich, goodluck. I forget where we ended up eating, but I'll never forget the turkey sandwich episode.) All in all, Grand Hyatt will be the first choice if/when we were to return to Singapore. Clean, comfy, great location, and genuinely friendly & professional staff. For the cost, which isn't unreasonable, the hotel's convenient location itself should be enough to convince you; pending, of course, the reason for your visit either business or vacation/sightseeing/shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Hardtopleaseofhk
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times now and find the guest experience to be consistently good. The lobby area and rooms are excellent, although not to everybody's taste, so I can understand some of the other reviewer's comments in this regard. The staff at reception could be friendlier but they are certainly professional and efficient, which for a business hotel is just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Not grand but not bad”
Reviews.Author: catman38ph
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Hyatt Singapore last weekend. The hotel lobby is incredibly busy but once you cross from the front desk and into the elevators, it gets more stress free and relaxing. The location is good but the marriot next door is more connected to the Ion where all the shopping you need is located. Service was good. Lobby staff was excellent specially the concierge team. They got taxis, car rentals and gave directions for us without that air of give me a tip around them. Food is good. Room service menu can be improved. Spa is good. poolside is wonderful...I would come back but i do not want to go back to Singapore for a while...that's another review.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Beautiful Country”
Reviews.Author: yesmasterjedi
Reviews.Content: I need to tell that all my expenses were paid by my company so I am not quite sure of the daily prices. Location is perfect since it is in the middle of everything. By walk you can go shopping or cover your instant needs. Rooms are very clean and every single need is covered around (like ironing table, funny but It saved my day). There is not much view because of the buildings around. Restaurants are clean and foods are delicious but expensive. There is a mid-end bar very close to the hotel( I am not sure if it is a part of the hotel but it seems so). The small waterfall inside is good to have but does not make you feel much localized. The lobby is crowded and noisy and the staff is not that much professional. That is the first thing suprised with Hyatt. Overall it is a high-end beautiful hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “lower end 5 star -> 4 star”
Reviews.Author: listenwell
Reviews.Content: Location was prime 20 years ago, now there are many hotspots in Singapore. Pool facilities substandard, rooms 5 star level (nothing special), service average, atmosphere of the lobby and lobby restaurant is noisy / hectic. Upper floor restaurants are better. Prices are on the high side, no real value for the money. Rooms not sound insulated.

Reviews.Title: “High quality service”
Reviews.Author: DarlingJJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Grand Hyatt Singapore after I stayed MBS. Club lounge service of Hyatt is much much much better than MBS. Because Hyatt staffs always care for us. Instead of it, MBS gives us poor service. I think they dont understand how to do customer service. Location is close to orchard street so you enjoy having time there. I will be come back there soon.

Reviews.Title: “True 5 star hotel and you pay for it”
Reviews.Author: mkbnj
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, the room is beautiful, very comfortable, great staff, wonderful gym and spa, high-end restaurants, great location for shopping, everything you expect in a 5 star. And you pay a lot for it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with convenient location though front desk staff can be more friendly...”
Reviews.Author: YY417
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 5D4N for work, stayed in club king room, spacious and clean, though you cant expect much view as there're so many buildings hereby. location is very convenient, shopping and dining are everywhere as soon as you step out from the hotel. when i checked in i was in jeans and t-shirt so maybe thats why the front desk was not too friendly and enthusiastic at all, hope they can be a bit more professional! After all Hyatt is a luxury hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Declining standards at Grand Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Sunshinetips
Reviews.Content: I frequent Grand Hyatt Singapore over the last decade because of its prime location, convenience and overall standard of the hotel. For the past 2 years, with each stay at the hotel, I am disappointed by the declining hygiene in the bathrooms. During my last stay, I found at least 6 dead insects on the ceiling of the shower. Mould and moldew have built up around the corners of the shower and bathtub. For the price we are paying to stay at a 5-star hotel, dead insects and mould are the last thing I expect to see.

Reviews.Title: “Would gladly go back tomorrow !! Really " Grand" :).”
Reviews.Author: pocahontasAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt Singapore for 6 nights in January 2011. As soon as you arrive, you are impressed by the grandeur of the reception hall, flowers displays etc...The check-in was very fast . We had 2 interconnecting rooms : a grand king + a grand twin.Booked under " The family plan", you get a discount on the second room.The rooms are spacious and beautiful.We overlooked the swimming pool area.
