We often choose Hyatt hotels as we are a bit fussy with bed comfort and we have never been disappointed.The bathrooms are also spacious with all amenities.There is a desk area in the bedroom with a safe big enough for a laptop and a bit more. Breakfast in ' Straits Kitchen is fantastic ! You could spend your whole morning there ! The choice of foods is unbelievable and the staff friendly ,courteous and extremely professional. We had room service a few times and loved it too. The location of the hotel is perfect.You can't avoid shops in Singapore so, Scotts Rd is a good starting point !!If you'd rather catch cabs than walk, it's so easy in Singapore...Cabs are everywhere.But, there is the metro just a few hundred meters away. Our stay in this hotel was perfect on all aspects.I would go back to the Grand Hyatt tomorrow if I could !!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service with HALAL foods....”
Reviews.Author: akuasyad
Reviews.Content: Definitely one of the best location in singapore... walking distance to Mrt n Orchard Road.. with the 5 star service n i dont think it can get better than this... the staff is so friendly n helpful... thumbs up to the management.... the greatest thing is.. the HALAL foods... not easy to get a hotel with halal foods in singapore.. n yes, Hyatt have the halal restaurant n its good... the room also very nice.. spacious n bathroom itself so biggg... really enjoyed my stay here... Hyatt is my best experience so far.... will stay here again the future.... recommended.........

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located and Great People...”
Reviews.Author: nshafz
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location... Across the street from DFS, surrounded by shopping area. Easy access to restaurants and fast food outlets. Room recently upgraded with flat screen TVs. Clean & comfortable beds. Spacious room. Should provides free internet, currently have to pay to surf the net. We got connecting rooms as requested. The best customer service, always attentive to detail. Staffs are all polite. Will definitely return on the next visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at a superb location that cannot get any better in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: PramodLunawat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were here in mid August for five nights and thoroughly enjoyed the stay although it a was a trip mixed with business in large measure and small but significant element of pleasure! Singapore has better hotels, no doubt, but this one stands out for its superb location in the heart of Orchard on Scotts Road and also for its very popular night club.As if this isn't enough for leisure, there is a lovely swimming pool and spa. The exterior is quite outdated and needs refurbishing and so do the meeting rooms or banquet halls. Check in was smooth, breakfast was never lousy and not a dull moment at all when you stay here.Rooms are big, well lit up but no view around because of its very location which is nearly on the junction of roads.The coffee shop some amazing juices and Sugarcane juice topped my choice! The choices in the menu also take care of vegetarians like me which is a big plus. They need to add complimentary Wi Fi for guests as that is so essential these days and hardly costs anything proportionately to a five star property.TV needs to have more international channels.Very surprisingly, there were newspapers and magazines sent over every day. Service standards and hospitality was of high standards, which I presume was a notch better for us because our host is a regular patron there. I will keep coming back and just need to alert the management not to let me down when I host my own stay next time!

Reviews.Title: “Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: jevousenprie
Reviews.Content: Five star service from turn down through to the front desk manager. The room was spacious and modern with a few minor maintenance issues that were quickly fixed by management.Very close to shops and transport;overall hard to fault due to the very well integrated approach to customer service. We would definitely return to the Grand Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel Service, nice rooms and friendly”
Reviews.Author: kar2on
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel is situated (around) the corner of Scotts Road and Orchard. Lovely location right in the middle of the city if you're there for shopping or sight-seeing. The staff are fantastic, and the service is one of the best I've had in Singapore (or anywhere else for that matter). The rooms are 'nice' unless you get an upgrade, that's when they become 'very nice'. The standard rooms that face the pool are big enough for a business traveler like myself with a separate desk area for work. Hotel service is great and the food over at their in house restaurants (Mezza 9, Pete's place and Straits Kitchen) is pretty decent, although the prices can be a bit on the high side. However, just to give you an indication on how good the service is, on my last trip to the hotel, I dined at Mezza9 and just briefly mentioned to the waiter than the Tom Yam soup I ordered was a bit too spicy, without hesitating he offered to waived the charges for the soup. Which was really good, because waiters are willing to comp you on service that wasn't perfect (the menu does mention the soup is spicy and he still comped the meal). The Hotel really has high standards for it's service, the staff always greet you by name and the reception staff are the friendliest anywhere in the world. The Pool is quite nice with a unique design, but depending on which wing you're staying can be quite a distance to walk, but overall I like the hotel, I like the rooms, I like the service and on my 9 trips to Singapore this year, Grand Hyatt was always my no.1 choice. The only real drawback is that my corporate rate didn't include breakfast, and there isn't anything to eat over at Orchard in the morning (with the exception of McDonalds & Starbucks across the road).

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Arti_60
Reviews.Content: The location is great and so is the service. We stayed at the club rooms and they were spacious and well planned. We ate at their restaurant Meezze 9. The food was so good that we went back the next day and ate the same salmon we had eaten the day before. We loved the Gym and the concierge was really helpful in booking any other restaurant we chose to go in the evenings. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: leefee
Reviews.Content: A personal experience. Arrived around 2pm for check-in. The rooms were not ready as yet, thus they ushered us to the executive lounge to wait while the rooms are available. Had to wait for about 40mins for the rooms, but they added in complimentary internet access for the whole stay.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel in SGP- great location too.”
Reviews.Author: Cintagreen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here four nights and enjoyed the Grand Hyatt immensely. Having a lot of extended family in Singapore, we've visited quite often and have stayed at many different hotels across the city---I can definitively say the Grand Hyatt is the best of the lot. The location just off of Orchard Rd. is very conveniently located for access to the malls, restaurants, and MRT. Rooms are modern and comfortable (we were generously upgraded to a suite thanks to a snafu early on in our stay), the breakfast spread in the club lounge was also impressive. But most of all, the staff (everyone from the managers to the concierge to the maids) went above and beyond to make things comfortable for us and they were exceedingly generous, polite and friendly. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but a very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: kaneblack1
Reviews.Content: I read all of the elated comments here and I feel as if I stayed in a different hotel. The Grand Hyatt has a great location, the rooms are well appointed, large and comfortable. However everything beyond that I found was very mediocre. Service was often hopeless, arranging simple airport transfers for my two business guests was stressful, the food in The Kitchen and their Italian restaurant was average. All in all for S$450.00 a night its overpriced and average!

Reviews.Title: “This is probably one of the best hotels in the world and so conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: 2371mount
Reviews.Content: fantastic service from maid service upward, from this location you can walk almost anywhere particularly in the Orchard shopping precinct

Reviews.Title: “the best service in over 40 years of business and personal travel”
Reviews.Author: Ivor T
Reviews.Content: A wonderfully designed hotel offering unrivalled hospitality. I never want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, we will be back”
Reviews.Author: ALMARZOUQI
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Grand Hyatt regency during my family trip, very nice hotel... Very nice staff in reception very polite and helpful, they explain everything in detail, very good security.... Location: Excellent location very close to MRT (Singapore Metro), and close to all high brands. With MRT can reach every part of Singapore and reasonable price (don't forget to refund by dropping the used card in the machine again, each card 1 S$)   Room: once we arrive in the reception they had offer for us upgrade to Club Deluxe Room for extra  150 S$ per day, we accept the upgrade and it was brilliant, with the upgrade we get early check in and access to  Grand Club Lounge, which serves complimentary Continental breakfast, evening cocktails and all day beverages., nice room big enough with 2 TV,Enhanced work desk  , complementary tea and caffe., nice decorated, and clean.  Activities: nice Swiming Pool, excellent  Gym equipments. Resturant: one of the best restaurant in Singapore located in this hotel, with very professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Crowded, noisy ; is this hotel really part of Hyatt group”
Reviews.Author: laoban173
Reviews.Content: seems this hotel really caters to large groups, meetings and maybe even conventions. real businessmen : stay away unless you are collecting points ; then make sure to stay in new tower in back, and use lounge in back seems they are pretty selective about honoring the normal perks of upper level hyatt gold passport program, being diamond member here has little impact very expensive for what you get

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelerMontreal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Grand Hyatt Singapore in August 2011, Staff are great!! Rooms are very comfortable, If you are staying in a standard room ask for the new tower

Reviews.Title: “My Choice in S'pore”
Reviews.Author: djain7276
Reviews.Content: Grand Hyatt has always provide consistently high quality service . . to the point I know what to expect and to be assured of a comfortable stay. It is for this reason that I returned to Grand Hyatt on a recent trip.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB service”
Reviews.Author: jwsmd3
Reviews.Content: A little problem with the Air Condioning met with a RAPID response and when the result was not adequate followed up with an upgrade and a very present, concerned management staff. I've travelled a lot and cannot remember any hotel being so concerned that I was happy and satisfied! A phone call, a little box of chocolates and a sincere apology have turned me into a Hyatt devotee! From check in to check out the staff was OUTSTANDING! The less expensive, newer rooms have a cool desing with two way closets, a drawer safe that will fit your laptop and artful touches. Pool area is very nice. Stayed in room in new building wish was terrific and in the older "junior suite" building, also fabulous! The breakfast buffet is SPLENDID, varied and abundant. Location: if you are a shopper you can't do better. For cultrual interests perhaps closer to the marina or the Raffles hotel would be better. But mass transit is efficient and easy.

Reviews.Title: “expensive but worth it”
Reviews.Author: jontowel
Reviews.Content: the Grand Deluxe King cost me $450. but the service and the room is worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great service. Great food.”
Reviews.Author: denisejw_trip
Reviews.Content: Al round this was a terrific hotel. Mezzane 9 had delicious food. The staff were more than efficient and friendly. The amenities for guests were superior to most hotels. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: rhonda21australia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here at on the 6 June for 4 days this was more a business hotel but it was great every one of the staff couldnt have been more friendlier or helpful. The pool area is fantastic and when you get out of the lift you face a glass wall which has a beautifull waterfall and fernery, We stayed in a grand room which was spacious and the bathroom was really nice, the bed was really comfortable. We had the buffet breakfast which was in the straites kitchen it would have to been one of the best we've ever had there was just so much to choose from. We tried the buffet dinner in the straites kitchen it was really good and was always nearly fully booked the only thing you need to be aware of this hotel does not serve lard or pork or bacon. Its location is just off Orchard Road. The gym is really good, you get free bottled water there. In each corridor they have free fruit at the end of the passage also lounge chairs and tables to sit at and a phone if you wish to use it. The rooms were always cleaned early. The television had 48 channels so plenty to choose from to watch at night if your in. They have a cigar shop. There is also another big restaurant upstairs it looked lovely we did not eat there. For cheap eating he Ion centre is not bad but Tangs have a takeway area and thats really cheap. If your a buffett nut then Singapore is your place. Would definately recommend this hotel it is a really modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “just Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jonesms
Reviews.Content: Great customer service from the moment you walk in the door! Rooms are bright, spacious, light wood and the carpets make it very cosy. We were fortunate that we were upgraded to a suite. The size and lighting was extremely well done, marble bathroom spacious. The rooms are beautiful, but the location is also perfect. The pool and restaurant area was lovely and gym equipment very modern. I actually cannot think of any negative to comment. Just don't think twice about booking it!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room and friendly and helpful staffs”
Reviews.Author: gemartraveling
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended hotel for bringing your family. The rooms are spacious with complete amenities including iron and ironing board. Family of four can stay in 1 room (choose the grand deluxe room for comfy and spacious). Friendly staffs from the receptionist, concierge, even the housekeeping staffs with limited English will be willingly to help and serve you the best. The food are nice and delicious. Many variety for breakfast at the straits kitchen cafe. For Moslem people most of the food are considered Halal. Very convenient location from orchard road since there is underpass to go to Ngee Ann, Isetan, Ion and even borders bookstore!! Choose Grand Hyatt Hotel for family vacation!! You won't be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable Service Quality”
Reviews.Author: DinDing
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights there last week for my business trip. In the 2nd night, I returned to the Hotel around 8:30pm after a long day of work to drop off some personal stuffs before heading to dinner. When I entered the room, the smell in the room is very unpleasant, so I looked around and checked out where the smell came from. When I opened the tiolet door, I found out there's a piece of excrement(yes, it's a real excrement, not too sure it's human or dog only) on the floor. It's really shocked me and I called Housekeeping immediate after clam down. After hearing the story, the Hotel send a Supervisor and 1 general staff to come to my room. Then, I left for dinner. When I returned to the Hotel, I went to the Front Desk and looked for the Hotel Manager. The receptionist told me that I need to make appointment to speak to thier Manager. I told them that I don't mind saying it loud with all your hotel guests surrounding me, it's a complaint, and obviously won't be something nice and cool. I him what I found in my room, and the Receptionist is astonished and opened his mouth wide for 10 seconds.Then, an on-duty spervisor came over and offered to a room change. However, I told them that I'm checking out tomorrow morning, and I won't bother to change the room. So he offered me a free ride to the airport and helped me to go up and checked the room. When he returned, he tried to jog down some notes and explained to me the process for the car arrangement. Up to this moment, I'm happy with what Grand Hyatt has done.However, the next morning, when I was about to leave the room, I saw a blinking light on the phone, I dialed "Concierge" to check the message, because this's what the Supervisor told me last night about the procedure. When the Concerige picked up the phone and I disclosed my room # and asked for the message. The Conceirge said she didn't know what's the message and she's away from the terminal and asked me to call Operator. When I called Operator, they asked me to call Concierge to make the arrangment. I told the Operator that i just talked to the Concierge and she asked me to call Operator. Then, the Operator replied that she's just relaying the message, nother she can arrange,so I need to call Concierge. I think this's what I cannot afford is the poor and unprofessional service of a 5-star Hotel like Grand Hyatt. Not talking about why there's a piece of excrement on the floor, I really wonder the security of the Hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home...”
Reviews.Author: elguwapo316
Reviews.Content: We went to Singapore for a couple of days and stayed at this great hotel. From the moment we arrived, we felt that we were very much welcome. This was the first time that me & my wife traveled with our 2 yr. old boy - and we were quite surprised that he felt at home the moment he stepped in the room. Grand Hyatt is conveniently located on Scotts Rd. and is (literally) a few steps away from the Orchard Rd. MRT Station. If you're planning to go to any of Singapore's attractions (i.e. Zoo, Bird Park etc.) the hotel also serves as a pick-up point and a direct stop of the Singapore Attractions Express Bus. So, going around and about the city is not a problem. And, since the hotel is situated almost at Orchard Rd., one can go on a shopping spree as a lot of malls are around the vicinity. We stayed in a very spacious Junior Suite with 2 LCD TV's - a 42" TV with DVD player in the living room and another 32" TV in the bedroom, where all channels are in HD. We had complimentary wi-fi access, a spacious closet, and a very appealing toilet & bath with June Jacobs amenities. Simply nice! We tucked our nights away in a very comfortable king size bed. Light controls and Air-conditioning were not a problem, with the switches and temperature knob located conveniently by the side table. Since we were staying in a suite, we were given access to the Club Lounge (with kids' play area), where continental breakfast was served everyday and cocktails was served every night. Needless to say that Club access means free flowing drinks - ALL DAY. The lounge staff were so accommodating. Going to the pool was such a treat when one sees the nice tranquil water falls in the middle of the two towers. The pool was nice and had cabanas where you can sit back and relax. Overall, our stay in Grand Hyatt is superb, and, as such, is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you can expect from Singapour”
Reviews.Author: michelmontreux
Reviews.Content: This hotel has seen many transformations since I first visited in 1983. A bit 'cold' but it remains my favourite in SIN, with its location, close to the metro and shopping area. Excellent fitness center also and the pool is a nice place to relax during the week-end.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what to make of it...”
Reviews.Author: EdmondUK
Reviews.Content: Here's why: Warned of hot water suspension between midnight & 4 am (I think) but turned out still not working by the time I had to take a shower in the morning before catching a flight to HK! Unthinkable and shockingly bad, for a 5-star establishment... Modern, stylish room except the WC, which has exposed pipework :-S Nice, airy lobby but there is nowhere comfortable to sit so one has to go to the coffee bar upstairs... Room service food was bland especially the Hainanese Chicken Rice... Good selection of freshly cooked Asian and Western food at buffet breakfast saved the day! Fantastic location just off Orchard Road, with two 7-11 within a minute walk. Better than Shangri La but I might give Fullerton a go instead next time around...

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money but not very cosy”
Reviews.Author: JoeDanski
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt is a fantastic hotel, but gave us the feeling to be more of a business hotel, then a place where you want to spend a romantic couple of days. The rooms are spacious and full of luxuary, high speed internet works perfectly and was added free-of-charge. We could also get an early check-in at 9a which was great after a night of flying from Chennai. The restaurant is inside without garden and with rather cold and dark atmosphere, not very cosy. No bar. The garden and swimming pool are nicely done but not very large. I spend a couple of months earlier in the Shangri-La and would recommend that one for leisure, the Hyatt for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: seda79
Reviews.Content: Location: Could not be better - right at the intersection of Scotts Rd and Orchard Rd. (smack in the middle of the major shopping and entertainment area) Restaurants & Bar: Beautiful F&B outlets and especially Mezza9 is highly recommendable. Huge menu selection and especially great charcoal grilled meats. Mezza9 Bar is very cozy and relaxing with a great selection of international beers. Rooms & amenities: Spacious and well-appointed, nice bright bathrooms with good amenities. Internet is chargeable at 25$ which I thought was very expensive considering that many places are providing WIFI or LAN for free these a days. Service: Overall very attentive and hospitable staff. Had a small problem with my booking and was passed from one person to the next which could have been handled much smoother. A “one stop shop” would have been much appreciated here. Verdict: Very good but could be excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly spacious!”
Reviews.Author: citoyennea
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in several Hyatt properties over the last few months, I was pleasantly surprised by the space and fresh new look of the hotel. If you are in Singapore as a tourist, this is well located as it is just off Orchard Road and the hop on hop off buses all stop in front of the Marriott, which is next to the Hyatt. Although I do not believe the hotel is new, the room was nicely renovated and SPACIOUS. I booked a standard king size room and it included a sunlight filled nook where the computer desk was located as well as a sitting area with a couch on the other side. I like the modern look of the room with the beech wood accents throughout. The bathroom is especially spacious and includes a double access closet, separate shower and tub, along with enclosed WC within the bathroom. The toiletries are in abundance. I do not like hotels where they skimp on giving you adequate shampoo or shower gel. I appreciated how the safe was as well as minibar were integrated into the drawers, which created a very visually appealing and clean look. The Club Lounge was also spacious and lively. The evening hors d'oeuvres were substantial.The breakfast was abundant. I appreciated the "generosity" of this hotel as water is plentiful as well as daily fruit and chocolate. Room service is bit costly; however, everything is quite costly in Singapore. With that being said, the service was efficient and the food was excellent. I would return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location, and Great Food.”
Reviews.Author: dxb67
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying in this hotel it was perfect. The location was in the middle of the shopping area just few steps away from Orchard road. The service was excellent and the staff were welcoming and very helpful. The Indian kitchen in the main lobby restaurant was one of the best I had and for Muslim's the food served in this restaurant was Halal.

Reviews.Title: “Good sized rooms, abundant buffet breakfast”
Reviews.Author: DDCHK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 2 connecting rooms and the size was good, enough for 2 suitcases to be simply left open on the floor. My family loved the buffet breakfast with several stations from the traditional eggs, cereal and fruit to the local Singaporean, Malaysian and Indian fare. The front desk could tend to get crowded if you chance upon other travellers at the same time. There seems to be only 2 at the time we checked in so had to wait a while. Perfect location for shopping as it is practically on the corner of Orchard and Scotts road. While we were there though the building next to it was being constructed to ask for a room on the other side, although that should be completed by now.

Reviews.Title: “Very efficient, great location”
Reviews.Author: simonbg
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a "Grand Duplex Suite" for three nights. Ridiculously enormous amount of space for two people, and masses of closet space, different kinds of furniture (sofas, chairs, etc.) created a very relaxing space to relax and chill out after hard efforts shopping and eating outside the hotel. The room was on the 20th and 21st floor. The hotel lift runs up to the 20th floor, so you can enter the suite from there into the living area, then walk up the internal staircase to the bedroom/bathroom/closet area, and out another door there onto the 21st floor, which takes you to the location of the club lounge. Service and food there were very efficient for breakfast, and also a nice place to come for tea/coffee and cookies/cakes during the day. The only negative during the stay was that the internet service was out for almost an entire day (from early morning to about 4pm) - they had no access from anywhere in the hotel. Was only an annoyance for us (on holiday), but could have been a real killer for anyone hosting a business meeting at the hotel. We came back to the room that evening to find a packet of biscotti and an apology card, which was a nice touch. I booked their "premiere arrival service" from the airport, which is a lot of money compared to just getting a regular taxi, but quite an experience on arrival at the airport. An buggy met us at the airbridge directly as we got off the plane, drove us through the airport to a private terminal at the airport, with its own passport control desk, then we waited in a lounge drinking tea until called to our car, with the suitcases magically already in the back, and drove out of their private airport exit and off to the hotel. Completely unnecessary, and probably took longer than just collecting your own cases and jumping in a taxi, but quite a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Truly 5-star in Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: MissHK2009
Reviews.Content: All things are top notch: service, location (on Scott Road where Orchard Road is just at the turn), decor (there is a waterfall), room (clean, very spacious, good design, well equipped, bed comfy), swimming pool looks good (though we didn't try). Truly 5-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Always the best”
Reviews.Author: heiress29
Reviews.Content: As always, Hyatt exceeds all expectation...fast check in check out, polite and corteous staff, the rooms are large with modern amenties and very clean. The location is perfect! Just around the corner is the Orchard road. Right across is DutyFree store.

Reviews.Title: “Great Locaion and Restaurants”
Reviews.Author: RKS_Travellers
Reviews.Content: A terrific hotel in a great location coupled with a some very nice restaurant options. Stayed here for 4 nights and thoroughly enjoyed the stay, great service, spacious rooms and of course nothing is too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Its Hyatt, always at your service”
Reviews.Author: rwintour
Reviews.Content: This review actually I should have posted by end of last year. But however will be useful for other members. My traveling time was during a peak season last October 2010, after the Islamic Lebaran. Singapore must have been roamed by Indonesian travelers and every hotel was fully booked and busy. Thats might be the cause of such disappointment happened in the late afternoon (6.00 PM) and our room (Junior Suite) was not ready yet. I traveled with my senior aged parents for general check up in Spore, my mom at her 67 was tired and upset since the room was not ready... (we booked a month in advance). But Hyatt led us to use the club lounge but then we found out it was not the club lounge but the meeting room across the lounge (what a joke), then after called on the reception staff they provided us with other spare room for us to lay down till 9.00 PM when our reserved room was ready. Well, this was not good start of the 1st night with Hyatt, but then they compensated us with this and that to express their apology. Well it worked and accepted the offers. It was their best to welcome us staying there and I appreciate how they handled us and respected my mom's condition who stayed there to see her doctor. Very high standard of service of Hyatt The rest was just a pleasant stay and relaxing. Its very Hyatt... Love to stay there again and no worries for how they will take care of us

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel at perfect (leisure) location, lacking customer focus”
Reviews.Author: Stakkato
Reviews.Content: I am a seasoned traveller both for Business and Leisure; please read my profile to put this review in to perspective. I stayed at the Hyatt a couple of times over the past 2-3 years for 2-3 nights respectively, mostly for leisure trips. I also used to live in Singapore at some point for 5 years. The Hyatt in Singapore is probably the 'Grandest' hotel in the City, at the busy intersection of Scotts and Orchard Road. The location is the strongest point of the Hyatt; for shopping fans, it is a 3 minute stroll to the latest and largest malls. For business, it depends on the location of your meetings; there are other hotels closer to the 2 or 3 areas in the city where most offices are located. The lobby is always bustling with activity, particularly towards the evenings; the restaurants are good and the Sunday Champagne brunch one of the best in the City. Overall design is nice, the gym solid and the pool area not bad. The rooms are very big and the bathroom spacious. However, the first major drawback is the quality or lack thereof of the interior; while the bathroom is nice though has limited towels and the bathtub is short, the bright wood of which everything in the main room, from the floor to the cupboards, desks, wall decoration etc is made of, is not very classy and quite run down. The bed is very good. My room had a view not worth mentioning into some old high rise condos whose inhabitants had a good view of my room interior. The phone and most items inside the room where a bit outdated, though the TV and programs where good. The second point of critique and for me the biggest drawback is the noise levels. Noise regularly woke my up early, coming from a) the outside, with the windows not very well noise-insulated; luckily, to this end, my room was towards the more quiet hotel backside; b) some form of renovation that must have been going on from about 7am somewhere above me, adding to the problem of lack of customer focus I will discuss next; c) noisy pipes ie someone flushing above your room resulting in a 1-2 minute soud in your bathroom; and d) lack of noise insulation at the door, which made you very much feel part of the conversation going on outside in the hallways while lying in your bed. Many of the louder conversations of this type appeared to be driven by staff walking by, which gets me to the 3rd point of critique Aside from the receptionist, the staff overall seemed very sloppy. General attitude was a chatty, careless unfocusedness, people were very hard to understand particularly on the phone and training seemed not up to scratch. This is surprising in one of the world’s premiere hotel chains in a well-educated wealthy country. Room service was expensive and actually pretty shocking. Overall, these negatives gave me the feeling that I am not getting what I pay for (given the place is not cheap) and apart from the hustling and bustling feel in the lobby and the size of the room there is limited 'wow' factor here. Next time I'll try the Marriott which is just next door, and for business the Conrad or the Ritz. In hindsight, I wonder why I went here so many times.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Huzmohd
Reviews.Content: I had taken 3 suites and probably this is the 3rd time i am staying here as its got everything at its doorstep. There is a 7/11 right next to it, a Burger King, a KFC and some texmex joint. Overall an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Superb 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: rsriram9
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best 5 star hotels in Singapore in a great location with spacious, elegant rooms, excellent service, efficient check-in and check-out and a fantastic daily breakfast spread in their StraitsKitchen restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great central location”
Reviews.Author: dropandflop
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights on business in a suite room. Hotel check-in was fast and efficient with an explaination of facilities. Room was a 1 br with walk-in wardrobe with the usual desk, chair, lounge, flatscreen TV in sitting room plus another in bedroom. There was also a DVD player. Bathroom had a seperate toilet as well as a dedicated shower (no bath). Overall bathroom was very spacious. Bed was a king size and comfortable with a good selection of pillows. There were 2 air-cons with their own controls (bedroom and sitting room). Room was well cleaned each day. Ate breakfast at hotel. Food was nice with a wide selection from Asian to western. Wifi was included and it was a fast connection. Check-out was again fast and efficient with an offer to call a taxi. In summary, a well located hotel with good service all-round. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel just off Orchard”
Reviews.Author: GagsDelhi
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt (It used to be the Hyatt Singapore earlier) is right in the middle of the action that is Orchard Road. Its location on Scotts Road within a minute's walk to Orchard is even more divine. They have renovated most of the rooms and most of these are now modern with all the amenities you expect in them. There are also nice extras in the room including amenities that you can think of in the Bathroom. I have eaten in the Straits Kitchen which serves Breakfast and Linch and Dinner Buffets too and the food, service and choice is absolutely to die for. The Italian restaurant (I think Pete's Place) again serves great food. The only thing is that the decor hasnt changed in the 15 years that I have been coming. The location makes it great for lots of quick shopping and which also means that there's always a croowd around Scotts Road. Once you are in the Hotel, you are in a different world.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a Grand Experience”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarrior90
Reviews.Content: Grand Hyatt has a very pleasent ambience with staff which is very friendly and attentive. Rooms are very well arranged and we personally liked the rain showers in the bathrooms. There is lot of variety for food but it is very expensive and outside market you get very hygenic and pocket friendly tasty food. Grand Hyatt has taken care of every necessity that a tourist will need and has provided everything in room. Overall I highly recommend this hotel. Note: If you are staying in Grand Hyatt better is to use train to commute within Singapore as TAXI will charge you for additional toll of Orchard street.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in town with its location close to Orchard Rd, the main commercial street”
Reviews.Author: LuneLune
Reviews.Content: I spent weeks in total for the last years at this hotel and always appreciated the professionalism of the staff and the overall quality of the service. The breakfast is the best in town (I tried most of the five stars in town) in terms of food choice and freshness at the Straits Kitchen and their Mezza9 restaurant is excellent too. The only weakness is the view from the rooms which is a bit disappointing (the Balinese garden is too often in renovation and there are building under construction all around the hotel) but globally this hotel is the best choice in Singapore for a good mix business / leisure unless you look for pure business (then chose the hotels close to Raffles Place) or pure leisure (then chose hotels on Sentosa Island). Its Club floor is quiet and ideal for business meetings. The hotel has an excellent spa centre (clean, modern and well equipped) and a quiet swimming pool area (not deep though as everywhere by Law in Singapore) in the middle of a nice garden.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Straits Kitchen - shame about the office-building-like lobby and unmanaged front desk”
Reviews.Author: ChristianMoss
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. Straits Kitchen - for dinner and for breakfast. Great quality, choice and service. 2. Location - just off the main drag. 3. Nice spa. 4. Quiet rooms. Cons: 1. Don't get the sense that the hotel is managed or that anyone is in charge. This particularly applies to reception. 2. The hotel rooms have low ceilings and appear poorly maintained. In short, they are more of Hyatt Regency standard than Grand Hyatt. 3. Service (front desk/concierge) very inconsistent.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mungo888
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here in November - travelling on business. The location is spot on - in the heart of the city with easy access by taxi or MRT to all points. Loads of shopping and restaurants nearby. Rooms and bathrooms very good and very clean. Didnt try any of the food. Little pricey compared to other Singapore 5star hotels. Would choose to stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel, outstanding service, brilliant food”
Reviews.Author: typebug
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a Club Deluxe King suite with a view of the garden below. We thought the layout and interior architecture of the hotel was beautifully done and our suite impeccably well appointed. We could not have been more comfortable. The staff from the moment we arrived completely raised the bar for service. We travel and stay in this level of accommodation fairly frequently and this simply blew us away. Well spoken and polite people answered the phones for room service, kept track of who we were, what we had previously ordered and asked how we'd enjoyed our last ________ without seeming to be reading from a promt. The serving staff glided in and out with trays of some of the best food we've had in Singapore since. I still can't get a coffee that's anywhere near Hyatt perfection anywhere else in town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: MarlinaIndonesia
Reviews.Content: this is the first time we stay in Grand Hyatt Singapore (usually we stay in Meritus Mandarin),the staff service in this hotel is very excellent.When we stayed,my wife have sickness and she vommit all night....the staff help us to contact doctor,taxi and hospital..after my wife come back from hospital,the duty manager called us and asked if everything is ok..and give us fruits too... thank you very much for all kindness,helpfull and friendly staff of Grand Hyatt Singapore..especially to Mr.Anumodit Chaturvedi and friends which duty in that night..thank you very much

Reviews.Title: “Worth staying at Hyatt, a heart of singapore”
Reviews.Author: WorldWorthEnjoying
Reviews.Content: Nilesh Shah - Mar 2011 We have many client in Singapore and after staying and trying out various hotel we finally we found one of the best hotel service in Singapore as Hyatt. The kind of deal we get at Hyatt is THE BEST in Singapore. We stay for long duration as 2-3 weeks at time. The room are so big enough that we don’t feel at home. The location of hotel is right in centre / heart of city that everything from hotel is just at walkable distance. The best thing in hotels are: 1. Italian restaurant of hotel is one of the best in Singapore 2. Internet speed is to fast 3. Night club 4. Excellent option in breakfast Worth to stay in Hyatt

Reviews.Title: “5 star quality at a 5 star price”
Reviews.Author: BigRuss1213
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for at this hotel, Great service, excellent restaurants and bars. Happy hour in the Martini bar is heaven on earth. Some problems with electronics in the room,I.e. hotel tv system crashed one night but they called everybody in the hotel and apologized and gave eveyone a box of chocolates - very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: DC_travellers
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean, and updated rooms. Bathroom is new and large. Staff was very friendly and always willing to lend a hand. There is also a pretty good gym at the hotel, which is open at odd hours. Very nice for those with "jet-lag." I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “a dreadful room”
Reviews.Author: awaytonight
Reviews.Content: as a platinum member of the Hyatt "gold passport" program I normally get assigned an OK room at Hyatt hotels (this is, after all, one of the reasons for joining such a program and remaining loyal to a chain). But here I was assigned a room underneath the Club Lounge so whenever the lounge is open (ie from 6 am every morning) my room rang with the noise of chairs being moved in the room above. Furthermore, the previous guests' hairs in the bathroom were off putting.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Albela_Musafir
Reviews.Content: It was a one day stopover trip to Singapore for me, and i wanted to stay at a place which is close to the tourist spot, and gives me comfortable stay. I have stayed in Hyatt in other locations before and this experience at Hyatt also turned out be good. The hotel is close to Scott road metro station and thus provides a very good connectivity with the airport. I took the metro too to come to Hotel. The Hotel has a great ambience. Room was pretty decent size with windows facing towards Scott Road. The Hotel staff is very courteous. Food and drinks are great too. Lots of choices for breakfast. Would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay; great hotel”
Reviews.Author: max_umami
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for a three-day work trip. The facilities were great -- common areas and rooms were cool/contemporary and appeared to be recently refurbished. The hotel's restaurants were excellent. The fitness center was clean, relatively big and well appointed. There is also a popular mezannine bar and basement nightclub in the property. If I did not have to go to work, I would not have left th hotel:) I have stayed at several places in town and the Grand Hyatt was the best mix of luxury and features for the money.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable, well positioned hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aliceandeve
Reviews.Content: We relocated here from the Concorde down the road and were very glad we did so. Other than the obvious hike in price.everything was very much to our pleasing and the old addage about getting what you pay for rang true. This is a great choice if you need somewhere reliable and are willing to pay a little extra.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the Heart of the City!”
Reviews.Author: SeoulRob
Reviews.Content: As a Diamond Member of the Hyatt I expect exceptional service and the Grand Hyatt Singapore offered that and more. From the personal in-room check in to the wait staff in the business lounge knowing my children's names within an hour from checking made us feel at home. We had house keeping contact us for a room cleaning. When I explained my 7 yr old son wasn't feeling well, one of the managers came to the room with a personal get well card and cookies. Well done! The location is excellent and the buffet is well priced and delicious. My only suggestion for improvement is having a dedicated door person. Often there was a door person, however, it seemed as if it was just a staff employee getting the door for you. Regardless, it is a first class act - kudos to the GM and the rest of the staff. Thank you for making our vacation much more special.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel so far”
Reviews.Author: Wilibona
Reviews.Content: I would rate this hotel among th best that I have stayed so far. In line with Andaz Wall Street and Sofitel Bangkok. Granted it is not cheap, although I am using Gold Points, it is lots of points, but I think it is worth it (my wife and kids also agree with me). The goods: 1. We are staying in the Club Room, so it comes with daily breakfast and evening 'snack' (not quite full dinner but can get you full anyway). The floor is only accessible to guest so I guess it is pretty secure and quite. Although the lobby can be very crowded. 2. The room is huge and extremely clean, and with a separate small area for work. Wireless connection is amazing. The bathroom is even more wow. The sheets are really soft, and the towels are THICK and soft. My kids will complain if we came back to the hotel after 19:00 because they will feel they do not have enough 'quality' time in the room. 3. The service is great. I am not sure if it is because of the fact that we are staying at the club floor, but no complains from me. 4. The food is also OK, the breakfast and the evening snack. 5. The pool is rather small, although the layout is great if you have kids. There is a section for kids, where you can watch them all the time while you are swimming. 6. Location: Orchard Road, the best area in Singapore for Tourist. And about 100 meters from the entrance to Orchard MRT or 50 meters from Bus stops. Can't ask for anything better. The only drawback of the location is that getting a taxi will cost you an additional $3 or 5$ because it is located ion CBD. The bads: 1. With the points we are using I would kind of expect that the 2 twin beds are not really a twin but rather a 'full' or 'queen' size, but unfortunately they are just twin beds. I am travelling with 2 young kids, so it is quite challenging to arrange. 2. Not sure if I should complain about this or not, but I am just trying to do my part for the environment by not washing my towel every day. The towels here are really thick. I came back at 13:00, the room is already made up. I took a quick shower and went out. I came back again around 17:00 and the towels are already being replaced with new ones. Left a note to re-use my towels the next day, but off course I am still getting new ones. That's it.

Reviews.Title: “True luxury”
Reviews.Author: made_in_ukraine
Reviews.Content: This must be one of the best luxury hotels in Singapore. While price can be somewhat daunting, the hotel is worth every single penny. It is located very close to major shopping areas, some 5-10 minutes away from Orchard MRT Station. The real highlight of the hotel is the outdoor pool which seems to be open until midnight. While during the daytime, the humidity is crazy and spending time at the pool is not the best idea, spending time after 18:00 at the pool is just what a body may need after a long working day. The room is spacious, clean, and modern. The style is minimalistic, but efficient. I did not try breakfast, since there were other (cheaper) options to have meal outside the hotel. In sum, for business travellers, this is a great place for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “best location,hottest night club”
Reviews.Author: ahmedta7
Reviews.Content: i have stayed for 2 nights in Singapore, which was not enough, choose Hyatt because of location,every thing in the hotel was amazing and perfect but the hotel is expensive and i think as many 5 stars hotels soulless , concierge desk was very helpful , orchard road was dreamlike .

Reviews.Title: “Impressive on all fronts!”
Reviews.Author: CaroAust
Reviews.Content: As a reasonably seasoned traveller I am disappointed more often than I'm impressed with supposed five star hotels, however the Grand Hyatt Singapore is an exception. From the moment of arrival, this hotel delivers. I travelled with my family (including a two year old) but also required business services, so I experienced the hotel from a leisure and corporate perspective. The facilities are second-to-none and the staff are so incredibly helpful. It's a hotel that delivers all the expected trappings of an inner-city five star, yet so much more. It is an oasis in the heart of Singapore, with it's beautiful pool and tropical surrounds, yet it offers the minimalist slickness of a corporate environment. This hotel has found the clever balance of pleasing both business and leisure travellers. Having stayed at a few five star hotels in Singapore, including the reputed Shangri La, the Grand Hyatt is by far the very best and a hotel I will return to over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: EllyN_08
Reviews.Content: Stayed for business for a week in the junior suite and happy with the spacious room.The room is equipped with Olfsen and Bang TV and Stereo, which is rather impressive. Tried the food at the Mezza9, Straits kitchen and Pete's Place and I must say they were all great! Since I was quite busy in the hotel for conference, the location was great for a quick shopping after.. as it is very close to Orchard Road. And if you need to take the MRT, it is just a bit of walk to get there. The business center was really well equipped and I love the fact they serve illy coffee! Love my stay there and would definitely come back even for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Just as amazing as possible”
Reviews.Author: rachit389
Reviews.Content: If one was going to Singapore and one has a high budget then this hotel is definitely what a person should be looking at. This hotel spells the epitome of hospitality and grace. Everything from our welcome to out departure was looked after properly! Indeed it is also situated at the best location of Singapore and therefore is convenient for tourists.! Special mention should be give about the staff who is extra courteous. I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone who is wanting to relax or rejuvenate themselves on a trip to SIngapore. PS: The Damai is also worth checking out as it is too good!

Reviews.Title: “My second business stay in 3 months and I will stay again, enough said”
Reviews.Author: PC2
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Grand Hyatt 3 times now and twice in the last 3 months with each stay being for two weeks so that says I like it and I will return to this hotel again. Likes. Service - I always find the service and attitude of the staff excellent from check-in to check-out. Hyatt should be commended for their training and other hotels could learn from this. Quality of the furnishings, buisness and wooden floors, so much cleaner than carpet. Location - is excellent for Orchard road as it's less than 2 minutes walk to Orchard MRT. Dislike Minor point but the hotel bars within the hotel lack atmosphere, but if you're in Singapore why do you want to sit inside a hotel bar anyway. Some of the rooms have a dissapointing view

Reviews.Title: “Still Exceptional, Great for Business or Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Public_Dave
Reviews.Content: I used to come to this hotel often as a kid in the 1980s, going with my parents or friends to Pete's place, the Nutmeg fine dining restaurant (now replaced by Mezza Nine) or the Cafe (now called Straits Kitchen) and then as a teen to Branigan's (now replaced by Brix). I stayed here once in the 1990s and thought it was pretty nice. When I was to attend a conference at the hotel I had no hesitation in booking a room. When one pulls up you immediately see the unusual diagonal doorways to the hotel (which had been recommended by a feng shui expert after having problems after opening many years ago). The entrance is spare, immaculate, and feels uncrowded and exclusive despite being in the heart of the city. On the right are the check-in staff; there were at least 4 staff on hand and there was no line; they were very quick to retrieve my booking, and because I was checking in in the morning, relieved me of my bags right there and promised to bring them up to my room when it was ready. The conference facilities are professionally managed, considering the large number of people in attendance the buffet lunches were actually very good, catering also for the Indian delegates (some of whom were vegetarians). The room was very large for central Singapore, and turned a potentially odd layout into a bonus, with a separate area for a desk overlooking a residential building. The view wasn't great but in a way made me feel like I was living in Singapore again. The bathroom was generously sized, new and spotless. I thought the Straits Kitchen restuarant at breakfast was excellent, I particularly liked the Indian dishes, and their red bean pastries. I normally stay near the business district, but I think the Hyatt is a very solid choice given its excellent staff quality, good restaurants and central location, especially if you like shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Better value elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: lemursydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt with our 1.5 year old, the room size is good and provided our duaghter space to run around (we booked the Grand deluxe king room with a separate living area), however the quality of the room furnishing is not 5 star with chipped furniture and the bathroom was grotty and old, basically the room needs to be refurbished relative to the price they charge. We had to ask the cleaner to come back to the room to clean the bathtub again, but then realised that the stains are permanent from old wear and tear. We found the Mandarin Oriental to be much better value for money and it has fully been refurbished. Location wise both the Mandarin and Hyatt are are in handy locations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,Great Environment,Great Team,real family inner city retreat with thin walls in the standard room wing”
Reviews.Author: liptonst
Reviews.Content: Great Location, Great Environment, Great Team, real family inner city retreat with thin walls in the standard room wing, but great insulation in the suites wing Grand Hyatt Singapore stands out as unique in Singapore for me due to the relaxing, well kept modern clean cut environment from lobby, elevators, hallways and the magnificent indoor waterfall. Presenting spacious clean comfortable rooms and suites, provided with extra luxury, quality bed, mattress, comforter, pillows and linen with strong sun blocking curtains as standard. Making the deal here very much in the patrons favor. Beware of the standard rooms offering very poor insulation from the noise of rooms next door and the hallway, which is why I can only recommend the suites here which are free from noise pollution/ Highly Recommended suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great improvement!”
Reviews.Author: London-Lourson
Reviews.Content: Wow, what an improvement compared to last year! Great location, good restaurants and nice rooms. It's worth mentioning the improvement in service. Now they can call themselves a Grand Hyatt. Recommended for holiday! For other stays in Singapore, check out my posts for Conrad and Sands.

Reviews.Title: “Generally comfortable stay but bell captain / concierge could do better”
Reviews.Author: theavidtraveller
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Grand Hyatt Singapore. In a competitive environment this Hyatt is priced at the top end of the range for hotels in Singapore competing against some of the big chain names and new hotels. Rooms The room was large and modern with wooden floors, desk, large marble bathroom and plenty of facilities. The only downside to the room was that if the bathroom door was left open at night, you could hear the plumbing everytime someone flushed the toilet or took a shower. This was easily rectified by closing the door Service I experienced some poor service issues during my stay but on complaining to the duty manager I was pleased to see that my concerns were quickly and effectively dealt with. I feel confident that the management does listen to its guests especially when issues arise. Downside - no free wifi Room service I ordered room service and I was suprised at the generous size of the portion. It took about 35 minutes to get to me at 11pm at night. Club lounge Very basic facilities. Breakfast was a huge dissapointment - it consisted of chicken sausage, scrambled egg, tomatoes, cereals and breads. That's it. No local foods, very limited hot food, not even close to what's on offer downstairs in the main restaurant. Bell captain The issue I had was with the bell captain / front door staff. When staying in a high-end property you at least expect someone to be there to help with your luggage and open the door. This was not the case on arrival. Additionally, on leaving the hotel to the airport, the person in charge of the taxi queue (who was there this time) quickly shuffled us to the side and plonked us into a waiting taxi (by-passing the normal queue). I was suspcious at this and asked whether we were getting into a normal taxi.. his response was yes. The reality was that it was a more expensive metered taxi (there are apparently two grades in singapore), while I suspected this and don't mind paying the extra 50% to the airport for a slightly nicer car, I was very very disappointed to be deliberately mis-led by the hotel employee. I do not expect this in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice - beautifully located, upscale modern look, brilliant dining opitons and good pool.”
Reviews.Author: beauchamptraveller
Reviews.Content: We travelled with our two children ageas 6 and 9, and we were able to get two interconnecting rooms at the Grand Hyatt in Singapore at what we thought was a reasonable rate for this level of hotel. The decor was really pleasing, cool and modern. The hotel provided a babysitter for us on two nights at an extra charge. Our children absolutely adored the pool which has lovely tropical garden landscaping around it and a very, very nice poolside restaurant which does fresh juices, cocktails and a variety of pan asian food options. I had the noodle soup several times which was very spicy and full of asian veggies and somehow felt quite healthy. There are a number of upmarket restaurants at the hotel including mezza9, with excellent service and willingness to accommodate food allergies (although we were seated next to a dissapated western man who was leering at his asian date, who looked about nine years old - ew.) The staff were polite and helpful and the breakfast congee we had from room service was great too - no complaints, only good things to say about the Hyatt. Excellent choice in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Executive Suites are excellent”
Reviews.Author: TravelTiger2010
Reviews.Content: Great location, good service and very clean. The Club level is great with a good choice of food and drinks. Good size room with separate living space.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable business trip stay experience”
Reviews.Author: baligirl57
Reviews.Content: I was there for 3 days trip for business meeting, and love the hotel location so much already, as was very easy to walk around in Orchard Road - where is the main activities are. Furthermore, the restaurants and bars they have - was amazing, especially the Martini Bar and The Brix. The atmosphere and the band they have there was great, and the crowd and overall was worth it to spend the nights there. Coming from Bali where we also have many great bars and lounge, I will say both Martini Bar and The Brix are similiar atmosphere with Kudeta. Where you wll find yourself enjoy so much the atmosphere and the best is after the late night, you just need to walk upstairs to go back to your room. I will come back for sure to this hotel on my next business or leisure trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect business hotel right in the centre of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: ChamUk
Reviews.Content: Very modern and well appointed with very fast check in, good room, and nice breakfast Other reviews have noted the downstairs Brix bar is frequented by ladies of the night. I found that seemed true (fact of life in a hotel like this in SE Asia) but was not a big deal. However the prices of drinks scared me to another watering hole - there are many, very near by. Great location for all the big shops too if you have an hour or so between meetings and the airport. Found morning taxi service very efficient too.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location with great service”
Reviews.Author: London026
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 8 nights. Travelled with our six month old child, the staff is very friendly and accomodating. We had booked a suite with a sitting area, which was very handy. The room looks exactly as shown on the website, the bedroom and bathroom are in great condition. Our package included breakfast at the restaurant and it was a great spread. The room service menu feels a bit limited. THe italian restaurant is quite a letdown. overall very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: shantichop
Reviews.Content: As with most Hyatt hotels, excellent rooms & service! Very brief walking distance from main shopping street.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location , very easy”
Reviews.Author: aajt2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed a few times and always find it very easy with young children. Food on site is good and its only a short walk to cafes etc if you want to go out. Service is usually great although back office admin can be a bit wrong occasionally.

Reviews.Title: “STAY HERE. IT'S A HOLIDAY IN ITSELF”
Reviews.Author: miserygutz
Reviews.Content: Forget the cost, look at the value. This is our favorite hotel in Singapore & it is a fabulous place to break the journey from Europe to Oz. You will be blown away by the level of service & the beaming smiles from every member of staff. This trip we arranged an early check-in (9am) on Saturday & because we booked a Club floor room we were given a 4pm checkout on Sunday, which was perfect for our 8pm flight out. During our stay we had use of the Club Lounge for coffee & snacks, free wi-fi, evening full bar & hors d'oeuvres (could have been enough for dinner had we not been going out for Chilli Crab) & breakfast. All this for about $600.00 incl taxes & service charge. New pool, gym & spa centre.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive internet access”
Reviews.Author: FionaHongkong
Reviews.Content: The overall hotel was good, buffet breakfast was really good, got lots of varieties, services was good. We requested a twin shares with extra bed, however, they only had king size bed room available for us when checked in, and after adding the extra bed, the room is a little squeezed. Worst part of the hotel, it's they charges SGD25 buck for 24 hours for internet access in the room, doesn't matter if you only use it for 1 minute, they still charge you for 25 bucks, which I think it's too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Muslims and Shoppers from Middle east”
Reviews.Author: ammn11
Reviews.Content: I liked the new hotel and area around it. Hotel staff were nice. The hotel serve halal food, which was the reason I choose it. Also, it is in the middle of the Orchard Road in Singapore; most important road for shoppers :D

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: LondonTealady
Reviews.Content: This is such a lovely hotel. The room was so comfortable and well-designed, and the bed was amazingly comfortable. But the thing which made the stay so pleasurable was the staff. They were so polite, friendly and helpful - they really went out of their way to make sure we had a perfect stay. When I return to Singapore, this will definitely be my first choice of hotel. A quick tip: for delicious local food, ask the concierge about the nearby night hawker market (but only visit the stands with an big letter 'A' over them as this indicate the cleanliness level!)

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly capable of services your every business need”
Reviews.Author: varuunn
Reviews.Content: Was there for 2 days on work, and i have to tell you i slept really well both those days, did not venture out into the hotel much, but the privacy and the peace in my room was brilliant. And thats what i needed the maximum during the hectic two days. Highly recommended for anyone need their peace, privacy and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good for weekend getaways”
Reviews.Author: Spoilt_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 nights at the Grand Hyatt over the weekend as a holiday without the travelling time. I was given a Grand King room on a non-smoking floor. Unlike lesser branded hotels like Renaissance, the non-smoking room/floor, was truly a non-smoking one. The lift lobby was bright and cheery with chairs and two apple platters in the lobby. The room itself came with a King sized bed, study table, large panel mounted LCD TV with DVD player, a very spacious bathroom. Everything was impeccably clean, well designed and unlike other hotel chains, they were generous with the quality and quantity of towels and toiletries. What I liked about the room design was its clean lined beech wood deco, good lighting as well as the fact that they built in the usual tea making counter and the safe box into drawers and cabinets. Very classy, even if it took a call to guest services to locate these things. Another thoughtful feature of the room was the double sided access to the wardrobe. Meaning, one could access clothes from the wardrobe from the bedroom itself and from the inside of the bathroom. Also, I realised that the Hyatt also catered to the health conscious guest by providing a yoga mat in the cupboard as well as provided a DVD of a yoga session. I didn't use this because there was a super 5 star luxury spa and gym in-house that was available to hotel guests. Called the Damai Spa, it housed a luxury five star spa (treatments start from $150 onwards), a well equipped gym with the latest TechnoGym branded equipment including 2 top of the range Kinesis machines which used air pressure instead of weight blocks. In line with the Hyatt experience, the Damai spa staff were professional and very helpful at the reception, with the personal distribution of bottled water and an exercise towel, as well as the provision of any other amenity you would need. To be honest, apart from the toilet and wash basin, I didn't take a shower or a bath in my room as the facilities at the Damai Spa was so much better. True, it was basically a luxury locker and changing room. However, after each gym workout, the appeal of relaxing in the hot and cold plunge pools and then a shower in the more spacious shower cubicles was just too enticing. Furthermore, the amenities provided at the locker room was much better than in the room. Plus, I didn't have to bring anything else except for a change of clothes and my room key. Seriously, everything else was provided for - lotions, toothbrushes, mouth wash, face moisturisers, etc. As the pool, its a chill out pool at best and not really meant for a proper swim. I tried doing that but I found myself doing more turns than actual distance. Based on the number of sun beds around the pool and the pavillions, I really felt that it was a feature pool more than anything else. I also enjoyed lying on the loungers that they placed in the water. Even if you weren't dressed in bathers but in a robe or your usual outfit, it was nice to waddle into the ankle deep section to get to the chair with a magazine. As usual, the F&B outlets were very good. During the stay, I dined at Pete's Place for their buffet lunch (about $28+++) which served one of the most satisfying salads and tiramisu; Mezzanine for dinner (about $100 per person without drinks); and Straits Kitchen for an American breakfast ($35+++ per person). Ah, the breakfast was really satisfying and could count among the best breakfasts amongst hotels in terms of quality, range and service. There was the usual a la minute cooking stations for eggs, pancakes/ waffles, but they also had a good Indian breakfast section with crispy and tasty rotis, tosai, and accompanying curries and chutneys. Also at the same station was a good Nasi Lemak with rich and tasty coconut rice and the usual condiments. I dare say, that the Straits Kitchen brought together the best in class of of all the local and international breakfast foods (sans Japanese). I also enjoyed the wide range of fresh juices (grapefruit, orange, carrot, etc) and free flow of local teas and coffees, as well as the usual cuppa. I was a little disappointed with the Mezzanine for serving me a tasty but cold tenderloin steak in my Meat Platter. Also, while waiting for my food, I got bitten by the mosquito - twice and informed the staff that I wanted a repellent, or coil, or just something for my bites. Unfortunately, this is where the impeccable service lapsed. I was firstly informed that the hotel didn't have any mosquito salve, or repellent. But they offered to go to the nearest pharmacy to pick one for me (my expectation was that they would have picked it up themselve instead of asking me). Second, I had to give them a solution to my problem by asking for a natural repellent which I knew they would carry in their kitchen - fresh lemongrass. When I told them that the lemongrass would help, the staff looked at me in disbelief (okay, she wasn't local, nor Asian, so I could imagine her surprise). I got my lemongrass anyway and the mozzie problem went away. Basically, if you stay at the Grand Hyatt and want to dine at their popular Mezzanine or Straits Kitchen, please be warned that without prior reservations (at least 36 hours in advance), your chances of getting a table at the time you want, or a table at all, is very slim. Overall, I enjoyed my stay at the hotel I found that the service was generally excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hyatt Experience”
Reviews.Author: grrl_3000
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the Club Level and my experience was spot on: the room was clean and modern, and the food on offer in the lounge of a high standard. The gym and pool in the hotel were well-equipped and beautifully designed. The location of the hotel is perfect for getting around, i.e. close to the train station, and great if you want to shop at the major department stores/ shopping malls. My only qualifying comment is that while I felt very accommodated during my stay (i.e. gluten free bread was arranged for my breakfast as soon as the hotel was made aware of my food allergy), perhaps the service was a little perfunctory from the majority of the staff I encountered? Saying that though, in general, I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “This USED to be the very best, 6 years ago”
Reviews.Author: cendut
Reviews.Content: Up until 2004, I was wowed with this hotel. The bang and olufsen tv's, the smart decor, the lobby, straits kitchen, everything. I come and stay in the Hyatt often, as I am from Jakarta. My very first stay in the Hyatt was when I was 11, and I have stayed here close to 10 to 11 times already. Now, when I stayed here again after all these years, I was thoroughly surprised that the 'magic' was gone. There was no wow factor. The grand deluxe room which from memory was huge (it was 56m2), was nowhere near huge. The B&O tv's that was amazing 6 years ago, was sadly outdated. Very small tv's (and non-flat) for 2010!! The wonderful restaurants (straits kitchen, mezza9) haven't changed their menu in 6 years! And Pete's place, Pete's place was AWFUL. Hands down the WORST italian restaurant I ever tried and I live in Jakarta, Indonesia. We stayed at the club room and the snacks in the club lounge was ok, I gave it a 7. The club lounge itself was nice, big with nice staff. I'm not into wine and sweets but the dessert selection is awesome. Ishak the feminine 'manager' is talkative, almost annoying but not. Borderline. You get free wifi at the lounge but not if you are staying in regular rooms. And this is a business hotel. You get meeting rooms if you are staying in Club floors (I think). Room service was ok, quite a selection and the hotel staff are a kind, attentive bunch. May the reception lady messed up our reservations, our rooms (we booked 4) were not ready until 2 hours later. Not all of them, only 2 out of 4. She wasn't that great handling our check-in and left us (switched to a gentlemen) near the end but to be fair the hotel was super crowded that day. Overall this is nowhere near a bad hotel, probably the best in Orchard road but from a top hotel back in the day, it has downgraded itself to a 3.5 out of 5. Oh almost forgot, they show all the world cup games here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good food but not warm hospitality. Not a good value for money”
Reviews.Author: armin1974
Reviews.Content: This hotel has execellent location but the rooms do not provide do view. The food is good. Rooms are small but if you have the luxury of suit then its very comfortable. Large bathrooms in the suits. But the hospitality is not very warm. Lukewarm hospitality!!! Not a good value for money!!

Reviews.Title: “Orchard Road Grand Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: georgianup
Reviews.Content: Date: 8-12th Mar 2010 Went there on a business but accompanied by my wife & kid. Chose this hotel for its close proximity to the business centre of Singapore. Its a very nice hotel strategically located with good spacious rooms. The rooms are modern and bigger than the normal star hotels. Its a good luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of my best hotel experiences in a long time”
Reviews.Author: Nisheel
Reviews.Content: What can I say ? Simply a great hotel in every sense. I travelled here in March 2010 and arrived early at the hotel at 9am. Though check is at noon, I was promtly given a couple of room options as per my booking and we were off to our room. Stayed on the 17th floor in the Grand Deluxe which was a large spacious one bedroom. The service throughout was flawless with everyone from the frontdesk, housekeeping, bell desk, f&b always smiling and helpful. The food and breakfast at their coffee shop was amazing and we really loved this hotel. To cap if off the survery I filled after returning back, the feedback to my few suggestions was replied to not by some anonymous helpdesk operator but by the Hotel Manager itself ! This is the way all hotels should treat customers !

Reviews.Title: “Grand....and comfortably so!”
Reviews.Author: bombayteddy
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel 5 times, it has begun to feel like home. From the winning smile of the attendant who opens the door to your taxi as you arrive from the airport, to the quiet assurance from the Concierge that you are indeed "recognised" and your special needs (and I have several!) will be catered to, you immediately feel at ease. The Grand Deluxe rooms, in the Grand Wing, are actually junior suites, with separate living and sleeping areas, partitioned by sliding doors. They are furnished in a simple modern style, perhaps a shade too spartan for some people but they are comfortable and homely....and I like it. However, the furnishings are now showing their age! Air-conditioning too seems to have a problem: when the thermostat stops the cooling action, the air-flow stops completely! So the first thing one has to do is ask Maintenance to disable the thermostat....and regulate the temperature on your own, by switching off the unit in one room at a time in the suite. However, the standard of house-keeping is superb , the sweet ladies who come to clean the room and replenish the amenities, very efficient yet courteous in a charming old-world way. Restaurants: cutting-edge world cuisine in "Mezza 9" coupled with a jaw-dropping wine and champagne list; good old-fashioned Italian comfort-food in "Pete's Place" and interesting sandwiches and salads at the Poolside....though they need to know that a Margarita is NOT always served frozen!! Speaking of which, the pool and spa have recently been renovated and are truly a haven of relaxation, complete with a lovely garden and waterfall. Especially incredible in the middle of the bustling Scotts/Orchard Road area, which is the location of choice in the city. I would like to end this long-overdue review by coming full circle to the Concierge-staff, who are probably among the most efficient and hard-working I have ever come across. Being the kind of shopper who prefers not to walk around, they were amazingly helpful in procuring whatever items I needed from nearby stores; and managing deliveries of items pre-ordered by me, all the way up to my room. Even trying their best to reserve SPECIFIC seats for me at the Esplanade theatre. So, in all, a hotel fully deserving one's loyalty, despite all the options available in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Whats your USP ? Business with pleasure !”
Reviews.Author: gemcool
Reviews.Content: Well, it has great location, superb restaurants, nice spacious rooms and prompt service. The location is prime and convenient for any kind of traveller - business or for those enjoying thier holidays. Their two restaurants are really good, offers variety of food - excellent preparation and very specious indeed. Whats not good is their freedom of nightlife, at the disc in the basement. Want to unwind after hard day's work - just step out in its porch and you would know. This is kind of a set back for a business traveller, never seen anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for business/couples, unfriendly for kids”
Reviews.Author: ExpatTraveller1
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at Grand Hyatt Singapore 3-4 times a year since 2002 and saw its transformation from Chinese to modern sleek leather and Bang & Olavson high tech heaven. The hotel clearly caters to business travelers and has all amenities that a business traveler might need. However, children are as a rule ignored by the hotel at best. We always stayed at the Grand wing in club rooms. Even though it costs extra, it is well worth the money. The food at the lounge is fabulous: the continental breakfast besides usual staples includes smoked salmon, cheese platter, fresh berries and fruit ("regular" and exotic variety), cold cooked muesli, etc, etc. The lounge stays open all day with tea/coffee, soft drinks, fruit, nuts and cakes. The evening cocktail hour includes sushi bar, small sandwiches, vegetables, cheese platter and fruit, and deserts ("western" and always unusual local variety) and an adequate selection of wines and other alcoholic beverages. The lounge staff varies from professional to snobby, but all of them completely ignore children. High chairs are available, but never visible and never volunteered. Our daughter practically grew up in front of the hotel's staff first staying at the hotel when she was less than 2 years old until age 9. The lounge personal never knew her name and never bothered to ask. Only hotel maids kept commenting on how she grew. Also, club level has its own reception and concierge. We found them totally unhelpful and unprofessional.
