There was a number of times when we were told "no" to a request at the club reception, only to be told "no problem" by regular reception in the lobby. From then on we only used regular reception and concierge and always got excellent service. The rooms are recently renovated with comfortable beds, glass top desks and leather sofas. Bathrooms have "sunflower" shower heads and removable massage shower heads and deep bathtubs. Be ware of a very shallow glass sink that overflows quickly. One of the most excellent features of the hotel is its pool. It is surrounded by lush tropical gardens, has a huge waterfall and a meandering creek, comfortable teak chairs and tables. When one is by the pool area, it feels like a topical island vacation, it's hard to believe that you are actually in the most central, busiest area of Singapore. To sum it all up, it's an excellent hotel with premium location. However, if you are traveling with young children and want them to be pampered, I'll recommend staying at a different hotel, for example Regent Hotel on Cuscaden Road.

Reviews.Title: “Feel the city through hyatt singapore”
Reviews.Author: atul_mukhi
Reviews.Content: The lobby is very chic and modern. Restaurants are excellent. StraitsKitchen offers a wide array of local delights. The hotel is in the heart of the city.The location, right across the Orchard road along Scotts road, very convenient for shopping and just a short distance from the Clarke Quay for some drinks / party Every service here is very excellent. I am very satisfied with Grand Hyatt Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Leissure in the City Centre”
Reviews.Author: Rajiv9300
Reviews.Content: Although it was a Business trip but completely enjoyed the stay. The Location of the hotel is fantastic. Nothing is far away. You may jusy have to get out of the hotel and walk in any direction to find whatever you are looking for. The ambience inside the hotel is awesome. The rooms are comfortable and the resturants are excellent. Would for sure go back when ever again in SIngapore and certainly recommend all to enjoy the peasure of staying with "Hyatt" quality service. Cheers !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: vs123456
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 11 times for a total of about 40 nights. The rooms are small but well designed. The suites are excellent. Everything is top notch. Restaurants are escellent. Buffet is something else. Italian restaurant is great. Spa and swimming pool were very nice. Brix, the night club is a great place to spend the evenings. Hotel is expensive though, but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: hatter08
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a Grand Deluxe King - lovely spacious room with separate living room/office area, and a massive bedroom and bathroom with everything you could want. The hotel's situation just off Orchard road is excellent - right by the MRT and lots of shopping in the immediate area. The pool area is great - I only swam at night and it was quiet and lovely. Didnt eat at any of the evening restaurants but they looked very impressive. Disappointed that breakfast (which was outstanding) and internet access was not included in the rather hefty price of the room. Also my hotel room looked onto the building site next door and the builders worked until 7pm at night as well as on Saturdays.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Hyatt standards”
Reviews.Author: henryw_9
Reviews.Content: This hotel has one of the best location in town and is very convenient for the whole Orchard shopping area. It also features a great restaurant upstairs and a martini bar. The new renovated rooms are very spacious and comfortable and finally a hotel which thinks about business travellers who need to plug 3-4 different things in! The overall experience was very good and you can feel the high standards of Hyatt including the nice executive lounge, the only small thing I would mention us that the service was at some times not a good as I would have expected, it seemed that the staff was sometimes not that customer oriented or responsive to queries and problems.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms; pity about the service”
Reviews.Author: Hburn10
Reviews.Content: Had the luxury of 2nights for a wedding, and with Hyatt points, I just needed to top up $60 per night to upgrade to the grand deluxe suite, which they call a "junior suite", on level 20 of the hotel and allows you access to the Grand Club Lounge which serves refreshments and bites during certain hours. I'll talk about the rooms first - Club Deluxe King - at 54 sqM, the room feels bigger than it is, with a nice separate working living room from the bedroom and bathroom. It was spanking clean and very well maintained, including the small minor things like bathroom tiles. Nothing to fault on cleaniness, comfort, and style. The bed was big enough for 3pax actually. Grand Duplex Suite - the 128 sqM suite is divided into 2 floors, with the living, meeting, and kitchen areas below and the bedroom, master bathroom, and separate make up area on top. Similarly spanking clean with ultimate comfort in mind. But it comes with an extremely narrow staircase which only makes for 1 way traffic. Grand Club Lounge - Only accessible via a stairway from the 20 floor and was a much bigger area than I expected. It was quite empty most of the time, and the bites served during the evening was not too bad, although I think the Club Lounge at Conrad Singapore serves better food. Service was okay, although I felt the staff tended to attend to non-Chinese more. Service - I was abit let down by the service throughout the stay as I thought well, its Hyatt. When I arrived, my taxi was packed with luggages and wedding stuff but no one came forward to help me with the things; only 1 doorman approached, took the stuff only to place them on the floor beside the departing taxi. ???!!!. I ended up lugging all the things from thedriveway to the hotel lobby myself. The same thing happened when we returned to the hotel the 2nd night, at almost 2am. We had numerous packs of things with us, including one huge wedding gift but no one came forward. I had to gesture them to bring a trolley, then 1 staff slowly strolled out with no trolley in hand. During the 2nd day, we were running out for the wedding proper at 3pm and because we knew we would be back very late, we called for an extra bed to be put in while we're gone so the extra guest can rest immediately after we return without having to wait. At 2am, we opened the door, and no extra bed. We called again to ask for it, then after 15mins, 2 staff rang my door, and I thought oh good, the bed's here. Nope. I opened the door only to have them ask me what was it I needed. I couldnt believe it. I told them about the bed, and just had to call to scream at the concierge because I was in absolutely no mood to be nice at 2am. Something else very irritating to me happened on the 3rd morning too. We were moving loads of the wedding stuff from the deluxe to the suite coz it was all on the same floor, just on different ends of the floor. My siser's mother in law is Causasian and was walking in front of me, both of us struggling with as much stuff on our hands. One senior staff saw us, and smiled politely to her and asked if he can help her with the things, which she declined. Then, he took a look at me then turned away without even mustering a smile, I caught more of a disdain than anything. It was very iritating to have hotel staff practice blantant discrimination like this but I was in a hurry to finish moving our staff. Didnt have time to try the room service, pool, gym but I'm sure they are quite nice. But I do really think they should brush up on their service.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Chic and Central”
Reviews.Author: Singapore_Cupcake
Reviews.Content: In short, this hotel is what you would expect of a Hyatt. If you have a competitive price on offer then go for it, I know sometimes it can be expensive; perhaps the only understandable flaw to this hotel. The only negative was probably the building work that was taking place outside the hotel, but I dont think that was anything to do with the hotel; plus it was only cosmetic, and no effect on the stay at all. The good points are as follows: Room: - Bed is very, very comfortable - It is chic, modern and well designed - It has really good tv, radio and speaker facilities - lots of desk space for business and stuff Bathroom: - Nice marble decor - BIG bath - Speakers feed through, so you can sing a bit in the shower, or on the throne! Service: - Friendly - Punctual - Makes you feel like an individual, not just another customer - great help with taxis, bars, food etc Location: - Central; in the heart of Singapore!! If you get a good price, go. It is a fantastic hotel and provides everything you want/need for holiday/ business.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all respects. Thank you Trip advisor for sending me here”
Reviews.Author: RovingRajan
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife, 2 children aged 5 and 7, Mother, Father, Mother in Law, Sister in law, Brother in Law and Nephew from 4.4.2010 to 14.4.2010 to celebrate my Mother in Law's 60th Birthday. I booked 3 Grand king rooms with Pool View. Got 40%off list price as I booked 6 weeks in advance. The rooms were quite large and spacious. Photos in their website is what you get. Everyone was most polite and courteous, check in took less than 5 minutes. Luggage whisked away to rooms without fuss. In the Middle of Orchard Road Shopping. 1 min walk to Isetan, Tang and MRT We are from Chennai, India but live in New Zealand. The food was Fabulous. Breakfast buffet and Dinner were fantastic. Both South Indian and North indian fare available amongst a cornucopia of Asian and Continental cuisine. Many Many Vegetarian Options for all meals. I had Medu vadai and Sambar everyday for breakfast with Iddly's and excellent coconut chutney. I also had the pleasure of having the "best" Palak Paneer I have ever eaten in my life. There was an elderly gent called "Henry" at breakfast time who had lots of fun looking out for my demonic children. Everyone else there was also very friendly towards children. I did a lot of research (much of it on Trip advisor) before booking this trip. Good Service, Good Food, Good Rooms, Good People, Central to shopping by walk, Lovely Pool. Thanks people at Hyatt for making this important holiday as good as it could be and Thank you Trip advisor for pointing me in the right direction

Reviews.Title: “Average stay, below Grand Hyatt standards”
Reviews.Author: BangkokBangkok
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the airport there was no driver, the dirver showed up after that I phoned the hotel. The check in was very standard, no information of the hotel. I could not find the elevator to go to the room, after that I went back to the front desk they informed me that I had to walk to the end of the corridor and there was an other elevator. The room was fine, basic and clean. At night it was very difficult to sleep because I could hear that the rooms next to me went to the toilet or to the shower. F&B facilities are great, meeting facilities very basic and the meeting room was freezing cold. The participants of the meeting complained several times, but no action. I ordered a taxi in the early morning to bring me to the airport, when I arrived 15 minutes earlier at check out the receptionist told me that the driver was still not there. I told her that I wait outside for the driver. Outside there was one taxi and the driver was asking for my name, why I had to wait an other 15 minutes when the driver was there already for more than 30 minutes. I was expecting from Grand Hyatt more service, next time when I visit Singapore I will stay at an other place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel right in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: styleandfashion888
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hyatt for 3 nights in February. this is a balanced review from a luxury traveller; hope it helps you. Rooms: we stayed in a junior suite, which was lovely. Furnishings seemed quite old though and none of the rooms in the hotel have any views. Food: buffet breakfast is excellent - huge choice, excellent service! Location: excellent, right in the centre of all the shopping. Pool: very nice pool with modern day beds; the water is quite cold though Spa: I had a 2.5 hr treatment which was great; treatment rooms are very pleasant but the lobby seemed a little shabby. Service is completely inflexible though if you ask for anything out of ordinary. Overall: I think it's one of the most expensive hotels in the city but we felt it was worth it. Will return and will recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore Grand Hyatt - Fantastic Biz Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 1connection
Reviews.Content: Five stars all aroud at this fantastic business hotel situated about one block from Orchard. Check-in: Arrived to the hotel at 1 AM and had the hotel arrange a Mercedes to pick me up at the airport...cost of $70 USD, but definatley worth not having to wait in a taxi line late at night. Arrived at the hotel and was checked in and to my room in less than five minutes. Friendly staff and warm greetings. Room: Stayed in a deluxe room, King sized bed, modern decor. Huge bathroom. Maid service 2X daily and towels were constantly restocked. Very comfortable bed. Particularly liked the light controls mounted next to the bed as well as the overhead reading lights and night lights activated by the bed-side controlls. Large desk and work area. No problems with internet service. Main Restaurant (Straits Kitchen): I've been all over Asia in the last 10 years and the Straits Kitchen is by far the best hotel buffet / general restaurant that I've come across. 4-5 main kitchen stations serving western, Chinese, Singaporian, and Indian food styles. They have a huge juice making station that also does a great pulled tea. Then there is a continential breakfast area as well serving fresh fruit, cereals, breads, etc. Then in the evenings they serve one AWESOME set of food at the dinner buffet. Hard to stay at this hotel and not gain 5 lbs per week. Pool / Fitness area: The Damai pool and spa area are great. Reminds me of staying in Hawaii with the set-up, plants, and overall atomsphere. They have 2-3 cabannas and a great pool-side restaurant called Oasis Cafe which I ate at several times. They have a happy hour at the pool side bar offering 50% off drinks from 4-6 PM. The fitness center is great with 4-6 bikes, 4 eliptors and 4-5 treatmills as well as a dozen weight machine stations on top of several free weight sessions. The locker rooms have private showers, a meditation room, wet sauna, dry sauna and hot & cool pools. Hours are 6 AM to 10 PM. Location: The location is great. The hotel sits about one block noth of Orchard Ln on Scotts Rd and about 100 yards or so from the American Club. The bus stop is right at the intersection of Orchard and Scott and for $14 SGD you can get an all-day bus pass that stops at ~20 tourist destinations on the island. Perfect for tourists or simply wanting to visit several areas of the city in one day. In summary....I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place for a beautiful family”
Reviews.Author: SBawa
Reviews.Content: Amazing experience with shopping just outside and dont miss to have rice chicken in the next building Keep your luggage with concierge if u check out and flt is late - amazing service levels

Reviews.Title: “Great service and friendly people”
Reviews.Author: DerbyDon
Reviews.Content: The friendly people and great service will keep you coming back to the Grand Hyatt Singapore. Rooms are clean and you can always count on a great night’s sleep. In room check-in is an awesome service that other hotels need to adopt. The concierge was able to arrange dinner at several very exclusive restaurants on short notice, a service that is worth its weight in gold. I would recommend the booking rooms on the Executive Level whenever possible because the nightly cocktail hour and snacks are excellent. However, this is also my only complaint about the Grand Hyatt Singapore... the people working the lounge aren't very personal or responsive, so if you want special attention you should stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bububeo
Reviews.Content: I and my family have stayed at this hotel recently. The location of this hotel is just wonderful with shoppings and entertainment at doorstep. We have been welcomed by a staff from the entrance and she walked us to the reception counter for checking in. It took us only few minutes for the registration. Learning that my mom could not walk properly, they assigned us a room near the elevator and next to each other. They initiatively offered a wheelchair for my mother, this really impressed us, especially my mom for their extraodianry services. We were then assigned in a new wing with new rooms. The room was well designed for the convenience of the guest with wooden floor and marble bathroom. The lcd TV and DVD player immediately taken by our kids for their favorites DVD movies that they carried along with them. We liked very much the wardrop with two sides door that we could take our clothes whether we were in the bathroom or from the bed room The restaurant on the Mezannine was extremely great with full ranges of menu and open kitchens. They offered a kid menu to our kids. We ordered beef and veal and sushi, all were delicious that we could only say excellent food after dinner (one of my brother in law was a kiwi and he really enjoy his main course with veal, especially the sauce) Following morning we went down to the lobby restaurant for a breafkfast, this buffet restaurant with open kitchen really imrepssed us with their variety and quality of foods. great comments the chef of this hotel It was just a short stay at this Hyatt hotel but it really impressed us with their friendly and outstanding services and especially the foods at the two restaurants. There is no doubt we will come back and stay at this hotel for our next trip to Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and wonderful stays we will definitely come again!”
Reviews.Author: mystery_advisor
Reviews.Content: Our experience at Grand Hyatt Singapore was truly amazing n splendid. Personally, Grand Hyatt is our most favourite hotel. We stayed there a couple of times and we witnessed the improvements in the customer service after we gave feedback to the management via the feedback form. We were impressed with the commitment that the management had on customer service. We booked our 1st two stays under the Explorer package. This was a very worth for value package as it includes buffet breakfast and dinner at the Straits Kitchen. Our Grand deluxe King room was very spacious and comfortable. The only drawback was the small TV screen at the living and bed room. We had to strain our eyes to watch the shows. The equipment and quality of the Gym at Damai Spa was impressive. The treadmills and cross trainer from technogym and had touch screen with cable TV and ipod attachments On our 3rd visit is a complimentary night at the Grand room, we noticed that the customer service at the counter staff of the Straits Kitchen improved tremendously. We were greeted warmly and we felt at home. Upon our check-in, front counter staff automatically gave us a double upgrade to Grand Deluxe King and Club access. Anted out request to check in early and check out late till 6pm, this is of course on an availability basis. My wife and I were very pleased with the flexibility that the management has empowered the staff with. The experience at the Club Lounge was overwhelming. Upon our 2nd visit to the lounge, we were greeted by our 1st names. The staffs were very proactive, helpful and friendly. Food and beverage quality at the lounge was also top notch. Wireless access was also complementary.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Shaun52
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 8.30 pm, after a flight from Brisbane, to be told our room was not ready for us, I am sorry to moan but I could sort of understand this if it were 8.30 in the morning ! We were advised to come back in 15 minutes, after doing this, we were told the room was still not ready and told realistically it would be 1 hour approx, and to get a drink in the hotel bar, for which we payed. We had left our luggage with concierge and like normal was expecting it to be delivered to our room. As we were only in the city for 1 night, we though it was imperative to do the Night Safari at the zoo, which I highly recommend, abandoned our wait for our room and just get on with exploring. Be prepared to wait for a taxi, as the system is totally manic. After waiting for what we thought was ' a taxi on order ' from reception, when in fact reception do not order taxi's, we embarked on our wait at the hotel rank. WHAT A DISASTER ! Try it and you will see what I mean !!!! On our return to the hotel, the room was finally ready, but lugguage had not been delivered, baring in mind this is now 1 am. We made the relevant calls to reception and finally it arrived 30 minutes later. I vexed my complaint to the duty manager, she was very charming and apologized. I would recommend complaining as we were given free breakfasts for the following morning and a late check out, which was very handy as it meant we could leave our luggage the following day and hit the shops on Orchard Road. If we had been staying in Singapore only longer than one night, we would have checked out of this hotel and gone elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok - but too expensive”
Reviews.Author: BkMike
Reviews.Content: Old rooms - but still looking fine. But when it comes to value for money - I have seen better. Location is what makes this place so good.

Reviews.Title: “sub-standard service”
Reviews.Author: ilovetravel-2010
Reviews.Content: 1/ needed to have the key card changed 3 times in 1 day so as to have it equipped with all access (lift, room and exec lounge) and had the guest standing in front of the room for more than 20 mins to have the card fixed; 2/ the front desk staff had no SOP re check-out and allowed people to jump queue; and 3/ if you'd to stay in this hotel, avoid the wing that's further down the property as the walls are real thin and you get to hear exactly what's going on in the next room at nite

Reviews.Title: “Singapore Visit”
Reviews.Author: Yashuca
Reviews.Content: Grand Hyatt is located in the heart of singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Extreme Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: sidzy
Reviews.Content: This was definitely the most value I got for my money spent on accommodation. My room was ready even though I checked in an hour or so before the given check-in time. The rooms were very spacious, neat and clean, with a separate living room to my surprise. The location couldn't be any better if you wanted to be close to the malls for shopping. This hotel is not even a minutes walk from all the big malls on Orchard Road. The concierge was extremely helpful in making us plan our days. The staff otherwise too were courteous. The food within the hotel was great. Being vegetarians, my wife and I had no problems. The perfect hotel to stay in while visiting Singapore for shopping and food.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location, super crowded lobby with endless streams of people”
Reviews.Author: asimplejazzlover
Reviews.Content: Grand Hyatt is located in the prime location of Orchard Road. Surrounded with crazy shopping centers in town. It has a very busy lobby, crowded with streams of people. A little bit of inconvenience though. It has one of the best location in town. So if you are the one who needs an easy access to shopping, get here. The hotel can be easily found if you are traveling into the city by train. The nearest train station is Orchard Road so you wouldn't miss this hotel. Rooms are compactly designed, a little bit small for a 5 star hotels but it is still acceptable. It has a nice spa, pool, and sauna. Do try this when you get here. Escape the buzz outside the hotel, dip in the pool and enjoy the facilities. It is worth trying. All in all, it is all about location for Grand Hyatt. Though personally I would want something more relaxing ambience and bigger/more comfortable room with the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, also has brix a really happening night pub”
Reviews.Author: skhemka
Reviews.Content: Great location, also has brix a really happening night pub

Reviews.Title: “Treats Diamonds Very Well”
Reviews.Author: choth21
Reviews.Content: I'm stayed here for a couple nights.. I used a Diamond Suite upgrade and got upgraded to a Grand Suite King. I love this room, with a huge bedroom and comfy bed and two sofas, some ottomans and a big 6 person dining table and a full kitchen. The shower even works as a steam room! it's really done well and I like the stylish midcentury modern-inspired furniture. I wish this was my apartment at home. I'm also amazed that this room has a working stove. although there are no pots or pans to cook anything, not that I was planning to given all the great food courts here. my diamond amenity was a generous 25 piece box of chocolates and a 1/2 bottle of wine and plate of fruit. The club lounge is really done well and the food spread is great. tonight, there was sushi, some martini glasses of greek salad and chicken waldorf salad, some lamb meatballs, shrimp skewers. At least 3 or 4 different types of dessert were offered as well.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Orchard”
Reviews.Author: utkarshmorarka
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt has the best mini suites I have ever stayed in, the comfort is excellent, the service good, and the food great. They have their own restaurants which are very good, and a chocolaterie and bakery which is simply superb. This hotel is a stones throw away from Orchard Road, and the subway. The security is great but the view leaves much to be desired. Better as a busines hotel, it is full of tourists and the like One warning, stay away from the basement nightclub, lest you want to spend the night fighting off solicitations from unscrupulous women, and the rest of your life denying that anything happened to your significant other

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: citysites
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic, from the moment you get out of your cab you are welcomed, taken personally to check-in and introduced to the staff. Even the basic rooms are of a really high standard, and the turn down service at night is a bonus (they fill your ice bucket, tidy (again), close your curtains, change towels etc). As your Do Not Disturb is electronic, once you switch it off and leave the hotel they usually clean your room straight away - i went down for breakfast and half an hour later came back to a spotless room. Breakfast was amazing, the curry was to die for, so were the freshly made pancakes and waffles. Room service was also fantastic, and minibar prices were lower than in less expensive hotels. The pool is beautiful, staff serve you iced water throughout the day. I also went to the gym which was well equipped. Oh and if you have any dry cleaning take it with you, it is priced on a par with UK but your cleaned items are back with you within the day, fantastic! Didnt try the bars or restaurants (other than room service) as the hotel is so central there are plenty of places to go at night. Later moved to Pan Pacific Marina Bay, still nice and good location but nowhere near as good as the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: bhavinhs
Reviews.Content: hi they have a new spa called the damai which is absolutely incredible. the masseause that i used knew her job and ensured that my massage worked on the areas which needed it and not just every area to get over with it attitude. a must tyr for all who stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Par excellence”
Reviews.Author: Romeo911
Reviews.Content: A truly world class hotel Had a wonderful time. Could not fault any service of the Hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for business”
Reviews.Author: virgo_08
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hyatt for two nights in early Nov for a business trip. Location - is great; very centrally located, and also close to Orchid Road - mecca of shopping. Room - was really large. A pleasant surprise. Nice study table on the side with great views, and a large bathroom. Almost looked like new. Service - didnt have time to order from room service. Restaurants - The Straits Kitchen downstairs is amazing. The widest selection of food I have seen in a while. Service also was very prompt. Perhaps this is a Singapore thing. Reception - check in/out was very prompt. In sum, whether for business or leisure, this hotel offers excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel..but pricey!”
Reviews.Author: OnlyBoeing
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel for the good internet rate (latestays.com) ..very impressed with lobby, location, room and staff. Conceirge very helpful to advise which attractions etc to visit and always very welcoming (by name) when we returned to hotel. Great location right on Orchard and Scotts Road..close for shopping and resturants and nightlife (try Gold Class cinema at Great World City..like first class aircraft!) But we found hotel dining too expensive. Sunday lunch was more than $300 for two of us even though we had one glass of champagne each...beautiful food though and nice atmosphere. Would recommend for locationa nd staff but eat elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “One of the newest and the leading hotels”
Reviews.Author: roadie123
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many 4 star plus hotels in Singapore for business and this is my first time at the Grand Hyatt. In my mind, this hotel is top 3. I am greatly impressed by the newness of the room and the spacious open layout. The service is also top quality. After one night of stay here, I tried out the Hilton Singapore. What a big disappointment. The service staff (esp. front desk delivery men) was extremely slow and with poor attitude. Hilton was in a totally inferior quality category.

Reviews.Title: “the best in singapore”
Reviews.Author: kiranrohera
Reviews.Content: this hotel has the best location. biggest room size thats the deluxe grand room and the best staff .the best breakfast you can get in singapore i have stayed more then 25 diff hotels in singapore no hotel can match this one .

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!! 5******'s”
Reviews.Author: gmcCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Elegant, High-Class, Fantastic Room. Could not be better!

Reviews.Title: “Well oiled, well located businessperson's hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveleasy
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt is located in the heart of Singapore's shopping and business area, particularly for the former. In many ways a typical convention kind of hotel with the surfeit of staff one sees in the Far East attending to almost every need. The rooms are nice sized with a large executive desk having both hi-speed and wi-fi, large closet space etc. Not too much draw space if you want to spread out clothes rather than "live off the suitcase" with the drawers far from the closet at the other end of the room. The bathroom is a typical "four-point" bathroom one expects of a full service hotel with a bathtub, shower, separate toilet, sink etc and plenty of room within, My particular room had an annoying malfunction of the closet light that would turn on automatically with the slightest movement at night as the door would not press the switch shut upon being closed. The other "negative" is the corridor noise - if any guest checks out at night as often happens in such hotels, the noise seeps into your room and if you're a light sleeper it can be a problem. All in all a very nice and fully functional hotel with great restaurant space - straits kitchen has a great breakfast spread - a very nice pool and gym and tennis courts as well (did not use).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay, great staff and service”
Reviews.Author: Yoyoggi
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a club room for 4 nights, everything was great. The location is very convenient to all shopping and eating. Staff and service at this hotel is at 5 star standards. The room was very comfortable and spacious. The club lounge on 21st floor was well run and a delight after a long day of shopping. Buffet dinner at Straits Kitchen was very nice, a good place to try a nice variety of the local foods

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel in the middle of SIngapore”
Reviews.Author: Miko_Tanabe
Reviews.Content: - Room was exellent - no wifi in standard room - strategic, near orchard st, MRT - next to Far East Plaza

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Askani
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Hyatt for 2 nights with our 6 month son and we found the service and the hotel excellent. Rooms are spacious with modern yet comfortable decor. When we arrived at check-in they confirmed the pre-reserved baby cot I had ordered and within minutes of setting foot in the room we had a call from Housekeeping apologising for the cot not already having been set up and that they would send someone right up. The one minor issue we faced was when we requested a bottle steriliser for the baby bottles. Housekeeping initially didn’t think that they had such things but a few hours later it they found one and sent it up to the room. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom very large with separate bath and shower. The gym is well equipped as expected and furnished with the latest Technogym equipment. Water, juice and towels were all available in the gym.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional in every way!”
Reviews.Author: AmsterdamFrancis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt Singapore for over a dozen times in the past 15 yeras or so. Our last stay before this one was 3 years ago and at that time, we were not very impressed,espacially the service was not up to standard.. As the location of the hotel is excellent, we decided to give it go this year and we were so glad we did. We booked a room (Junior suite) in the older (grand) wing, with access to the Club Lounge, with free continental breakfast in the morning; free coffee, tea and soft drinks during the daytime and free cocktails and snacks from 6-8 pm. Our stay was 5 nights. Our arrival at the hotel couldn't be more welcoming. I was greeted by one of the concierges at the entrance. Check-in was done in the room. Even our preference for the beds (no duvets) had been remembered, without me having to ask for it before arrival. Amazing! The same goes for our preference in newspapers. Not often do you see such a well kept guest history record! The room hasn't been changed or updated over the past few years and some people might find it a bit outdated, but it certainly has a charm: Not too posh and opulent; everything you need (including two flatscreen televisions) and a great and big bathroom with all the amenities you could wish for. The view was great: Overlooking Scotts Road. There is a lot of construction going on around the hotel, so I was fortunate to have a room with a view. Staff, concierges, housekeeping ("guestrelations" as they call themselves) were outstanding and extremely friendly and professional. At the Club Lounge, every waiter and concierge called us by our last name from the beginning. Impressive. Service at the Club Lounge doesn't come better than this: Very attentive, catering to your every need, helpful in every way. It felt like coming home, every time we came up to the Club lounge. Housekeeping twice a day, of course. The hotel has a few wonderful restaurants: Strait's Kitchen for the amazing buffet; Pete's Place for the Italian touch and Mezza9 with a great variety of dishes from all over the world. Everywhere, the service was outstanding. As said, the location of the hotel can't be beaten: Corner of Scott's and Orchard (where it all happens..). The subway is around the corner and so is the latest luxury shopping center, ION: All the major luxury brands have their flagship store at the ION. The pool has undergone major reconstruction and is absolutely great with big sun loungers. There is also a restaurant with all day -al fresco- dining. The new Spa is absolutely worth a visit. The hotel may be a little older and less posh and opulent than other, recently opened hotels, but it has a quiet, sophisticated feeling and is an oasis in the hustle and bustle of Singapore. It has the 5 star touch and feeling.I visited the nearby Four Seasons and the St. Regis: And espacially the latter made a rather "stuffy" impression with respect to the opulant lobby with its huge chandeliers. chandeliers. The Grand Hyatt is absolutely highly recommended. Consider a stay in a "Club" room (with Club Floor access). Service is second to none. Breakfast in the morning is very good: great choice; but beware: No eggs, only Continental. The snacks in the evening are to die for: So many choices and the taste is exquisite. Free internet on the Club Level: It's a WiFi zone or you can make free use of one of their computers. We will certainly stay again at the Grand Hyatt during our next stay in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional.”
Reviews.Author: mshaus
Reviews.Content: This is my second time here. Last year we stayed for about a week. This year it was 11 days. Both my husband and I enjoyed every minute of our stay at the Grand Hyatt Singapore. We arrived at about 1.30am Tuesday morning, tired and foggy after traveling for almost 24 hrs. Upon arriving at the hotel, one of the staff on duty helped us with our bags, welcomed us back and greeted us by our family name. My husband was astonished and kept asking me how they knew our name. It is still a mystery to me. We did not have our name written on our bags anywhere. So I guess, it is a Hyatt trade secret. :-) Check in was very easy and quick. Within minutes we were on our way to our room. We never missed our breakfast at the Straits Kitchen. We saw some familiar faces among wait staff who actually remembered us from last year. Breakfast was wonderful... we never got tired of the food. I even made dinner reservation for my family at the Straits Kitchen. In one day we had two meals at the Straits Kitchen! My older family members were treated very kindly and with respect. The housekeeping staff were polite, discreet and efficient without being overbearing. I am very impressed as usually most hotels don't really put a lot of effort into training their housekeeping team in customer relations. Everyone from the front desk to the staff at the hotel door were attentive and efficient without trying too hard. I have stayed at the Four Seasons in Singapore and while the service there is as excellent, Grand Hyatt got my vote for being a more welcoming hotel. There is a certain warmth as you enter the hotel. No stuffiness of a 5 star luxury hotel that you may expect at other places.The staff work well together, there is a certain zen like calmness among the staff... everything seemed to 'gel' in this hotel. We received a gift from the assistant manager, hazelnut biscotti to go with our coffee in the morning when we came back to our room. That was a nice touch. On our last day Oct 9th 7am, we woke up late and almost missed our flight if not for the concierge who checked us out quickly as the front desk were busy with other guests. I wished I remembered the name of the staff member who was on duty but I was in such a hurry to leave. Also thanks to the bellhop who helped us with our six pieces of luggage. Overall, the Hyatt is my top choice in Singapore. Great location, 2 min walk to the MRT, great food, excellent staff and very comfortable rooms (grand deluxe). I know I will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “5 Class Standard in Everything”
Reviews.Author: bdmnmch
Reviews.Content: Hyatt has always set a high standard on its quality and service and Singapore definitely presents both in 5 star standard. The room was planned out nicely and impressed me with its 3 colour combo of grey, black and light timber. Bathroom was fantastic, with its vanity table opposite the sink and toilet opposite the shower room and great bathtub in between; shower room was another gem with its Hansgrohe head shower as another option of handheld. Loved the two way access of wardrobe from vanity table side and bed side making an easier access to grab something in there. Bed was King size with its excellent mattress quality and pillows; room lighting and air con temperature were easily adjusted and within bed reach. We had dinner in Straits Kitchen which we booked through Concierge and it was a splendid dinner with local cuisines buffet spread. Breakfast was also served at same restaurant; it gave good variety but I wouldn't say it was a big spread but quality wise was great. Unlucky for us, it was raining when we wanted to go for a swim, a minus point was the pool was adjacent to Oasis Restaurant and there were patrons sitting next to the pool without any barrier in between, it would felt weird going swimming knowing within less than 1 metres, people could be staring at you. But the DAMAI (its fitness centre and spa) which was quite recently revamped looked great; we would try the spa treatment next time. Check in and check out went smoothly with its efficient front desk staff. Definitely worth a short stay during weekend and you could visit surrounding Orchard malls that opens for late night shopping up to 11pm every Saturday.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Experiences”
Reviews.Author: Heji
Reviews.Content: It's was not my first time at S'pore, but the beautiful memories at Grand Hyatt Singapore keeps us coming back. Not only the smile always with the staffs makes us feel happy, but their cares for our stay make me feel more than welcome here. I still don't know how they remember my allergy to nuts at my favourit breakfast destination, StraitsKitchen, despite everytime we came, we was greeted my different staff. Don't forget to see Mike, restaurant manager, because you don't wanna miss his 'like no other' recommendations! This fantastic guy makes our meals are always pleasure. We still remember my first dinner here. It was under candle light, with red roses, 2 glasses of champange and the congratulations from each staff we meet. It's all come from my simple note to Mike when I made reservation, "this is our honeymoon trip!" We keep on talking about those beautiful memories with my friend. It's truly exceptional experiences thanks to all the staffs at Grand Hyatt Singapore. We definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly excellent”
Reviews.Author: TravelDuo35
Reviews.Content: You'd never guess from the outside, or even from the lobby, how wonderful this hotel really is. We had the good fortune to stay in a 1-bedroom suite in the main building, and it was a delight (and something of a bargain). Ultra-contemporary (without being stark or cold-feeling), and with the very highest levels of housekeeping and maintenance. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, which made a great experience even better. The 'piece de resistance' was the truly excellent food served at BOTH of the main restaurants...an unexpected and very welcome bonus. Cudos to the staff and the Hyatt organization.

Reviews.Title: “Great luxury hotel at the heart of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Bobomjon
Reviews.Content: My wife, 3 year old son and I stayed at Grand Hyatt (Scotts Rd) for 4 nights for the second time in 3 years. This hotel offers luxury comfort, great service, friendly staff and a beautiful pool (for all ages from toddlers up) and fantastic food. Nothing is too hard for the staff and management and everything is aimed at making sure guests return time and time again. Grand Hyatt is located near the corner of Scotts and Orchard roads in the heart of the shopping area of Singapore and is a short walk away from all ameneties. With the recent opening of the ION mega mall, which is just a minute or two away through an underpass, Grand Hyatt's location is even more attractive than before.

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best”
Reviews.Author: Bond239
Reviews.Content: Simply impeccable and top notch hotel in Singapore and always my residence whenever am in town. Professional staff which gives me attentive but unobtrusive service from check in till check out. Couldn't have been better. The Pressing coupon that I got along with my keycard is simply very thoughtful. Moreover I got the personal note the next day from the Resident Manager asking me to give him feedback on my staff and offering 15% discount at their award winning Mezza9. The only regret is I should have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence”
Reviews.Author: esitang
Reviews.Content: My family and I visited Singapore for long weekend and stayed at Grand Hyatt Singapore for 4 days. It has been an excellence stay. The rooms, foods, ambience of the hotel are excellence. The staffs are very friendly and helpful. We have only great experience and will definitely return to this hotel for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Efficient Service”
Reviews.Author: myvision58
Reviews.Content: Attended a meeting held at the hotel recently. On arrival I was greeted with a friendly smile and greeting before alighting the taxi. I then realised I did not have Singapore dollars to pay the taxi (panic!) The staff me money from his own wallet to save my time and said I could pay him back later. This was a start of a fantastic stay which still leaves a warm feeling whenever I share my experience to my friends and colleagues. The check in was smooth and efficient. I stayed at the hotel last year however this time the warm service was felt in all areas of the hotel. The breakfast was unbelievable and very good value for money. The choices are endless and served fresh. At the meeting I requested for a cable to charge my IBM Thinkpad laptop and they brought this to me very quickly and I realised they have a supply of cables to fit most types of laptop which is very thoughtful and very customer focused. The restaurants and bars are always busy which is a good sign and dining at Mezza 9 for dinner was a great choice and highly recommendable. Drinks at the bar downstairs was great and the band was fantastic! The next day I dropped by the Grand Club lounge as I was kindly upgraded this visit with a colleague. They staff lounge greeted us and asked for our room numbers. We went inside for evening snacks which was complimentary and had to pass the entrance area to go to the other side for more seats however this time another staff was there and he greeted my friend by name and she came to tell me this. We sat there for awhile to discuss how he could have known as there were many people at the lounge and untill today we are impressed yet puzzled. On the day of departure I called the concierge to order a flower basket for a colleague and wanted her to get this on the same morning and preferred to see the flowers before I left. The concierge that helped me was super efficient and very patient. He made it so easy and personally collected the flowers for me to make sure I got this on time and I was very impressed! The check out was also very quick and the staff at the reception were very engaging and friendly. Thumbs up to the management of the hotel and staff as they made my stay extra special! Have sinced recommended this centrally located hotel to my friends and clients!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & amenities”
Reviews.Author: DRMBinDC
Reviews.Content: Three great nights at a first class hotel. Perfect location, very nice guest rooms, welcoming club lounge, relaxing pool, good tennis court, loved the spa, good gym, plus a delicious restaurant (Straights Kitchen). We stayed at this hotel last year and were in a standard room and enjoyed it. This trip we were upgraded to a suite! The hotel has two towers, but having stayed in both towers there doesn't seem to be a difference. I noticed in March that a new building is being built on the block between the Hyatt and the Marriott. Ask the front desk at check-in if neighboring building is still under construction to make sure you get a quiet room. Great hotel. You'll be glad you stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Not as expected”
Reviews.Author: WSUaristo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the GH Singapore for 2 nights in the beginning of August for holiday. Chose the hotel for its location and proximity to the shopping district. Stayed at the FS last summer which despite its location was a very nice property. The GH is like any typical GH and it reminded me very much of its sister location in Tokyo in Roppongi Hills. Stayed in a Grand Deluxe King and the size of the room was fine. Toiletries definitely need to be upgraded to a brand name. Room service was efficient, friendly, and tasty for my 3yr old. My biggest disappointment would be my dinner at the Straits Kitchen. After watching and hearing about the restaurant on No Reservations, I wanted to try this "hotelized" version of hawker cuisine. During my last visit to Singapore, the restaurant was fully booked and was not able to dine there. This time, I made sure to reserve my table early. The interior was nice and the food stations look very clean and modern. The main issue was with the food. Don't get me wrong, some of the items were delicious, but I was disappointed that they did not present Singapore's main food items. I was expecting either chili or pepper crab, but they offered crab in black bean sauce. That was a real disappointment. The popiah was wonderful, but the rojak salad could have been better. The barbecue section was nicely presented, but the roast chicken, duck, and other cuts were not as tasty. The indian food corner was probably the best area, but their roti prata was not light and fluffy, but almost as hard as the naan they offered. Malaysian corner was decent, but overall the variety was not as much as I expected. Fruit/ Dessert section was large but not that great. I did enjoy the Teh Tarik and Coconut Juice, but overall, I was not happy with my meal. I was full, but I felt that I was not satisified by what I ate and regretted my meal later on.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay!”
Reviews.Author: T01Bhelsinki
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights in late June with my family (boys aged 18, 16 and 11) in two club rooms and we had a wonderful time. Our rooms were connected and were very spacious and comfortable. We had access to the club level for breakfast and for happy hour drinks and snacks in the late afternoon and this was wonderful. The staff there were extremely attentive and friendly and I have rarely experienced such a level of service. My only gripe about the hotel is the revamped swimming pool. When we went to the pool it was crowded and it is built in a way that makes it difficult to swim for exercise. However, given the hotel's excellent location and excellent staff this was overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: CapnAlex
Reviews.Content: Very much enjoyed my stay in one of their Junior Suites. The hotel is very nicely appointed and all the usual luxury amenities are in place. The gym is quite new and well equipped. Did not try any of the F&B outlets in the hotel, as there is so much to choose from nearby. Enjoyed the band in the hotel's nightclub (BRIX), but prices down there are quite hefty (however beautiful girls are plentiful also). Particularly I was impressed by the service of staff (Grand Club Staff, Concierge, Housekeeping). One of the best Hyatts I have stayed in. My stay was using GoldPassport points, so I can't comment on value but it's probably not very cheap. Might not have stayed there if not on a business trip or (as in my case) using loyalty points.

Reviews.Title: “Really cannot find anything to complain about.”
Reviews.Author: AClovestotravel
Reviews.Content: It was what I expected for the price, nothing more, nothing less. Very clean, pleasant atmosphere. The only downside, if it is one at all, is that the reception area is not well located ... I had to kind of look for the reception lounge after entering through the main entrance. Also, I did not find the reception desk staff particularly friendly. Aside from this, overall, I really enjoyed the quiet room and the prompt baggage delivery service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: jobymaloby
Reviews.Content: This is a really great hotel, with extremely good staff and excellent facilities. You will want for nothing at all when you stay here. The rooms are spacious, modern and extremely comfortable. There are a great range of restaurants to choose from and the pool area and health club are great places to relax and work out. This would be my first choice everytime in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous establishment!”
Reviews.Author: alma15
Reviews.Content: We spent one extraordinary week here in this fabulous setting. From the time we checked-in we were pampered from A-Z. The employees at the reception desk were extremely friendly, courteous and helpful. Our junior suite was phenomenal and I would highly recommend this room type to any families with children. Our floor was very quiet throughout our stay. This is a top notch hotel establishment worthy of your consideration if you are looking for plush high end accommodation in Singapore. The pool and fitness center are nestled in water falls and a jungle like setting - simply stunning!

Reviews.Title: “Great consistent service”
Reviews.Author: KKtravelerKk
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in the hotel over the school holidays and really enjoyed our stay. We stay on the club floor and the staff in the Regency Club lounge were exceptional, nothing was ever too much trouble. We returned every evening to a clean, fresh room and it truly was a luxury when you've been out the whole day. The kids really enjoyed the room and that meant alot. We definately will return to the hotel whenever we are in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eatlovepray
Reviews.Content: Singapore is always a city of my favourite food around! GrandHyatt is just located in the centre of the crowd of Orchard, perfect for me who just love to stroll down the shopping arcade. The front office team is usual as found in any city hotels in the world – they are too tired to present the beautiful smiles then here I stood there as unimportant guest but I thanks to the concierge, they are helpful and chic, well done! My club room is nice; love the working space and special two thumbs up for morning buffet breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Modern accommodation, perfect location for Shopaholic!”
Reviews.Author: Tads222
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights during our shopping trip to Singapore. The Grand Hyatt Singapore has a great location at downtown Orchard. Service was meeting my expectation for a 5 star hotel. I didn't spend that much time at check-in counter and the staff was extremely helpful. The rooms were very spacious with a big and comfortable bed, a very good sized bathroom and nice sensible work desk. I was lucky to get a room with pool-view, one of the best hotel pools that I ever experienced. We had our lunch at Oasis pool bar and the food was excellent. The hotel is surrounded by array of shopping malls and restaurants. Since it was our shopping trip, this location is so ideal!!! We often took breaks in between our shop rounds, went back to drop stuffs & rest in our room, and then continued with next rounds,haha.... Heard that their Damai Spa is fantastic but such a regret that we could not have time to try out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the shopping paradise”
Reviews.Author: jakartagirl
Reviews.Content: I was on leisure trip in the beginning of June. My purpose is to enjoy the Great Singapore Sale. However the GSS is not as I am expected. Luckily I stayed in the great hotel. The food and service in Straits Kitchen was excellent. As a moslem I can enjoy any kind food in this restaurant as the restaurant is the halal restaurant. The newly renovatec spa was fantastic and my favourite is the swimming pool where I could feel a different atmosphere. The room was spacious and the Grand Club Lounge staff was very friendly. Only one thing that bothered my stay, and that was the TV signal. The signal was on and off.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but check in process is disgusting”
Reviews.Author: VivDelhi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Grand Hyatt a couple of weeks ago for three nights. I travel quite frequently to Singapore but this was my first time at the hotel. What really disgusted me was their really painful check in process. Somehow the check-in staff took almost 10 minutes per pax for check in, which is shoddy by any standards. Having waited for more than 20 minutes, I finally got my turn. Having completed check-in, I was left all to myself to find my lift (least expected in a 5-star hotel). What made things worse was that they have apparently added some rooms to the hotel recently, but with different access points. So I spotted a lift and landed up on 6th floor looking for room 660 while the floor plan showed room nos. only up to 645 or so. After taking a round of the complete floor and also feeling disgusted, I called up reception and they told me I had taken the wrong lift! Apparently my lift was located in some obscure corner of the hotel and there was no one to guide me there. There weren't even any directions to help a first-timer to the hotel. Finally, I came to the reception and blasted the staff for not letting me know about the lift. They started apologizing and one of the staff members at the check-in counter left his seat in a flash to guide me to my room, much to the anguish of the person who was being checked in at that point of time. Rooms though small, are decent, beds are comfortable. But view of the room I got was really bad as my room window was pointed towards a street and residential apartment. The area surrounding the hotel is definitely good, and is well suited for those looking for some quality shopping and cool nightlife in the Orchard road area. But overall, if you are looking for pure pleasure and want to get yourself pampered during your stay, there are much better options available in Singapore compared to the Grand Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “On the Shopping Street”
Reviews.Author: Mitwaa
Reviews.Content: Grand Hyatt is near the Orchard Road which is the shopping street. The Hotel is very good for luxury stay and has lot of promotional schemes. Frequent visitors can benifit out of the this and can get free night stays. Recomended for Business Travellers

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: abhy
Reviews.Content: My review will be biased because we got upgraded to a junior suite - so our value that we received was far more than what we paid for. What i liked 1) The breakfast - i"m not a fan of huge breakfasts - Im ok with lesser variety but all of it can be high quality - however the variety and the quality at the GH was very high. We were a family of 4 with friends and breakfast was a leisurely affair where 8 individuals(including kids) had choices of what we could eat and because of the variety in offer we could relax on the breakfast table and move onto our next dish that we selected. Truly - the kind of breakfast you want when you"re on holiday. 2) The Swimming Pool - was very nice - the look and design made us feel that we were on a holiday - we went swimming after dinner at 9:30 pm once and that was just awesome!! 3) The Location - if you're going to be on orchard road and look forward to hitting the malls then down you go and there you are right next to them. What I didn't like The rooms - were maybe a little dated as the decor and the upkeep looked like the rooms were a little older - maybe renovated 4 - 5 years ago - nothing bad as such but gave the feel of an older room. What I loved - was the personalized service and the great training of the staff at the GH - all the staff were a pleasure to interact with and they were very outgoing and made us feel welcome all the time. This shows the great effort the GH puts in training of its people and I think its necessary to recognise the same as its not an accident but a lot of hard work!! We really enjoyed our stay and I'm happy to become a member of the Gold Passport programme and look forward to staying at a GH next time im travelling. GH - may your tribe increase!!

Reviews.Title: “well located hotel near orchard road”
Reviews.Author: makMumbai
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in may while visiting Singapore for shopping with friends. Just off orchard road the hub of shopping namely takashimaya ,wisma atria and paragon departmental stores.perfect location. stayed in a junior suite(called grand deluxe room),paid 350 USD per night.Room was a bit old but spacious,not what i would call luxurious.Personally not worth the price as there are better deals in the same area.meals ordered specially italian was good but breakfast was not good.Pool is quiet small,gym is just about ok.However instructor was very helpful.Spa was shut for renovation.Staff spoke excellent english and were polite and very competent.Hotel has a nightclub which is a pick up joint and unsuitable for couples.We ate at the food courts as well as restaurants in the malls and partied at Clark quay and marina area.Shopping was excellent though the singapore sale had not started as yet.We took the duck tour and singapore flyer tour as well as went to wet wet wild water park.All ok,basically singapore is best for shopping.Nightlife is excellent at clark quay.weather was a bit warm.This was my 4th trip,location wise orchard area is the place to stay however i might stay in an apartment next time to get more space at a cheaper cost.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: GarryNg
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Grand Hyatt Singapore on several occasions and am always impressed. The hotel is fantastic, the restaurants are very good and the location is perfect. Staff are always friendly and helpful and the rooms are large and stylish. I have never had a bad experience of any sort and would thoroughly recommend this hotel. The hotel is also perfectly located for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely stunning”
Reviews.Author: tieuphuongle
Reviews.Content: We were in Singapore for a family leisure trip. Our stay at GHS was truly amazing. I was especially impressed by Mr. Yasrid Bin Mohamed upon check-in. He was very helpful and efficient. The Deluxe Room is well-appointed with beautiful design. The pool is trendy with the new look. The hotel locates on the Orchard Road which is so convenient. All the offices, malls and entertainment areas are within walking distance. Great hotel! Anyway I am coming back to GHS end of June 09. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant City Hotel with plenty for holiday makers”
Reviews.Author: gilbertenstein
Reviews.Content: I had a stay recently at the Hyatt in Singapore and loved it. They have renovated the pool and pool side BBQ which was a wonderful oasis from the city outside. And the best part is that the busiest part of the city and shopping is literally just outside. The location is brilliant for business and tourists alike. I also tried their new gym and spa and was truly surprised by this new part of the hotel too. Its not a cheap massage place, this is a serious spa location that ranks up with all the best in Singapore and some of the best in Asia (esp for city and hotel spas). And the gym was about the best hotel gym I have every used - and I have used plenty of them Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location with good service”
Reviews.Author: Speedy20
Reviews.Content: The service at Grand Hyatt is incredible & I paid S$300/night for a grand room which is very spacious and well equiped. As i am a gold passport member, I am able to access the club lounge for for business meetings. The ambience and setting is just right for meeting over a drink. The restaurant (Straits Kitchen) serve excellent local food & I enjoyed the food very much especially the satay and chicken rice. Overall I would say this is probably the best business hotel I have ever stayed & the location is along Orchard Road which is the key shopping belt in Singapore. I will recommend my friends to stay in this hotel for their trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to Match”
Reviews.Author: Getabreak
Reviews.Content: One of the best run hotels in the world and difficult to fault. Great position and great food. But Singapore is expensive, the night club downstairs full of intimidating ladies so not relaxing for a drink and the air con in the rooms often feels clammy/damp. Executive floor is worth the extra for great breakfast and snacks. I would not stay anywhere else in Singapore if visiting on business.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Business Experience”
Reviews.Author: NinuMumbai
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a Business Visit in their Suit. The rooms are very spacious, very high speed internet, extremely courteous staff, amazing buffet breakfast. The washroom is very big too with separate shower and bath tub areas. Although it was expensive, but it is worth stating here. Located next to Orchard road, all major shopping centres are walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: timbie8
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four days before our trip to Australia. Loved the service, front desk and concierge really helpful as were staff in bars and restaurants. Did not book breakfast but ate around the pool where they cooked light breakfast and lunches. Pool was really tranquil, very luxurious and hardly ever busy. The location is very convenient to Orchard road shopping. We walked to botanical gardens which were lovely but because of heat and humidity it is easier to get around in taxis. The taxis were plentiful and cheap (everything else in Singapore was quite expensive).

Reviews.Title: “A 5 star Grand Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: PC2
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Marriott on corner of the Orchard and Scotts several times but this time we chose the Grand Hyatt as it is newer and the rate was better. I'm glad we did, the hotel appears to be very new with good facilities. It is located about 100m from the Marriot up Scotts road so it is an short walk to Orchard MRT station and to the best people watching bar in Singapore at the Marriot.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hyatt”
Reviews.Author: ksingh_9
Reviews.Content: amazing location very close to orchard road shopping area, the hotel rooms are very clean and modern look they are all equiped with latest tv and audio from bang and olufsen, the rooms are very spaces specially the grand deluxe rooms they are like suites, the club level lounge is also very good, good service and clean hotel

Reviews.Title: “loved to omlets”
Reviews.Author: suri1111
Reviews.Content: it was the best omlets i ever had rooms were amazing and view , location was amazing its the best place to stay in singapore.

Reviews.Title: “u never forget this”
Reviews.Author: rajaAssam
Reviews.Content: the hytt , u never forget once u will in. the staff,the facility,the enviroement,food everything with a beautiful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: suitdude30
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Hyatt Singapore for 4 nights in the all-suite Grand Wing, on the Club floor. The Grand rooms are 55 square metre suites, but despite a refurbishment 3-4 years ago, the accommodation looks tired. Carpets looked and felt dirty, and the the much-touted Bang & Olufsen televisions produced poor sound. The Grand rooms are good value for the amount of space you get, but they do not feel luxurious or cosy, in my humble opinion. Hanging space is quite limited. Toiletries need to be of a higher quality and at least of L'Occitane or Molton Brown standard - this is a Grand Hyatt after all, and the shampoo and conditioner smelt and felt like dishwashing detergent. Biggest disappointment of all was the Club lounge on the 20th floor, whose breakfast spread was the poorest I had ever seen at any Hyatt or chain-hotel's Club/Exec floor. When I brought this to the manager's attention, he admitted that space constraints prevented them from putting out a larger spread, but I suspect it's cost-related. There was plenty of space in the lounge where additional platters or chafing dishes could have been installed. Loved the new Damai Spa - amazing treatment rooms, designed around Japanese Zen gardens and bubbling streams. It was so tranquil that I fell asleep, helped by the hands of my massage therapist. The gym was pretty well equipped too. Pool area nice and tropical, but felt very exposed, being surrounded by buildings on all sides. I felt so vulnerable in my bathing shorts! For the prices charged by the Grand Hyatt, I'd look elsewhere. Unless you absolutely insist on staying in the Orchard/Scotts Road area, there are far better hotels in Marina Square (the Pan Pacific) and Raffles City (the Swissotel Stamford).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Gerat New Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: JamesVki
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for one night and was really pleasantly surprised with how nice their new rooms are. Really really great rooms, nice big LCD tv's, DVD player, great chair and really great work desk. The beds in the room were really nice and with nice big feather pillows! very comfortable rooms. The Bathrooms were very nice but one pet hate with Hyatt's is their "own brand" crappy body products that they use, I really do wish they would put something decent in their rooms!. The location of the hotel is just off Orchard Road which is fine, my preference when in Singapore is the Marina area as its closer to my business commitments and I just like the area better. The only downside to this hotel is that every thing is very expensive, like the charge to use the internet $50, what a joke where do these hotels get off charging this for only 24hours so we can check a few emails!. The other thing is when I checked out at around 545am I had to struggle to the front door and flag my own taxi down, no help offered by any of the staff behind the desk!. All in all I think this hotel is very nice and if you want to be around Orchard Rd then its in a great location, but really for the price they are charging ($350+) you can do a lot better in Singapore, one big thing is this hotel does not have any views of Singapore from your room!

Reviews.Title: “luxury in a great location”
Reviews.Author: lilbopeep
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel on our round the world month long trip, we arrived without a suitcase that got lost ast heathrow terminal 5! but when we advised the hotel, they said it was no problem and kept us updated to when it would arrive via voicemail and letter to the door and when the suitcase arrived it was delivered into the room with no issues, great service. The room was a really nice suite, a seating area with a lcd tv with loads of channels, an office area, a large bedroom with a massive bed, and a fab bathroom with a full size bath with hand shower (great for a quick hair wash) over shower and also a seperate shower cubical - 3 showers! The toilet was also in a seperate room in the bathroom and the toiletries that were supplied included the usual shampoo etc, but also a razor, comb, vanity kit, etc, all great stuff, especially when you have a missing suitcase. The hotel was centrally located on scotts road right next to orchard road, right in the middle of all the shopping and just next to the train/subway system, perfect, even the night safari bus stopped outside the hotel. The leisure areas - pool, gym and spa are amazing. its all brand new so very shiny and impressive right now, but the gym is very well equipped with all the usual gear but all the treadmills, bikes etc have satelite tv touchscreens on, really cool. you also get personal service if you need it and a large towel and bottle of water on entry, all free of course. The pool looks stunning, the sunbeds, which there are loads and its always empty, have great quality beds ready with towels laid out and even tables next to them but call buttons on for when you would like water or food and drink. To be honest, even the toilets are impressive with a spa bath in! We also requested a late check out which was agreed for free and without any grumbles, and they store luggage safely for when your ready. To be honest its difficult to find anything negative about this place, there was some construction next door, but they start at 9am and we were on a floor that didnt hear any noise. I would return to this hotel next time, yes its a bit more pricey than some others, but for me, was worth every penny

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, even better location.”
Reviews.Author: mlasser
Reviews.Content: Sparkling Hyatt with great facilities. Cuban cigar store in the lobby. Straits Kitchen has been featured on Anthony Bourdain's No Reservations on the Travel Channel. Right in the middle of the Orchard Road Shopping district and across the street from the subway. Walking distance to the Botanical Gardens. A few stops or a medium walk to the Colonial Center of Singapore including the Raffles Hotel. Rooms were updated and had the amenities you find in good Asian hotels that are usually missing from US Hyatt's. Big flat panel TV's. Nice pool. Great place to base a visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very good food outlets but the rooms interior needs work....”
Reviews.Author: dubai976
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel in a great location behind all the shoppings and restaurants on Orchard road.... the service is very good and the hotel restaurants are very good... the only negative thing i think that the rooms interior needs to be upgraded because it feels dull and for the high standards of singapore i think it should be fully refurbished.... overall: Very good hotel in a great location...i would give this hotel 8/10

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & great amenities”
Reviews.Author: bella_oes1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel right in the centre of Singapore city (corner Scotts & Orchard Road) so you can walk to all the shops or public transport. You are also only a 5-8 min cab ride from Clarke Quay which has some great restaurants/nightspots. The hotel is set up like a typical Hyatt - catering to the mass tourist market, with a particular focus on business travellers. But it does this very well. The service is always good, rooms clean and well maintained (albeit the decor is a little generic and uninspiring). The room sizes (including Club Exec) are excellent and I have also stayed intheir smallest Suite which is ridiculously big, so whichever room you select, you will never have an issue with size. The hotel gym is absolutely fantastic. There are issues with internet connection in the room at times (I have had others in the group within which I was travelling say the same thing).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fabulous Spa!”
Reviews.Author: Suitdude32
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Grand Hyatt Singapore Nov 6-12. Liked: 1. The newly-built Damai Spa with serene treatment rooms, each with granite-floored/walled ensuite bathrooms, and surrounded by a bubbling stream and overlooking Japanese-style gardens. 2. Room ready for my early morning arrival 3. Helpful, courteous and professional staff all round 4. Spacious Grand Deluxe rooms in the Grand Wing; the standard rooms are situated in the adjacent Terrace Wing, expect to pay S$80-$100 more per night for Grand Wing accommodation, whose rooms are actually suites of approximately 600 square feet. 5. Central location, within 10 minutes walk of all major shopping and transportation, dining of Scotts and Orchard Roads. Orchard MRT station (underground train system) is less than 5 minutes walk. 6. Well-equipped gym Disliked: 1. Bathroom toiletries which felt and smelt like dishwashing detergent - certainly not becoming of a 5-star Hyatt 2. Very limited breakfast spread in the Club lounge, which is strictly continental, and a far cry from the expansive offerings of sister Hyatt properties, particularly those in Asia, and certainly far short of the Club/Executive lounge breakfast buffets at Mandarin Oriental and Ritz-Carlton and Shangri-la properties. 3. Shabby stained carpet in both rooms in which I stayed (see point 5 below) 4. Poor sound from the TV, which was esp. surprising given that it was a Bang & Olufsen unit. 5. Construction noise from adjacent building site (the Ascott Apartments and Scotts Plaza have been demolished to make way for a new high-end residential tower) - I requested, and was given, an alternative room facing the far quieter hotel gardens and pool. Beware! Noisy room was 1305. I do not believe that it is worth paying extra for the Club floor, given the lousy breakfast spread. Far better to go buy yourself some breakfast provisions from the nearby food courts or supermarkets on Orchard Road. Afternoon tea and evening drinks were also very limited. Ate dinner at Straits Kitchen on one occasion, and its actually high-end hawker food at high-end prices. You need to be pretty darn hungry to do the buffet justice. Would prefer to visit a food court and eat all that I want and only spend a fraction of the bSK buffet price. Overall, I highly recommend the Grand Hyatt, mainly for its location and its design.

Reviews.Title: “Caveat Emptor”
Reviews.Author: jd11Denver_CO
Reviews.Content: I won't bore you with the restaurant and room descriptions; Suffice to say it is a swanky place overall, and the staff, to a person, are friendly and courteous. But be aware of one caveat: After arriving late at night, and settling in to our non-smoking room, on a non-smoking floor, I was awakened to a great deal of noise from the room next door. Stepping into the hall, I noted a sign for a "Son's 21st birthday party" on the room door, with people coming and going, and cigarette smoke billowing from the room, along with numerous cigarette butts on the floor. Taking a trip downstairs to bring this to the attention of the night manager, I was assured that they would "do something if it got out of hand" and it was really "just a small family event". Three hours later, around 3 AM, they must have finally gotten around to doing something about it, as the noise subsided, and the "family", (remarkable in having so many young girls with a nearly identical preference for skimpy clothing, high heels and excess make-up), finally stopped their traffic in and out of the hotel room. Later conversations with workers in the hotel yielded the real data: it is not at all uncommon for the hotel to allow parties in rooms designated for sleeping, even if the room winds up trashed. Apparently, money talks. Since I don't know the specifics of the franchise business model for the Hyatt in Singapore, I can't say whom the fault for the questionable policy of allowing parties in hotel rooms next to those used for sleeping lies with: the hotel manager, the franchise owner, or the Hyatt company themselves. But I do know if you are expecting a quiet nights sleep, or a relatively smoke free room in this hotel, buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: kthongkong
Reviews.Content: My previous stay at the Grand Hyatt Singapore was very good and based on this I decided to stay again during my last business trip. Surprisingly I was disappointed. Check in was slow, to their credit they were quite busy, but when it came to my turn a woman who had not been waiting rushed up to the desk and was helped first. Not a big deal but after being made to wait I felt it could have been handled better.
