Once I got my room key I was really surprised by the size of the room, I now think I must have been upgraded during my last stay because there was no comparison in room size. While efficient and clean the room was very small, and the bathroom even smaller. There was only a shower, the toilet crammed between that and the tiny sink. This is compared with my last stay where the room was very spacious. Overall the rooms are kept very clean but are showing their age and need to be refreshed. The rate paid was certainly not worth the room when there are so many other options in Singapore. We ate at the Straights Kitchen the first night which is a unique take on the standard hotel buffet. I'm not a buffet person but the various areas all featuring a different Singaporean cuisine (Malay, Chinese, Indeian etc) was very well done. The hotel bar was also very pleasant and the service was great. The hotel also has a night club in the basement that seemed to be a prime pick up spot and prositute hang out, we left after seeing it. We saw quite a few guests taking women up to their rooms which was not really meshing with the image of a 5 star hotel. All in all not a terrible stay, but it could be so much better. In future I'll be looking for other options before staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cokerbud
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in an excellent location. Walking distance to the MRT and to the best shopping in Singapore. Also within walking distance of The HardRock Cafe and Orchard Towers.

Reviews.Title: “Qucik Break”
Reviews.Author: afxdes
Reviews.Content: Just a quick break in transit from Tokyo to Melbourne. The hotel is as efficient as is the city in general. Well Positioned with a great breakfast restaurant. Grand King Room on an Executive Floor - well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bo94114
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in a Grand King room. Early check in was granted and was appreciated. Bellmen, check in was great. Bags delivered quickly. Room was large, big bathroom, very comfy bed. There is some construction going on between the hotel and the Marriott and the noise was noticeable at times but not disruptive. Good safe and desk. Restaurants were good; location was great for shopping at Tang’s and DFS. Pool was going through a refurb but was not here long enough to fret over it. Granted my request to delay check out and quick check out. This hotel met all my needs and then some.

Reviews.Title: “Great services, location, rooms, food all in one hotel”
Reviews.Author: gggggggggggggg
Reviews.Content: i have stayed in this hotel many times for the last two years. it was one visit that kept me coming back again. i stayed in the ritz carlton and the shangri-la but the Grand Hyatt gave me that diferent feel i was looking for. its the feel of belonging and easyness. itst hat simple relaxtion with a bustling life next to you if wish to change. like singapore it gives that sofisticated and ultra modern life with a simple asian twist. the hotel is great from all aspect and close to the heart of this great city Orchard rd. renovation have taken this hotel to the next level and some noise was noticed in the allowed timing (9am-6pm) but hey isint this for the best services to us. staf are really great in this hotel and rromes are large and clean. beds are very comfy while toilets are very larg and smartly designed. best rooms are the grand room. elegant and uncrowded lounge. nice resturant but next to you great choices out ther. try the Tetarek (singapore tea with milk speciality) at the strait kichen returant ground floor it probably one of the best you could tast in singapore. just injoy this hotes and it services in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Junglejuice30
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! We booked a Grand King room and were not supposed to be able to check in until 2pm. However, as our flight from the UK arrived in Singapore at 6.45am we decided to leave our luggage at the hotel and wander down Orchard Road until we could check in. On our arrival at the hotel, the Receptionist obviously took pity on us (we did look shattered and had a three year old with us) and not only checked us in straight away but also upgraded our room to a Junior Suite free of charge!! The room was fantastic, every amenity you could wish for and then some. The staff were wonderful and were on hand to help us with anything we needed. The location could not have been better - about 2 minute walk from Orchard Road. The only downside was the view of a building site from our room - however, as we had our crane mad three year old with us, it kept him entertained! He spent ages looking out of the window and giving us a running commentary on what the diggers were up to! All in all, a brilliant hotel and if we ever go back to Sinapore (which I hope we will), we will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new club longe and rooms”
Reviews.Author: splatnz
Reviews.Content: Having seen the recent reviews we were a little hesitant to book here but we use Hyatt Passport so went with it. We requested a newly renovated club room so review is based on this. Likes - Good size room - Great decor in the Club Lounge (with free WiFi) - Location - StraitsKitchen! Dislikes - Maintenance issues in the bathroom (door handles and plug both broken) nb they were quickly repaired - Limited food range for breakfast and cocktail hour in the Club Lounge; especially when compared with other Hyatt's (eg Taipei) Overall - A pricey hotel, if you get a new room then is probably worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be refreshed.”
Reviews.Author: sjcsfooak
Reviews.Content: I stayed here mainly for the location, which is great. Near shopping and subway. However, for an expensive 5 star property, my room (on the exec floors) was shabby. It was well kept, but its age showed. The toilet did not flush properly. I could hear neighbors on either side of me. That room was certainly due for a renovation. I did have a great dinner at the mezza9 restaurant. Great selection of Western and Asian dishes from one menu.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ghtraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is large and it appears suited to the business traveller. We booked a Grand Club room and this included breakfast and evening drinks. This was very good value and the Club Lounge has a nice ambience. The staff here were quite friendly. The breakfast was continental and exactly the same each morning. There was also a service desk so accounts could be settled in peacful surroundings. Internet access was free in the club lounge so checking emails was easy. Our room overlooked Scotts Road. It was very spacious as we had a bedroom, bathroom and a spacious lounge with a nice area for working. The furnishings in the lounge were begining to look tired and the carpet required cleaning. The room was serviced twice daily which was nice. The bathroom had two showers the hand held and the rain shower which was lovley. Also great mirrors. I am never sure who uses the bathroom scales but I guess it is a nice touch if you are weight consious. The toilet was seperate so that was good. Two Tv"s and 49 channels if you can't find anything better to do. This hotel had the best security I have ever experienced in a hotel. No chance here of intruders getting near your room. The Oasis by the pool was a good place to have lunch and a drink . The gardens around the Oasis were quite beautiful and it difficult to imagine that I was still in Singapore. Mezza9 gets rave reviews and whilst the food is excellent the service and atmostphere were lacking. it was like eating in a giant cafeteria. However it was very popular so I guess it is all a matter of taste. Scotts Bar was lovley for an evening drink. Brix the nightclub was also OK . I visit Singapore regularly and I usually stay at the Marina or City Hall district. I must say I prefer this area to Scotts Road which is too frenetic for me. I also prefer the Ritz Carlton becuase of their more personal service and rooms to die for. However if you are a shopper two minutes from the door of the Hyatt is Tangs and the rest of Orchard road. It is also in a great location for the MRT.

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel”
Reviews.Author: takincare-of-busines
Reviews.Content: Their are a lot of great hotels in singapore but this is one of the best...great size rooms, in house massage is excellent as well

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: UKUK-Traveller
Reviews.Content: What a fab hotel this was, with its grand entrance, excellent staff, spacious suites and great restaurants. Just a perfect location within the city of Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: itsbart
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived untill the moment we left, this hotel is just a dream. Great staff welcoming you on arrival, quick check in with a lovely smile. We booked a Grand King room and got great value for our money. Heavenly bed, spacious bathroom and great ameneties. Location is also great for all kind of travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LynchLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Grand Hyatt on the way back from Sydney. We had booked our accomodation 6 months in advance and on checking in we were placed adjacent to a building site. The property next door to the hotel is being developed (as it most buildings in Singapore) so make sure you stress to the hotel you would prefer a garden view! However, the hotel staff were polite and did upgrade us to a lovely room. They could not have been more helpful, especially when my child became ill and we had to change our flights. I would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful business hotel -- great experience”
Reviews.Author: S3CR3T3X3C
Reviews.Content: The Singapore Grand Hyatt is wonderful. It's an oasis of calm in the middle of it all (Scotts Road). I loved the renovated rooms, the super comfortable bed, the immaculate and beautiful showers, the sumptuous breakfast and many, many other things. It's a hotel I'd find a way to stay at if I were you. Hyatt should be proud to have this wonderful hotel in its family. The only small issue I would have is that the service is not all that warm, especially if you compare to Bangkok but compared to 98% of the rest of the world, it rocks.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall hotel - maybe lacking a bit of soul.”
Reviews.Author: pommie01
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt that this is a good hotel. In a good location just off Orchard Road. Paid $S380 for one night and $S400 for the next. Nice big modern comfortable room with king bed, and a great huge bathroom. LCD widescreen tv on the wall with lots and lots of channels. Nice touch was that the wardrobe had too doors one in the main living area, and one in the bathroom. Made it easy to get to stuff from both sides. Very well though out. There are plenty of well labelled connections on the desktop that allo you to connect video sources, ethernet, fax etc. Very well thought through. The internet connection was very fasy, a cheapish, but no working iPass. I needed to stay later, and they extended my stay until 2pm (from the regular check-out time of 12 noon) - no problem. And then I camped in the free desks in the business centre in the lobby, and worked from there for a few hours until my flight. Really not much to complain about - it's really quite good - just lacking a bit of edge or soul - it's another bland 4/5* hotel - and if that's what you want that's fine. I would stay there again however, as it really is a great location and is very comfortable. Brix bar in the basement is "interesting" and quite expensive - but has good bands.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: mbgandco
Reviews.Content: Staed in a Grand Duplex Suite which is on 2 floors. The room itself was very good with an excellent bathroon with seperate shower and downstairs kitchen and guest wc. The room also gives access to the lounge with complimentary wi fi, continental breakfast and snacks between 6 - 8pm. One gripe is that the lounge charges for a third person. The location is by the junction of Scotts Road and Orchard Road and very close to an MRT station. It is great for tourists but a taxi ride away from the business district. Within walking distance is the Newton Circus Food Centre one of the more famous hawker centres which is well worth trying out before going to some of the less touristy ones. The hotel is very comfortable and there is nothing wrong with it but it does lack a little spark that you find in the best hotels in Asia.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: schnoopzmq
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Grand Hyatt for 4 days in Dec 2007. I received warm service and friendly help from the staff. The room is very clean because the housekeeping come by twice a day! (I didn't know this until the 3rd day when i didn't have to work at the office and came back afternoon to find that they are cleaning again, knowing they already did once in the morning). I absolutely loved the king sized bed where I enjoyed my glorious sleep every night. It is conducive to work by the window as there's natural lights but they do charge about $25SGD per 24 hours of internet use. Ordered my first meal with the room service , Burger and Fries ($32SGD) and it was lovely except the beef appeared to be overcooked on one side. The hotel's location is just nice, off the main Orchard Road and very accessible to all the major shopping malls (Takashimaya, Paragon, etc) as these are only a short walk away. Straits Kitchen offered a good selection of buffet breakfast, but it's almost the same everyday. I like the coffee tho :) Oh and the lovely bathtub, it's just the perfect thing to do at the end of a tiring day of work(and shopping) ! By the way, Orchard Road in December is at its busiest and most beautiful. You gotta enjoy this hotel. Seriously.

Reviews.Title: “One of the top business hotels in the world...”
Reviews.Author: ChaunceyGardiner
Reviews.Content: Had two nights here in late November, third stay in the last three years at this property, and it remains one of my favorite places in Singapore, and one of my top business hotels in the world. Check-in is always crisp, even at 1am. I’ve stayed in both the Grand Wing and the Terraces Wing. Grand Wing is all two-room (living room/bedroom) Grand Rooms, which are similar to the Dusit Thani in Bangkok, except very, very clean/modern. Lot of blonde wood and stainless steel. This trip was in Terraces Wing, which is regular single rooms. The room has a large wall-mounted LG flatscreen (I think the Grand Wing rooms are Bang & Olufsen). Bed is in the new Hyatt bedding, which is really nice. Hardwood floors with carpet, marble in the desk area by the window and the bathroom. Desk area is spacious, and is tucked in by the window, with a very nice array of power and plugs and stuff, and large desk surface. Bathroom has separate tub/shower, and has generic toiletries. The shower has a large “rain” style showerhead in the ceiling. Very clean. The Club lounge in Terraces Wing is not as large as the one in the Grand Wing, but the folks there were just as friendly, helpful and crisp as over there. This is one place where the Hyatt stands-out… their people are really well-trained. Breakfast has a very broad spread, and eggs can be cooked to order. Evenings they have drinks and light munchies. Concierge services were well executed… I needed help with ground transit in both KL and Bangkok, and they arranged both for me within minutes. Ate at Pete’s Place, an Italian restaurant in the basement; very good, and having an Italian waiter (!) made choosing something different great fun. Have eaten before in Mezza9, and the food was good. Straits Kitchen, their main dining room, is not only an outstanding place compared to other Hyatts, but one of the better places in Singapore. I’ve taken employees and guests here, and it never ceases to impress them. The location here is a 50:50 proposition. The good news is that it sits at the intersection of Scotts and Orchard, in the middle of some of the best shopping anywhere in the world. Marriott next door, Sheraton Towers down the street, Hilton and Hard Rock around the corner. If you’re not here for shopping, though, it is NOT in either of the business districts. It does sit within 200 feet of the Orchard Road MRT station, which is a quick, clean and safe subway shot to either downtown, Raffles City, or Bugis areas. Taxi rank is as good as any in Singapore. Once the new circle line is completed to Suntec, it’ll be helpful. I stay here because it's a terrific hotel, and when downtown/Suntec/Marina hotel rates get outrageous (more and more common), this is a reasonably priced refuge. I would, and have, stayed here on my own money. Another terrific stay here, and I will be looking forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “What one expect of a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: KBLA
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Singapore is a very good business hotel!stayed there a few times and the location is great! Stayed this time at the new renowated wing, the room were good and spacious, however the toilet was old and should have been shifted when remodelling and put so much energy in the renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Zen”
Reviews.Author: Browns77449
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for one week. I was very happy with the accomodations. Here are my thoughts Decor: This has a fung shway look and feel. For those that complained about the seating in the lobby, there are some by the elevators and near the check in desk. It has a minimalist feel when you first enter, but there is more once you enter the heart of the hotel. Elevators: You have to have your key each time you use the elevator. There is a slot that you insert your key in, then press the floor. You can only go to your floor. This keeps people from wandering the floors that are not staying there. (This is singapore where some things are legal that are not in the states) Work out Facilities: Very nice. They do not open until 6:00 am. On the 4th floor. You can't access the 4th floor until then unless you stay on the 4th floor. It is challenging finding it. Ask for directions! Pool: see pics, large towells provided. Restaurant by the pool as well if you wish to eat outside. Breakfast: Outstanding!! If you can afford it, it is worth it. If you request it upon check to be included in the price of your room, you get a $5 discount per day. If you purchase ad hoc, you pay much more. If you are leaving early in the morning, you can order room service in lieu of waiting for Straits to open if you get the breakfast with your room. Room: Excellent. Put your room key in the slot by the lights right when you enter. Push down all the way. This enables the lights. I had 544 and had a view of Scott Street. Taxis: If you leave 7-7:45, there is not a long line for the taxis. By 8:00 the line is long. If you want to shorten your trip back to the hotel, since they have one way streets, you can tell them it is ok to drop you off across the street in front of the Galleria. There is a close walk you can take over Scott street back to the hotel. This cuts off 5-8 minutes when you come from the East side of town. Money Exchange: They do have that at the hotel. There is a place next door in Far East Plaza that gives a better rate. There are numerous place in the shopping areas to change money. We ate at the restaurants in the basement. Served pizza and had a salad bar. Food was good, Drinks were VERY expensive. Salad is nothing like the states, but satisfied the need.

Reviews.Title: “Screwy”
Reviews.Author: ColonelParker
Reviews.Content: The location is great, right near Orchard and a 3 minute walk to the MRT. The remodel is screwy, though. Our first room had a busted tub drain and the closet light wouldn't go out (troublesome given the glass closet door. The room is tricky to walk around too. We were given another room, essentially identical, but the Muslim room, so plus prayer mat and minus booze. It's great they are so accomodating but kind of an odd room to give an Irish guy. Had to prop a bag on the closet door to keep the light out there too. The aggravating part is that it was virtually impossible to reach the front desk. Phone rings and rings, then the operator promises a call back which never comes. Then we go down, and presto, people all over the place (who don't seem THAT busy that they can't at least answer the phone. Screwy.

Reviews.Title: “THere location is not without problems....”
Reviews.Author: Stephen_Lloyd
Reviews.Content: Reading the reviews of the hotel two thingsstood out - location and club lounge. I only rated it as 4 here because those two let it down. I stayed in a Club King - and it is an excellent room. The windows are on the corner but used cleverly to create a working space that's effective. The photo on the web site is exactly how it looks in the flesh. Comfortable and very well equipped, light wood tones. The check is in smooth and the entry to the hotel uses a clever use of glass and lights because for the ground floor resaturant and bar there is virtually no natural light. THe feeling is spacious, chic and very modern. However, whilst the club lounge hasa good range of drinks on tap, breakfast is limited somewhat. More to the point despite being on the higher floors it is darker than some nightclubs. Little natural light and dark wood on the walls makes it feel small. There are better club lounges than this in Asia, including the Plaza and Conrad's in Singapore if that's what you look for. As for location, it depends greatly on what you want. A couple can happily shop in the area and lots of eating places. However, the cross the road from the hotel and walk toward the THai Embassy and the atmosphere changes - Singapore's Orchard towers and strreetwalkers of all genders inhabit that part after dark. It lets the location down. Better here than the Hilton directly facing Orchard Towers though. Of course if that's what you seek it's a perfect location, otherwise leave the hotel and stick to that side of Scotts and you will be ok. Much as though I thought the room was good if choices occur in future I'll be in the City Hall/Marina area rather than here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grand Hyatt Singapore”
Reviews.Author: ZAK12003
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from staying at the Grand Hyatt Singapore. I was there with my wife and one year old baby girl. The location of the hotel was perfect right off of Orchard Rd. It is situated in the center of the shopping district. There are also some good open air bars around this area. The hotel itself has great restaurants. Pete's Place and Mezza 9 both have to be visited at least once. Try the brick oven pizza at Pete's Place and the steak at Mezza 9. The room had a “new” feel to it. We were staying in one of the junior suites which are very spacious and clean. The cleaning staff paid good attention to detail. Also there was direct access to the club lounge where they had complimentary continental breakfast and evening drinks. Internet was complimentary through wi -fi which in my opinion is a big plus. Derek Tan at the concierge desk was extremely helpful. We had a few special requests which he happily did for us. We have never received such great service from a concierge before. He went out of his way to accommodate us. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel with an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: iwishiwasonvacation
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been one of my favorites since the early 1990s. I have always stayed on the Club Floor providing access to the lounge facilities including free internet, breakfast and cocktails. I suggest potential guests at this hotel upgrade to the club floor. Location: The location is excellent as it is at the the Scotts and Orchard crossroad. This is where most of the nicer shops are located. Taxis are abundant, giving you easy access to anywhere in Singapore. Rooms: I cannot say much about the regular rooms, but the grand deluxe rooms which is a Jr Suite is an excellent place to stay if you want extra space or a family tagging along. The bed linen and towels are very plush! Service: The front desk attendants were very polite and helpful. They even called up to check if the room was alright. That is good service! Little things matter a lot. Also, parking is free which is a great plus! Food: Food was good, but there are so many restaurants outside, that I'd suggest you try them rather than the hotel outlets. The lounge breakfast is great, although it is not an American Breakfast. Conclusion: If you are short on time and would like to shop and do business, this is the perfect place to be. If you bring your kids along, upgrade. They'll enjoy the extra facilities. *ahem* Just tell JR to go easy on the free alcohol in the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Expect the best”
Reviews.Author: nekokoneko
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with our accommodations at the Hyatt. We had a regular room but it had all the conveniences we needed for a pleasant 3 night stay. It was roomy and had provisions for businessmen like internet connection.. etc. The bathroom was impressive with its separate shower, bathtub and toilet areas. The hotel is located on Orchard road, so all the shopping malls were close by. It's very easy to get around in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms - Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Deadsy
Reviews.Content: The GH has two towers, and I've had rooms in both of them. In the first tower I had a 3 room (living/bed/bath) at 290S$/night. In the other tower I had a 2 room (bed/bath) at 230S$/night. Both setups are very good - and if your value minded and won't use the living room, by all means save the money. I can't really find fault with the rooms. They are well organized, the ergonomics are good and the showers are great (overhead + normal - and none of this low flow stuff). The hotel location is also very good for pedestrian activities down to Orchard Road and the various attractions there. If you are of a mind you could arrive at Changi airport, catch the MRT to the Orchard MRT station and then walk to the hotel- so long as rolling your bags 300m down the street doesn't bother you. I took my breakfast at the Straits Kitchen on the lobby floor. This offers a bit of everything for most ethnicities- and all of its is good. The buffet was 41S$. All in all - a very good hotel, not overpriced, but not inexpensive. If I was spending my own money I would have stayed at a less expensive place, but if its on the corporate tab by all means go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: nanaanddaddad
Reviews.Content: I had a two night stay in the Hyatt on my way back from Australia. The hotel is just fab, the staff are great and they all seem to be really happy working there. Great comradarie between them. The restaurants are as described and the food is excellent. Met some really friendly staff at the martini bar. I felt I was in complete luxoury.

Reviews.Title: “First class”
Reviews.Author: Denise15
Reviews.Content: I can highly recommend this hotel, the service was second to none. I was travelling with a young child and the staff were extremely helpful. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: cumi
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at The Grand Hyatt between July 27th.-July 29th. We had the Grand Deluxe King room, with a separate living room. Excellent. Room as described, large comfortable king sized bed, 2 TVs and a lovely big bathroom with rain-shower. Especially liked the YOGA on-demand channel on TV . Room came with a yoga mat and I could do yoga anytime in the privacy and comfort of my room. Brilliant idea! I would strongly advise guests to make reservations if they wish to dine at any of the restaurants within the hotel, esp. The Straits Kitchen. We were turned away for lunch as they were fully booked. Not very pleasant if you have 2 little boys (plus my husband!} who were VERY hungry. However, the restaurant staff assured us that we could order room service and it would be no problem. So we did that. It is a wonderful restaurant. Exactly as described by other reviewers. Delicious food. Managed to have lunch there the next day and the buffet spread was AMAZING. Hotel staff were courteous, polite and very friendly. Definately the best hotel I've stayed at. Location-wise, it's great bcos it's right near Orchard Road. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Grand, but impersonal”
Reviews.Author: sxa93
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt would seem to have a lot going for it. It has a great location (minutes away from the wonderful shopping district on Orchard road), excellent facilities, great rooms... So whats missing? The personal touch. While the staff is professional enough, the whole experience seemd to lack the warmth one has come to expect from good hotel chains. Sure, your work gets done, in much the same way as a robot would do it! But let me not take away the pluses. The location is fantastic. The premises are clean and well decorated. The breakfast at Straitskitchen is quite a spread. Sure its repititive, but the spread can make up for that. The metro station is a stone's throw away, and taxis are easy to come by. All in all, an above average hotel. But still needs some warmth to make it to the top rung.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Nana2804
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Grand Hyatt during the Indonesian school break and my family had a thoroughly enjoyable stay. It was truly grand and the rooms that we had was a junior suite in the front building. The room was spacious and the connecting room was sufficient for the kids. What I like about the hotel is that they do not discriminate the fact that I had kids with me, like some hotels do. My only complaint , well it started as a complaint, was the Straitskitchen was full during one of the nights. I had heard so much about it and wanted to try. The manager on duty on hearing that I was checking-out the next day went through great lengths to rearrange the seatings so that my family can try the restaurant! Straitskitchen did not dissappoint, great design and concept. I love the noodle and Indian section. Truly recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: alok
Reviews.Content: great location,yummy breakfast.good sized room,my daughter loved the plasma!didn;t try the restaurants but they seemed to be really popular'will definetly return!

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Not So Grand”
Reviews.Author: silver 57
Reviews.Content: We booked on the Hyatt website, a grand deluxe suite for a week of relaxation in Singapore. Booking conditions included charging your credit card by 2pm. I advised the hotel of our late arrival. However, when we arrived the only suite they had left was on the 6th floor overlooking a building site and were warned of the noise. For $S510+++ per night! We were offered a club room at the same rate but declined and after 45 minutes were shown to a grand suite. The suite was slightly shabby, overlooking Orchard Rd with two bathrooms, living room, kitchenette etc and LIGHTFITTINGS HANGING FROM WIRES DANGLING FROM THE CEILING. By this stage it was 3am so we unpacked for the night with the knowledge that the next day we were to transfer to the room type booked. Later that morning we were shown to the room of the type we had chosen and packed our bags. It was just like the pictures on the website. We returned to the hotel later that night to find our room not so cool, but were really tired so I showered and turned back the sheets to find them soiled !My husband screamed from the shower as he couldn't regulate the temperature. I called the duty manager and demanded he came to our room with maintenance and housekeeping. We waited an hour for the faults to be rectified and received many appologies. However it was our second room and our second night of disrupted sleep in the hotel. We asked to see the general manager in the morning. We saw a senior manager who was also very appologetic, offered us various incentives to stay, credited our bill for one night's accomodation and provided a hotel car to transfer us to the Shangri La [the hotel we booked that morning which was subline]. I was not willing to pack AGAIN and try a third night in a third room at the Hyatt. At the price we expected better. Why wasn't our room allocated if it was guarranteed by our credit card? Why was the hotel in such disrepair?

Reviews.Title: “Great with caveats”
Reviews.Author: rboarman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are on day four of a six day stay here at the Grand Hyatt. Over-all I agree with all the reviews so far. I do have some comments to add however. Room service, while fast, is of very mediocre quality and expensive. The breakfast buffet is very good but has exactly the same items every day. No variation whatsoever. Here are some examples of room service prices. Subtract 35% for USD. Add in about 30% in taxes and fees. Continental breakfast: S$28 (~US$17) American breakfast S$38 Breakfast buffet: S$35 ($48 with taxes and fees) Hamburger: & fries: S$25 (tasted good but was VERY undercooked, basically raw even though I asked for well done) Ham and cheese ciabiatta: S$22 (terrible sandwich, avoid) Australian rib-eye steak: S$98 Tuna filet: S$35 Side dishes: S$11 – S$13 Bowl of penne (no meat): S$27 Soda (can): S$8 We had some laundry done. The prices are about S$12 per item. Our five items cost $60. Dry cleaning runs from S$12 to S$25 a piece. If they pick up by 10:00 am they have it back by 6:00 the same day. Add 50% for rush items. The pillows are hard and thick. If this is an issue for you, they say they have additional pillows of different types available. The internet connection is fairly fast but somewhat unstable. It costs S$25 a day. When you check in be sure to ask for a room away from the construction next door which is VERY noisy. The work starts early in the morning and runs into early evening. The location is awesome but you pay a price. Literally. Everything is expensive. For example, lunch that cost us S$60 would cost S$12 not six blocks away from the Orchard area. Over all we love the area and the hotel is great as long as you can afford the exorbitant markup on everything.

Reviews.Title: “No Tipping??”
Reviews.Author: psifactor
Reviews.Content: We stay 4 nights at this hotel, and everything is a 5 star except tipping issue. We've read several times that tipping anywhere is discouraged in Singapore, and that's what we did. First incident when we arrived with just 1 luggage, and the porter deliver it to us, he gave me the confused look while looking at my empty hand. Second incident when the giant dark skin porter with long coat put our luggage to the taxi as we're leaving, he looked really pissed not getting any tip and slam the trunk with a fist. Hyatt will be a 5 star experience if not for these 2 untrained unprofessional porters.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at the Grand Hyatt!!!!”
Reviews.Author: johnivan521
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for three nights in April/May. This is the best Hyatt I have stayed in bar none (I stay in about five Hyatts at year). The location is excellent on Scotts Road, just off the main shopping road, Orchard Road. Also, the MRT (Singapore's train system) is only a two minute walk from the hotel (on the corner of Orchard and Scotts). Check-In: Super-efficient and the staff was extremely professional and courteous the whole time. Even though I arrived at the hotel at 1030, my room was ready. Room: I booked the Grand Delxue room and was elated. The room is similar to an executive suite with its size, large work desk, and upgraded amenitites. The room was also very clean and well-stocked. I especially appreciated that the bathroom had the rainshower head. The only thing that I did not like were the two Bang & Olfusen TVs (one in the living room and one in the bedroom); I could not understand how to turn the TV in the living room off from the confusing remote control. Other than this minor problem, the room was everything I wanted and more. Restaurants: I had room service the first day I arrived: a hamburger with fries and chocolate cake for dessert. The meal arrived within 30 minutes during lunchtime, it was elegantly prepared, and tasted delicious. Also, my special requests were all honoured. I also ate at Pete's Place (Italian Restaurant) in the basement for lunch. I had the buffet and it also was excellent for 26SGD. The meal included many main courses, appetisers, and dessert. Exercise/Spa: This hotel has a nice exercise facility with personal trainers available. The cardio machines were not the latest Life Fitness equipment with the LCD TVs built-in to the on-board electronics but were the previous generation (still modern and good and had separate LCD TVs). The best part about the facility was the steam room in the men's locker room. The temperature was set high enough for an excellent steam. I find in many of the locker rooms, the steam room's temperature is not set high enough for it to be meaningful. The hotel also has a pool outside the exercise facililty and a mini-pool inside the men's locker area that seems to be nice, but I did not venture in it. Also, there are many spa treatment rooms in the health centre, but again, I did not use the spa services. Everything was clean and in order though. All in all, I enjoyed my stay because the hotel was extremely clean, staff very professional and courteous, and the location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel In Singapore”
Reviews.Author: ilovethebeach86
Reviews.Content: FANTASTIC HOTEL amazing rooms, plasma tv's huge bathroom, massive beds, clean. room service quick effieient and friendly. pool is amazing overall this hotel exceeded all my expectations dont stay anywhere else... ive been to singapore many times and hyatt is my favourite. perfect stay

Reviews.Title: “not grand hyatt at all”
Reviews.Author: enrico-Italia
Reviews.Content: I have stayed for two nights at GH singapore early march in a Club King deluxe room .I checked in quite early in the morning and the first room I got was stinky, placed in a hidden corner overlooking a backyard, noisy (soundprofing does not exist there) as the door was open. So I asked to change room and I got another one a little better located but nothing special at all. Interior is minimalist in a cheap way and remind of some Novotel. Service is something comparable to soundproof, to get something or just to get a reply it takes a long time. Club lounge very small at least in my tower wing , but service there is okay. Breakfast (beware if you take it in in the lobby they charge you in full even if you as club member you are entitled of continental) offers a wide selection but also there staff need more training as they are quick only in bringing you the bill . Scott's bar okay, attentive service .Altogether this structure is old with nothing special , nothing Grand Hyatt .I have been travelling several times to Singapore but this was my worst experience.If you can avoid it ,do it. On the positive side the location,,but that's still too little in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Service, Not Worth it”
Reviews.Author: BENLEE123
Reviews.Content: Had a short stay in Singapore and I booked this hotel. This hotel is pricey but looking at their website, the room looks attractive and location is convenient, right at the centre of Orchard Road. The “Grand Deluxe” room is actually a junior suite with a separate bedroom and living area with sofa. On first look, the room does looks nice, stylish and spacious actually, charming in its own sort of way but a bit too minimalist for my taste. It has a separate sitting area with sofa and a working desk. But on closer inspection, the hotel really cheap out on a lot of things. The sofa is kind of Ikea type, the TV yes it is a Band & Olufsen but it is not flat screen, it is a CRT tube TV, no more than 30” and not even widescreen. There is also no DVD player, no sound system. Bathroom is black marble with rainforest and a deep tub. But the rainforest shower head is very small ( size of a small plate ) and the water pressure is definitely not adequate. Also it is very difficult to control the shower temperature as it can fluctuate from cold to suddenly very hot before it stablised. For a “Grand Deluxe” room and with the rate they charge, the hotel only provide a miserable 2 bottles of no-brand mineral water. Sound-proof is not adequate. I can clearly hear people talking at the corridor outside. Also, there are a lot of strange noises in the hotel room at night, mainly from the aircon and the bathroom ( water flowing underneath in the pipes ). No view from my room, just buildings. The room faced the Far East plaza building. Now to the biggest complain – Service! The service here is really sub-par for 5-star hotel. When my taxi arrived, no bellboy was in sight to pickup my luggage. A hotel staff was standing right next to where my taxi stopped but did nothing. Surely if I came to their hotel by taxi and have luggage in the taxi, then I am their hotel guests! My taxi driver has to literally went into the lobby to call the bellboy to collect my luggage. Even a 3-star hotel has better service. Check-in took 25mins, including 10mins of waiting in a queue and another 15 mins waiting for the checkin staff as she type furiously on the computer trying to locate and assign me a room. Moreover her first form got it wrong and printed another guest name instead. This is really unncessary and unacceptable. They already should have my reservation under confirmed status and I did inform them of my arrival time so they should already be expecting me and have my room ready. After room keys were given, no “thanks for staying with us” or “enjoy your stay”. And of course, no escort to the room. There is also no welcome letter in the room. The concierge is not helpful either. I ask him where can I buy some artwork near the hotel in Orchard Road . He refers me to Tanglin mall, a good 20 mins walk from the hotel at the corner of Orchard Road . Actually it is avaliable within 5 mins walk at Takashimaya and Paragon. The casual answer showed me that he really can’t be bothered. Breakfast is included in my room rate and food generally OK but I definitely won’t pay S$40/= for it because they cheap out by serving local food like chaw kway tiao, nasi padang, rotti platta which can be bought outside for one fraction of the price and properbly of better taste too. Service during breakfast is good though ( the only time when I got good service from this hotel ) and the café staff are much more attentive, at least they greet me! Internet is very expensive at S$25/= ++ a day. Another service hipcup occur during checkout. I waited almost 30mins for the bellboy to come up to collect my luggage. And this is after 3 phone calls to chase and also after I intercept a passing staff along the corridor to help me locate the bellboy. Then after I checkout and paid, they misplaced my luggage and took them another 15 mins to locate them while I wait and wait and wait.This is definitely not worthly of the hotel’s “5-star” status. Overall, for the room quality and the 2-star service, it is way overpriced and poor value for money. I definitely won’t stay there again, at least not at those rates they charged me. If location is crucial, the nearby Marriott will most likely be a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Superb business hotel”
Reviews.Author: dutchkiwi
Reviews.Content: I recently had the opportunity to stay at this great hotel. Opportunity I should say as some-one else offered to pay. As a self employed business man, budget is always a concern, so when the offer came in, I could not refuse. The rate of S$ 530.00 (Euro 265.00) per night is not something I lightly overlook when making accommodation decisions. I must add, this rate gave me access to a Club room overlooking Scotts Road and access to the lounge for breakfast (excellent) free all day coffee and tea and afternoon cocktails and snacks. The location of the Grand Hyatt is equally excellent within reach of all major shopping malls and convenient for business. One evening I dined at Mezzanine, possibly one of the most interesting and unusual restaurants I have been to, with a large variety of food choices and great service. It is in essence a six star food court and an absolute must should you get to stay at this hotel, or if you choose to stay at another hotel, pop in, you will not be disappointed. The guest room I stayed in had a bed room and lounge area with a large bathroom. The lounge boosts a B&O tv set, a good work desk with power adaptors built in and broadband internet access. The latter is expensive and hotels in Asia still need to catch up with the USA on free internet. Not a big ask I would say, if you pay Euro 265.00 for the room, internet could be thrown in. The staff is very good, friendly and helpful. it is also good to see that expat management acknowledge you (Mezzanine manager and the Exec Chef). it makes you feel welcome, even if it is a nod, a smile and a "prego". I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel and should I make enough sales, I will become a regular.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JourneyWife
Reviews.Content: I accompanied my husband on a business trip and thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the hotel. The rooms were clean, spacious and equipped with all the amenities you need. Pillows and beds were comfortable, plenty of TV stations, staff was courteous, restaurants offered flavorful foods and the location was ideal for any type of shopping. Not ideal if you are looking for a spectacular view but it was great for people watching. I would stay at the Grand Hyatt again.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite in Singapore... Regardless of cost!”
Reviews.Author: wacka
Reviews.Content: I am in Singapore frequently and have never stayed at the Hyatt... Until now! What was I waiting for?? Great location, excellent F&B (which I had enjoyed numerous times before) and a new wing with fantastic rooms. Great new design with rain shower, plasma, and great linen. Awesome! The price is great too. I used to stick my nose up at Hyatt properties (except Park Hyatt) and I have to say, this place is among my favorites anywhere. Service outstanding too. I will not stay anywhere else for a while (that is until the newness wears off!) Very happy...

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints Here...One of the best hotels on Orchard”
Reviews.Author: Keslergo
Reviews.Content: I was a bit hesitant in booking the Grand Hyatt becuase people were complainingab out the lines for the taxis and getting mobbed by people going to Orchard. I never actually experienced any of it when I was there. To be very honest I was very happy, being upgraded upon check in to a Grand Deluxe Room and being close to the malls, I could easily drop my bags and rush out again. Actually everything was good...would be the top of my list if ever I visit Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: alan9
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Grand Hyatt a couple of times and each time was fantastic. The ground staff was helpful and friendly, the hotel was clean not to mention its perfect location for shopping ( orchard road ) . Though due to singapore's new law on smoking.. it has become a haven for non smokers. For me it is oxygen and having to stand at the entrance ( corner ) to smoke is a no no. I loved the rooms with their great flat tv and lots of channels to choose from,, also I wont miss my EPL .

Reviews.Title: “Renovated Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Linus6jul
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Grand Hyatt Singapore twice, latest being in March 2006. Lobby area is big and leads to 2 wings. I stayed at wing further in from the main road. The room seems newly renovated and had a flat panel TV. Though the room is oddly shaped with a writing area that juts into something like a "corridor", the room was reasonably big. The "corridor" leads to a floor to ceiling window that overlook some great looking plants. The hotel is also pretty well-located, next to Scotts Shopping Centre and Tangs. Reasonably courteous staff. I wish they could be forthcoming in volunteering information about affiliated point accumulation programs though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BrianChiTown
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! I stayed in Singapore prior to my meetings in Vietnam. The hotel staff was great. The rooms were very nice and spacious. I highly recomend paying for the upgrade to an Executive Suite and adding in the Grand Club. I've been in many hotels over the years, and this hotel had the best concierge floor! The food was great but the service was even better! Great location for prime shopping and entertainment. Bring light clothes as Singapore can get quite hot!

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: pinkapricot
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at another hotel but when that hotel was fully booked, we decided to stay at the Grand Hyatt hotel and that was a decision I certainly do not regret making! The rooms are so comfortable and very modern. There's a huge flat screen tv, a long writing desk, a super comfortable bed and a really nice bathroom. The bathroom has separate cubicles for the toilet and the shower, with a bath tub in the middle. The wardrobe opens both ways so you can get your clothes out from inside the bathroom. The second time I stayed there, my bathroom had a shower instead of a bath tub but I had a lounge and a walk in wardrobe! All this for almost the same price as the hotel we used to stay at! The food at the restaurant downstairs called Straits Kitchen is really good too. It's always packed during lunch and dinner. The restaurant is very well decorated and food is served buffet style at different counters. A great place to try Asian food! 10/10!

Reviews.Title: “excellent but expensive”
Reviews.Author: aputty
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. I stayed in one of the newly refurbished rooms. It was equipped with very modern accessories, like the wall mounted flat screen TV and DVD player. One corner of the room had these floor to ceiling windows angled towards the corner. The workspace area was in this corner, which made it quite inviting, and I imagine would be great to use if you were here on business and had to take work back to your hotel room. In fact, it would have made my old days of working in hotel rooms very pleasant. The bed was huge and the bedside tables had a very user friendly control panel that controlled the lights/TV etc. My favourite thing about the room was the bathroom. The bathtub was huge, and even had a waterproof pillow at the head of the tub to use if you were soaking. The walk in shower had one of those huge ceiling mounted rain shower-heads that were the size of a dinner plate. The toiletries came in a black box. There was a nice vanity table and chair in the bathroom that was separate from the sink area. This was so comfortable to use when putting your make-up on, and ideal if you have numerous cosmetics and toiletries. I was a regular guest at this hotel about 10 years ago, and it has changed so much. The hotel bar is good as well, and has a large variety of interesting cocktails. The restaurant mezza9 looked very inviting, which is why I went. The décor, atmosphere and service was good, but the food just average. It was fun for people watching though. The tables were so closely placed together that you could very easily eavesdrop on the conversation taking place at the tables next to you. The only downside is that the rooms are very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JDERV
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the GH Singapore in August and have to say it was one of the best hotel experiences I've had. Of the many positives, location very near Orchard Road and overall quality/condition of the rooms are the most significant. Orchard Road is a 1/2 block walk from the front door of the GH. There are numerous shops, restaurants, malls all within 5 minutes walking - fantastic location. The rooms appear to have been recently renovated - as the decor is very modern/contemporary with fresh, clean, minimal design and such features as a flat panel plasma tv, wireless internet and plenty of room - large by comparison to other hotels. The fitness center and spa at the GH is also very nice by comparable hotel standards. All equipment is new, clean and would be appropriate for any fitness center. The spa facilities are also very nice with sauna, steam, whirlpool and roomy changing areas. Generally speaking, the service I experienced from the front desk staff upon check-in, to wait staff for room service, to fitness center attendees to my massage therapists was of upmost courteousness and professionalism. The staff really went out of their way to ensure my comfort. The only negatives to mention are the rather long taxi queue in the morning - at the front of the hotel. After a 20 minute wait on my first morning, I learned that hotel guests can "prebook" taxis the previous day - this information would have been nice to know. If you need a morning taxi then best to prebook with the bell staff. The second slightly less negative experience was with the checkout which was longer than usual - maybe 10 minutes due to a shortage of staff at the counter. The positives of my stay so far outweigh the 2 minor negatives that I will definitely stay at the GH Singapore on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica819
Reviews.Content: orchard road is 1 minute from your doorstep! i've been to singapore numerous times for business but i've never stayed at the grand hyatt. i decided to stay there, even though i read a lot of negative comments about it on tripadvisor........ because my favorite restaurant in singapore is mezza 9! it's an open kitchen kind of restaurant and you can see the chef prepare your dish. they have chinese, japanese and western food, an extensive wine list...... the menus are like books. you can eat there everyday for a month and you still won't be able to try every dish on the menu. i read a lot of negative comments about the staff and the size of the rooms. well i booked my flight and hotel package with cathay pacific holidays and we got upgraded to a grand superior room. i was amazed at the size of room! everything was modern and clean. the housekeeping lady took the initiative to line up my sister's 20 something bottles of moisturizers, tonic lotions, make up remover, etc. from smallest to biggest. the front desk and the concierge were equally helpful. my sister even got a "tour" of mezza 9. she went through the different areas, even the martini bar and the VIP rooms. everything was great. the food was great, the shopping was great, the room was great - and i almost forgot to mention - they have B&O flat screen TVs in the living room and in the bedroom!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Much Improved Hotel”
Reviews.Author: l-globetrotter
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location, with Orchard Rd on your door step, the convenience of it all is brilliant. I got upgraded to Club Room (which is like a mini suite), which was spacious and entitled one to partake of happy hour (mix/pour your own drinks and finger food) and rather excellent breakfast at the Club Lounge. Fab views from Club Lounge accompanied by a glass of red at the end of a long working day was heaven indeed. The same can be said about fabulous rooftop gardens on Level 3 leading to the gym. It is particularly spectacular all lit up at night, including the 3 storey waterfalls, so if you are there on a romantic getaway, don't miss out on the opportunity to wonder there at any time, but especially at night. The service at reception/check in-out is ordinary; door men are excellent and show genuine concern for the guests. The service at the Club Lounge was also attentive and excellent, which is more than can be said for the gym. The restaurants downstairs and the one on the mezzanine are very good and service excellent. The biggest complaint I have about this hotel is the gym is opened only till 10pm, with rude staff kicking one out at around 9.40pm. I find it difficult to believe that a 5 star hotel in Singapore, in this location, does not have 24/7 gym, or at least access to one with security pass. No flexibility on the issue does not help. I hope they change this and very soon so they are in line with the rest of the world and the Hyatt chain!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Maximilien
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hyatt for 4 days and I was really surprised to enter my standard room after reading the reviews. The room was large, very modern with many amenities (toothbrush, rasor, computer plug-in, etc...) and a superb flat-screen TV. The pool is not so nice and close to a generator that makes a constant annoying noise. But going back to these beautiful rooms was always a pleasure. It seems that there are two building so I dont know if all rooms are alike.

Reviews.Title: “The Not So Grand Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: ApplesInMyBra
Reviews.Content: Ok, so the loction of this hotel is great - very near Orchard road and MRTs and bus stations. The problem is that the minute you step out the front door, you are jostled and shoved by huge crowds of pedestrians (on their way to Orchard road and the MRT). Immediately you feel engulfed by the city - a bit overwhelming. Sometimes you get pushed along with the masses that you can't get out of the steam to go into the hotel!! The restaurants in the hotel are overpriced completely. For the breakfast buffet at Straits Kitchen they rip you SG$40, but when you go for a second plate of food or more juice (to get value for all that money), you get dirty looks and snide comments from the waitresses/waiters. Wait a minute! I paid for this, I can damn well eat all I want!! Oh no, the serving staff treat you like dirt, and bring you the bill to sign immediately, before you are evven done. Pete's Place is a more casual restaurant downstairs. The ambience and decor tells you it must be authentic italian food. Heck no!! My husband ordered lasagne and it looked and tasted exactly like Dinty Moore's beef stew. It was so disgusting and tasteless, we were pretty miffed at paying SG$36 for that rubbish. The housekeepers at this hotel are very rude. They knock on your door even if you have the "Do not disturb" sign on! One time, the maid knocked on the door and I told her to wait 2 minutes while I gather my stuff so that I can leave while she was cleaning, and she started tapping her foot and snapping her fingers at me!!! (---)! Be sure to get a whole lot of nothing for an exorbitant price if you stay at the Grand Hyatt. Not so Grand in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rustycycle1
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 days in July 2006. Booked a room on the club floor, only to find out on arrival that they don't have a club floor but rather a club lounge. Lounge was on the 15th floor and our room was on the 13th floor. All rooms were the same so there was no benefit in payingan extra $150 a night for a club room which didn't exist. Only extras was a cold buffet breakfast of poor qaulity. Soft drinks and water also free during the day. Rude staff as I was asked to leave a bar because I was wearing dress shorts as was my wife, but she was allowed to stay. I find this discrimination disappointing for a 5 star hotel. Ripped off on checking out when hotel refused to honour my booked room rate which was made by my travel agent. Charged an extra $40 per night. When these matters were raised with the manager he was quite rude in refusing to do anything about the problems. In a city like Singapore where there are so many excellent hotels, my advise is go elsewhere. There is no excuse for poor service and rip offs like I experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT perfect! Far from it!”
Reviews.Author: John999
Reviews.Content: I'll try to make this as neutral and unbiased as possible. We stayed there for three nights. GOOD THINGS ABOUT THE GRAND HYATT SINGAPORE - upgraded our two rooms to Grand Deluxe - very friendly and efficient reception staff - large rooms, good toiletries and towels - very good buffet breakfast selection - with very attentive staff - porterage and concierge service efficient - hotel guests have priority for taxis - the queues can get quite long at peak hours - we were charged for a phone call and minibar consumption that we never made - once this was raised the staff erased the record immediately. how the charges occured is a mystery to me! - the gym & sauna was well equipped and clean BAD THINGS ABOUT THE GRAND HYATT SINGAPORE - our cordless phone didn't work - this was reported on the first day but the phone remained non-functional for all 4 days (and 3 nights) of our trip. it kept on flashing and the buttons didn't work! - the pillow covers had holes .... not on the edges/sides but right in the middle! - the showerhead was cracked and basically non-functional - water was dribbling out .... again this was raised but nothing was done CONCLUSION - definitely not the best hotel we've stayed in - but still quite good considering the price paid and the room upgrade. - the staff are great - it appears that it's the hardware that needs work done (the phone, shower, pillowcases).

Reviews.Title: “GRAND Hyatt?? I don't think so!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A disorganized staff coupled with wonky fixtures in the rooms make this hotel a comical addition to the Hyatt's Grand class. Someone needs to get in there and teach them how to run a hotel of the 5 star calibre.
